Title: Data Scientist II (Remote)
HTML:
Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customisable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures and automated platforms based on data governance best practices. Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organisations to discover, value and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.

With a highly skilled team of over 130 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organisations with their data-driven transformation.

Take a look at our Handbook to discover our core values and processes.

💰RAL: € 38.5K - 48.5K

💼The Opportunity

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist II to join our team: you should have in-depth knowledge of statistics, classical machine learning. Experience with timeseries analysis is required. Familiarity with MLOps practices and collaborative software development workflows is considered a plus.

💻Responsibilities

  • Analyzes business requirements and determines a suitable solution autonomously, evaluating if an ML-based solution is feasible;
  • Good understanding of business requirements;
  • Develops and fine-tunes models through reproducible experiments;
  • Builds ML solutions incorporating software engineering quality standards (SDLC) and data engineering best practices;
  • Participates in the technical design of features with guidance;
  • Understands and optimizes and monitors model performances;
  • Prioritizes tasks with autonomy based on requirements and proper context.

🛠️Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science;
  • Previous experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer (+2years);
  • In-depth knowledge of at least one machine learning framework such as Tensorflow, PyTorch or scikit-learn;
  • Good Knowledge of programming languages including advanced Python patterns;
  • Familiarity with software lifecycle practices (testing, release, deploy) and git-based workflows;
  • Knowledge of MLOps practices;
  • Ability to explain ML results and limitations to tech and non-technical audiences;
  • Good project management skills;
  • Good communication skill;
  • Languages: both Italian and English;
  • Team Player.

🙌🏻We Offer

  • Remote or smart working and work life balance;
  • Training monthly budget;
  • A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level;
  • Benefits and corporate welfare programs: meal vouchers, health fund provided, prizes, welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work;
  • Agile Nomads experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad;
  • The opportunity to attend one conference per year;
  • Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are;
  • Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.

😊How We Work

  • We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team;
  • We don't like bureaucracies; we prefer sense of responsibility;
  • We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable;
  • We want to make a positive change in our industry;
  • Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
Akkodis è un leader globale nel mercato dell'ingegneria e della ricerca e sviluppo che mira ad accelerare l'innovazione e la trasformazione digitale utilizzando la forza dei connected data.

Con la passione per la tecnologia e il talento, il gruppo composto da 50.000 ingegneri ed esperti digitali offre una profonda esperienza intersettoriale in 30 paesi tra Nord America, EMEA e APAC.

Akkodis vanta un’ampia esperienza e un forte know-how in settori tecnologici chiave come la mobilità, i servizi software e tecnologici, la robotica, i test, le simulazioni, la sicurezza dei dati, l'intelligenza artificiale e l'analisi dei dati.




La combinazione di competenze informatiche e ingegneristiche porta a un'offerta unica di soluzioni end-to-end, con quattro linee di servizio - Consulting, Solutions, Talents e Academy - per supportare i clienti nel ripensare ai loro processi di sviluppo prodotto e di business, migliorare la produttività, ridurre al minimo il time-to-market e dare forma a un domani più smart e sostenibile.




Nell’ottica di un potenziamento del nostro team, ricerchiamo una figura di:




Data Scientist Intern




La risorsa, all’interno del team di innovazione, si occuperà della ricerca e dello sviluppo di nuove tecnologie emergenti, per supportare e migliorare le attività degli stakeholder interni ed esterni.




Attività e responsabilità:

Condurre ricerche sulle tecnologie emergenti, in particolare sulle più recenti tecniche di machine e deep learning.
Collaborare con team cross-funzionali per progettare e implementare MVP e POC
Collaborare con fornitori esterni per sviluppare e integrare soluzioni SW e HW
Definire le strategie di scaling delle soluzioni testate
Addestrare e ottimizzare modelli di machine learning
Identificare e misurare obiettivi e risultati chiave che guidino il go/no go per lo scaling delle iniziative




Profilo




La risorsa ideale è un* laureando/laureato in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o similari.

Possiede un forte background tecnico, una mentalità creativa e innovativa e una passione per le tecnologie emergenti. Sono richieste buona capacità di problem solving e di team working, autonomia nell’organizzazione dei tasks assegnati ed orientamento al risultato. E' inoltre richiesta la disponibilità alla mobilità geografica in ambito nazionale e internazionale ed un’ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese.




Requisiti




Ottima conoscenza di un linguaggio di programmazione (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Conoscenza teorica delle tecniche di machine learning
Esperienza con framework di deep learning
Conoscenza di linguaggi di sviluppo e markup Java, Javascript, HTML, CSS, PHP, API REST
Familiarità con i framework Big Data e gli strumenti di visualizzazione (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)
Ottime doti analitiche e di sintesi







Offerta




Si prevede un'inserimento in stage (curriculare/extracurriculare)




Sede di Lavoro




Milano

Show more

Title: Junior – ML & RPA Developer
HTML:
Stiamo cercando una figura Junior da inserire nel team Digital Controls CPP di Deloitte per la sede di Milano e Roma che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business Digital Controls CPP si occupa di fornire servizi di Digital Transformation, che hanno l’obiettivo di supportare la digitalizzazione dei processi di business, mettendo in atto attività che prevedono l’utilizzo di strumenti di Robotic Process Automation, Data Analytics, Machine Learning e AI sfruttando i principali servizi messi a disposizione dai più importanti player del settore dell’automazione di processo e cloud.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:

  • Aiutare nella progettazione e design di soluzioni IT sia di tipo applicativo che di integrazione;
  • Porterà avanti attività di troubleshooting e reverse engineering su soluzioni già implementate;
  • Implementazione di nuovi processi di automazione a partire dall’analisi di requisiti di Business fino al rilascio in produzione dopo opportuni Unit e User Acceptance Test.

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea triennale in informatica o in un campo STEM correlato;
  • Esperienza su progettualità di trasformazione digitale e/o automazione di processo;
  • Forte predisposizione al problem solving e mentalità analitica;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata);
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi C#, SQL, .Net’;
  • Ottime abilità comunicative nei confronti degli stakeholder di progetto (colleghi, cliente, etc.);
  • Voglia di imparare, propositività e capacità di teamworking.

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

Title: Clinical Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

We are the company that cares – for our staff, for our clients, for our partners and for the quality of the work we do. A dynamic, global company founded in 1995, we bring together more than 2,700 driven, dedicated and passionate individuals. We work on the frontline of medical science, changing lives, and bringing new medicines to those who need them.

Job Description

Reporting to the Clinical Data Science Manager, the Clinical Data Scientist is an integral part of our team here at PSI. You will work with clinical trials patient and operational data, develop new data solutions and set up Risk-based Monitoring systems in Process Improvement department.

Hybrid work in Milan


Participate in selection of the Risk-Based Monitoring (RBM) system and provide relevant training to the project team and/or Sponsor
Set up and maintain RBM systems, collaborating with the Central Monitoring Manager
Manage complex datasets from multiple sources, including data extraction, transformation, and loading into PSI data platform
Program and produce data listings, tables, and figures for Clinical Data Reviewers and Central Monitoring Managers
Calculate Key Risk Indicators and Quality Tolerance Limits, applying advanced analytical techniques to identify data trends for Centralized Monitoring
Collaborate cross-functionally to identify study challenges and develop data solutions using advanced analytics
Communicate data findings and solutions to stakeholders effectively
Contribute to the development of databases, software products, processes, and Quality System Documents for Centralized Monitoring



Qualifications

Must have:


Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or equivalent; or relevant work experience and professional qualifications
At least 5 years of experience in Data Management, Biostatistics, and Centralized Monitoring
At least 4 years of experience in one or more of the following: R, R Shiny, SAS, SQL and associated packages and libraries
At least 2 years of experience in data engineering area including one or more of the following: relationship databases, data warehousing, data schemas, data stores, data modeling, testing, validation and analysis
Full professional proficiency in English and Italian
Strong analytical an logical thinking
Communication and collaboration skills



Nice to have:


Experience with CluePoints RBM system
Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques for analyzing data
Experience with using Machine Learning technics and products testing and validation



Additional Information

What we offer:


We value your time so the recruitment process is as quick as 3 meetings
We'll prepare you to do your job at highest quality level with our extensive onboarding and mentorship program
You'll have excellent working conditions - spacious and modern office in convenient location, and friendly, supportive team who love to hang out together
You'll have permanent work agreement at a stable, privately owned company
We care about our employees - aside from competitive salary, you'll have good work-life balance with flexible working hours and additional days off, life and medical insurance, sports card, lunch card
We're constantly growing which means opportunities for personal and professional growth



Make the right call and take your career to a whole new level. Join the company that focuses on its people and invests in their professional development and success.

Title: Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Fluency in both Italian and English


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Requirements

Master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Technologies


Programming: Python


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
Faboci Srl è una realtà innovativa e dinamica in continuo divenire – MAKE IT EASY. Professionisti del recruiting ICT si sono incontrati con esperti della formazione tecnica; assieme, queste due sfere di competenza hanno dato vita a una risposta univoca alle più attuali ed urgenti esigenze del mercato.


Siamo alla ricerca di un Senior AI Engineer per una realtà globale innovativa, specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni digitali avanzate per supportare la trasformazione tecnologica delle imprese. Presente in oltre 30 Paesi, collabora con importanti brand internazionali per migliorare processi aziendali e creare prodotti digitali che uniscono tecnologia, creatività e intelligenza artificiale. L’ambiente di lavoro è dinamico e inclusivo, con un forte focus sull’innovazione continua e la valorizzazione delle competenze del team.


AI Engineer (Cod. Rif. "FBC321")


La risorsa si occuperà di:


  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni AI avanzate utilizzando tecnologie di machine learning e/o generative AI per affrontare complesse sfide aziendali;
  • Implementare e ottimizzare flussi di dati end-to-end, concentrandosi su feature engineering, preparazione dei dati, valutazione dei modelli e deployment di soluzioni scalabili;
  • Collaborare strettamente con i data engineer per progettare e mantenere pipeline e infrastrutture dati che supportino efficacemente applicazioni ML e GenAI;
  • Sfruttare tecnologie Large Language Model (LLM) (ad es. LangChain) per creare applicazioni AI innovative che migliorino l'esperienza utente e generino valore aziendale;
  • Tradurre insight dai dati in raccomandazioni operative, presentando i risultati in modo efficace a stakeholder tecnici e non tecnici;
  • Ottimizzare modelli AI per il deployment in produzione, garantendo scalabilità, affidabilità e alte performance;
  • Rimanere aggiornato sugli sviluppi nel campo dell'AI, del machine learning e dei framework LLM per applicare costantemente tecniche all'avanguardia.


Requisiti:


  • Conoscenza dell'architettura a microservizi ed esperienza nello sviluppo di API RESTful per integrazione e comunicazione tra servizi;
  • Esperienza con tecnologie di containerizzazione (es. Docker) e strumenti di orchestrazione (es. Kubernetes);
  • Competenza nei linguaggi di programmazione come Python o R;
  • Esperienza nella preparazione e ottimizzazione dei dati per applicazioni di machine learning e AI;
  • Conoscenza approfondita di framework ML (es. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) e capacità pratica nella costruzione e distribuzione di modelli ML;
  • Esperienza con strumenti di big data processing (es. Hadoop, Spark) e piattaforme cloud (es. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);
  • Conoscenza di SQL e familiarità con database NoSQL (es. PostgreSQL, MongoDB);
  • Padronanza degli strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib);
  • Familiarità con framework LLM come LangChain e loro applicazioni pratiche;
  • Conoscenza delle best practice di governance dei dati, sicurezza e requisiti di conformità per progetti AI.


Cosa offriamo:


  • Inserimento a tempo indeterminato;
  • Lavoro in una realtà aziendale strutturata enterprise;
  • Gestione progetti ad alta visibilità e ad impatto internazionale.


Orario di lavoro: Fulltime


Sede di lavoro: Milano


Metodo: Ibrido

Title: Scientist III, Data Sciences
Description:
Work Schedule

Standard (Mon-Fri)

Environmental Conditions

Office

Job Description

Data Scientist III

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you will discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer. As we continue to invest in our digital transformation, our Data Science COE is expanding to our newest facility in Milan, Italy. We are excited to launch this new digital center, bringing together innovative and passionate colleagues to drive the strategic priorities for our businesses.

How will you make an impact?

Innovators please apply! As a Data Scientist III working in the Corporate Data Science Center of Excellence, you will be part of a team dedicated to increasing the business efficiency of a Fortune 100 Company. This position provides an exciting way for an early-career, high-aptitude employee to work with an experienced team and make immediate contributions. If you enjoy math, programming, and problem solving this may be the job you are looking for.

Working with a team of great people you will learn how to navigate complex business concerns from across the enterprise and translate them into processes and algorithms. These solutions will be presented to fellow analysts and business collaborators. There will be a continuous challenge to develop new analytic capabilities and improve existing ones on a wide variety of projects. Our Data Scientists will typically choose the approach taken.

Responsibilities


Apply advanced data algorithms to build models which could include: customer acquisition, upsell and cross-sell, customer retention, recommendation engines, and others
Create, validate, and stress-test the algorithms that are employed
Pull data in from various sources and work with business leaders to develop revenue-generating strategies
Develop analytical and visual metrics to measure and compare campaign performance
Transform data on customer behavior and web engagement into product recommendations
Work with our Data Scientists to leverage machine learning, generative AI, and automation to enhance business processes
Share ideas across the team to come up with the best algorithms and approaches


Skills Employed In This Job Will Include


Extracting data from multiple sources, cleaning and validating for duplicates and other anomalies
Identify patterns in data and turn those patterns into market opportunities
Employ math and statistics into algorithms to generate real-time predictive systems
Align and adapt business problems to the most efficient machine-learning algorithm
Write code from scratch to create solutions that don’t align with any available turnkey packages
Selecting and explaining the best analytical technique for the particular problem
Understanding how to create a computationally efficient solution
Accurately manage data coming from multiple domestic and international sources
Proactively create solutions as opportunities are identified


Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree with 2 years of relevant experience in data science, analytics, statistics, applied math or related
Willingness to wrangle data and solve elusive problems
Strong interest in math and numerical estimation
Proficiency in Python (or PySpark) and SQL
Experience with version control / source code management systems (Git, GitHub)
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including an ability to communicate effectively with individuals from diverse technical and business backgrounds.
Passionate about continuous learning


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in eCommerce desirable but not required
Solid understanding of SQL Server, Databricks, Spark, Oracle or Power BI
AWS/Cloud Computing
Exposure to a variety of operating systems and computing platforms
Familiarity with available Open Source solutions that will boost the team’s effectiveness
Show more

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST




Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?

Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.

We are looking for motivated and talented Data Scientists to join our Data Science team. You will have the opportunity to work on complex and innovative projects, using cutting-edge tools and collaborating with high-level professionals to face the challenges of the global financial market. If you are looking for a challenging environment where your curiosity and creativity can make a difference, this is the right opportunity for you.




RESPONSIBILITIES:




● Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data in banking and insurance, identifying useful patterns and insights to support business processes and decisions.

● Design, develop and implement advanced machine learning, data mining and statistical models to solve complex problems in finance.

● Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define project requirements and propose innovative solutions.

● Contribute to the development of proprietary frameworks and algorithms to improve the performance of solutions offered to our clients.

● Present complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, making analysis results understandable.

● Support customers in implementing solutions, ensuring knowledge transfer and customization.




REQUIREMENTS:




● Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration and feature extraction.

● Excellent knowledge of Python and the most important analytical libraries.

● Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms

● Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques, predictive modeling with the application of Machine Learning models, and data analysis.

● Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

● Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

● Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

● Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.




NICE TO HAVE:




● Experience with code versioning systems (git).

● Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

● Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

● Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)

● Prior analytical experience in the financial industry




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:




● Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields

● Experience in a corporate setting (including internships), preferably in finance or insurance




LOCATION:

Milan




WHAT WE OFFER:




COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT




Our history, as well as our future, is based on the value of our people. Prometeia’s biggest investment is in our people and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it “Total Compensation” and it is made of three elements: Compensation, consisting of a fixed and a variable component, a Welfare Plan active since 2015 –we were among the first companies in Italy to introduce it–, and Benefits, including all initiatives for the well-being of our people.




REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of our way of working. In Prometeia, remote working is an organizational method based on trust. It results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results through autonomy and empowerment of people.




PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of our people and on continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Within the projects, several moments are dedicated to transparent discussions between managers and team members. This allows for reciprocal and prompt feedback. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the strategic growth of both the individual and the company.




TRAINING

Prometeia means continuous training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. We pay specific attention to younger colleagues, the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important and is made of immediate and direct confrontation with the market.




WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees and you recommend a person who is later hired, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.




PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

We have completely digitalized the management of our physical and virtual environments through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia. Access to the office, remote working, workstations, meeting rooms, carpooling... everything is just a click away.




COMMUNITY

Our Community is highly diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities we actively cooperate with are stakeholders representing a great value for us in terms of trust and collaboration.




DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the recruitment phase to everyday life, promoted also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and uniqueness.




IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, territories and communities we operate in. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards recognizing the efficiency of the building in terms of energy and water savings, CO2 emissions reduction, and improvement of the ecological quality of interiors, materials and resources. In the Sustainability Report we outline the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda drafted by the UN in 2016, that we have been supporting since 2020.

Title: Data Scientist Internship- L 68/99
Description:
Cerved è la Tech Company che aiuta imprese e istituzioni a proteggersi dal rischio e a crescere in maniera sostenibile.

Siamo leader nell'ambito dei prodotti e servizi integrati di Risk, Sales e Marketing Intelligence, Credit Management. Con Cerved Rating Agency siamo specializzati nella valutazione del merito di credito di imprese non finanziarie e registrati quale agenzia di rating europea.

Dal 2021, Cerved è entrata in ION Group, uno dei più grandi operatori FinTech sul mercato a livello internazionale in cui lavorano oltre 13 mila persone, con 60 sedi internazionali e oltre 4800 clienti in tutto il mondo insieme realizziamo soluzioni integrate per aiutare le imprese a prendere decisioni efficaci, semplificando i processi e mettendo al centro le persone. 

Sei una persona appassionata di dati e desideri far parte della trasformazione algo-driven in CERVED? Siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Junior Data Scientist che si unisca al nostro team di Collection Intelligence. Questa è un'opportunità sfidante per chi desidera contribuire alla comprensione dei dati e all'estrazione di insight significativi per il nostro business.

La persona che cerchiamo si occuperà di


Collaborare con il Collection Intelligence Manager per sviluppare metodologie e tecniche per l'analisi e la valutazione dei dati mediante modelli matematici e statistici.
Identificare, analizzare e interpretare i dati per individuare trend, pattern e opportunità di ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali.
Supportare le diverse aree aziendali nell'implementazione di strategie data/algo-driven sui sistemi gestionali aziendali.
Sviluppare reportistica per il monitoraggio dei principali KPI aziendali nell'ambito delle operazioni.


La persona che cerchiamo


Ha conseguito una laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Informatica o campo correlato.
Possiede forti doti analitiche e quantitative.
E’ in grado di organizzare, analizzare e interpretare quantità significative di informazioni con attenzione ai dettagli.
Ha competenze in data modeling
Ha una conoscenza avanzata di Excel
Utilizza il linguaggio di programmazione Python.


Per Cerved la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali per permettere a tutti di esprimersi al meglio nell'ambiente lavorativo. Ci impegniamo tutti i giorni a capire, comprendere e sviluppare le potenzialità e a valorizzare la diversità delle nostre persone, che rappresentano il vero valore del nostro Gruppo.

Si valuta come sede di lavoro preferenziale San Donato Milanese (MI)

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Your responsibilities


Actively contribute to the quantitative success of our Products
Develop, deploy, and maintain scalable MLOps solutions that facilitate the integration and deployment of machine learning models into our products
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using industry best practices
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance machine learning infrastructure and streamline operational processes
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.
Identify performance bottlenecks and optimize system components for enhanced scalability
Stay up to date with whatever is happening in the ML world



Your super skills


A Master’s Degree or PhD in quantitative fields, like Computer Science, Engineering, Stats, Math, or Physics
Fluent in English and eager to work in a multicultural and international environment
Curiosity and open-mindedness toward the ideas of others
Passion for technology
Desire to learn new things and share them with other people
Desire to grow professionally, improve and challenge oneself, always demonstrating great proactivity
Excellent ability to work and communicate within your team



Your experience


3+ years of hands-on experience as a Machine Learning Engineer in agile teams
Previous working experience in a software product-oriented company
Familiarity with development led by product OKRs
Superb Python and PySpark programming skills and experience with data science libraries, e.g., NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn
Experience with modelling and implementing deep learning models with TensorFlow or PyTorch
Proficiency in SQL
Familiarity with MLOps practices and knowledge of tools such as MLFlow
Hands-on experience with AWS services including Fargate, Step Functions, S3, Lambda, Glue, Kinesis, etc.
Demonstrated ability to write testable, modular, clean, and secure code
Experience with REST APIs, Pub/Sub messaging, or event streaming
Familiarity with CI pipelines (e.g., GitLab), containerization, and pair programming



Nice to have:


Knowledge of the following applied machine learning fields: Recommender Systems, NLP, LLM, Information Retrieval, Causal Inference, Time Series, Knowledge Graph
AWS Certified Machine Learning certification
Familiarity with DevOps practices including container orchestration, shell scripting, test automation, and Linux knowledge
Familiarity with architectural patterns of large-scale software applications
Experience with Graph DB technologies
Experience in at least one compiled object-oriented programming language (such as Java or C++).



Why Vedrai?


Flexibility. We have a hybrid working policy to ensure an optimum work-life balance
Innovation center. A place where you can create new cool projects in any field from scratch
Celebrate your birthday! All employees can enjoy an afternoon off spendable during the week of your birthday
Team building and events. In Vedrai we like to grow, have fun together and know each other, so you’ll have the possibility to attend team building activities, corporate and external events
Annual bonus. Based on the achievement of goals
Stock incentive plan. Every employee has his own stock incentive plan. Also compensation can grow rapidly depending on the performance review
Ticket restaurant. We provide 8€ ticket restaurants for days worked in the office
Brilliant, skilled colleagues. Work with and learn from the most talented people in the AI field
Continuous learning. Vedrai focuses on people, enabling them to grow personally and professionally by offering training opportunities and a performance management program
Business Development. Join a workplace that's constantly evolving, always growing and changing. You’ll never get bored!



If you have a charismatic personality, an insatiable curiosity, work ethics and sense of humor..come and join us!

Did we catch your attention? Learn more about our company and culture at our website and apply now

Vedrai is committed to promoting equality, diversity, and inclusion throughout our organisation, including our recruitment and selection processes.

At Vedrai, we are dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all individuals are respected, valued, and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives and talents and we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Your Perspectives

Entra a Far Parte Del Nostro Team Digital Innovation - AI Center Of Excellence In Rapida Crescita e Partecipa Allo Sviluppo Di Rivoluzionarie Applicazioni Basate Su Tecnologie Di Intelligenza Artificiale. Avrai L’opportunità Di

  • Sviluppare progetti basati su algoritmi di intelligenza artificiale, sia per ottimizzazioni dei processi interni o per clienti che integrati in innovative soluzioni software;
  • Contribuire attivamente alla crescita della nostra struttura dedicata all'Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare al Natural Language Understanding e alla Computer Vision;
  • Partecipare al ciclo di vita di un prodotto basato su AI, dall’analisi del business case, al tuning dei modelli, allo sviluppo delle componenti applicative richieste dall’applicazione fino alla realizzazione della User Experience ideale;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Operare in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Garantire l’erogazione dei deliverables di progetto concordati con il Project Manager di riferimento e con i committenti, in accordo con i vincoli di budget e quality condivisi;
  • Fornire supporto applicativo a soluzioni basate su moduli di Intelligenza Artificiale, Large Language Models e Computer Vision, sia esistenti che di nuova realizzazione.

Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una laurea in discipline STEM;
  • Hai esperienza nello sviluppo e addestramento di modelli utilizzando tecniche di Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing e Computer Vision, sia a partire dai framework più utilizzati (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Spark ML, Spark GraphX) che da servizi SaaS (Google Vertex AI, Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI);
  • Hai esperienza nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su AI e sei interessato a lavorare con Large Language Models come OpenAI e tecniche di Computer Vision come OCR, YoLo, etc.;
  • Hai basi di Semantic Web e conosci l’architettura dei motori di ricerca evoluti (Elastic Search, Solr, Lucene);
  • Hai utilizzato strutture dati NoSQL (MongoDB o componenti dell'ecosistema Hadoop);
  • Conosci approfonditamente linguaggi di programmazione object oriented come Java/Scala, C++ o Python;
  • Sei capace di mettere in pratica tecniche di "Continuous Learning" al fine di cogliere opportunità da nuove tecnologie senza abbandonarti alla sola attività di ricerca;
  • Possiedi tecniche di ascolto attivo, capacità di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza e curiosità, spiccato senso di responsabilità professionale;
  • Possiedi una conoscenza avanzata della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta).

Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprenderà con un’opportunità di carriera che ti farà sentire al centro della società, dell’innovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosità avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l’identificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualità dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.

Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversità e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunità, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Data Scientist - Data&AI
HTML:
In Accenture, potrai portare la tua visione innovativa al cuore del cambiamento, lavorando con le aziende più importanti a livello mondiale per trasformare interi settori di mercato. Modella il futuro del business e della tecnologia sviluppando soluzioni all'avanguardia in grado di generare nuovo valore. Il tuo ruolo e le tue prospettive Entra a far parte del nostro network internazionale di talenti Strategy & Consulting in ambito Data&AI. Lavorerai con tecnologie innovative su progetti entusiasmanti, aiutando le aziende leader a livello mondiale a sviluppare le loro strategie IT. In particolare, potrai:


  • Disegnare soluzioni per progetti in ambito Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence e Generative AI;

  • Raccogliere, sintetizzare e analizzare dati complessi sviluppando use-case ad hoc utilizzando il miglior stack tecnologico per generare insight e risultati di valore;

  • Applicare tecniche di Advanced Analytics all’interno di paradigmi Big Data per lo sviluppo e l’implementazione di modelli statistici tradizionali e di Machine Learning da applicare in contesti cross-functional & cross-mercato;

  • Gestire attività progettuali con metodologie di lavoro Agile e Waterfall.


    • Se condividi la nostra passione per la consulenza in ambito Data & AI e hai le seguenti caratteristiche, ti stiamo aspettando:


  • Laurea Magistrale in materie STEM;

  • Da 2 a 5 anni di esperienza in ambito AI per lo sviluppo di modelli di Advanced Analytics (ad es. Time series analysis , Clustering, Classification), Computer Vision, NLP e Generative AI;

  • Ottima conoscenza di Python (in alternativa C++, Java) e delle librerie di Data Science (Pandas, Scikit Learn, Keras, Tensor Flow, Matplotlib, fastapi);

  • Esperienza di almeno un anno nello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI su uno dei maggiori providers di Soluzioni Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google);

  • Conoscenze delle MLOps e delle architetture a microservizi;

  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese.


    • Scopri di più su di noi Accenture è un’azienda globale di servizi professionali con capacità avanzate in campo digitale, cloud e security. Combinando un’esperienza unica e competenze specialistiche in più di 40 settori industriali, fornisce servizi in ambito Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Industry X, Operations e Accenture Song, sostenuta dalla più ampia rete di Advanced Technology e Intelligent Operations centers a livello mondiale. I nostri 742.000 talenti combinano ogni giorno tecnologia e ingegno umano, servendo clienti in oltre 120 Paesi. Se desideri prepararti al meglio al nostro processo di selezione ti invitiamo a consultare la nostra sezione FAQ: https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/explore-careers/area-of-interest/journey-to-accenture Policy Qualora il tuo percorso di selezione andasse a buon fine, avrai la possibilità di aderire all’Accordo di smart working, ove compatibile con l’attività svolta, e lavorare da remoto secondo quanto previsto dalle policy aziendali. Per informazioni sulla nostra protezione della privacy art13 L.679/2016 (GDPR) vai su https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/privacy-policy Accenture garantisce le pari opportunità.

Title: R&D Junior Analyst
Description:
Chi siamo:

Doppel Farmaceutici Srl è un’azienda leader nella ricerca, sviluppo, formulazione, produzione e confezionamento farmaci per conto terzi.

Organizzata su due stabilimenti produttivi, Rozzano, in provincia di Milano, e Cortemaggiore, in provincia di Piacenza, Doppel offre un’ottima opportunità per entrare in contatto con un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e sfidante, sia per i professionisti già affermati nel settore e sia per i giovani che stanno maturando la loro prima esperienza lavorativa in azienda.

Passione, energia e dedizione sono solo alcuni dei valori che contraddistinguono Doppel e guidano quotidianamente il lavoro di ogni dipendente.

L’ambiente lavorativo positivo, informale e particolarmente collaborativo consente a ciascun lavoratore di esprimere al meglio le proprie qualità personali e di portare a termine le mansioni quotidiane.

Da settembre 2024, Doppel Farmaceutici, insieme a Mipharm e Alfa Omega, è entrata a far parte del gruppo DMX PHARMA, gruppo leader nel terzismo farmaceutico.




Chi cerchiamo:

Per la divisione R&D, situata sullo stabilimento di Rozzano (MI), si ricerca la figura di uno/a analista da inserire nel laboratorio di Sviluppo Analitico, che andrà a svolgere le seguenti




Principali Attività:

Analisi su materie prime e prodotto finito
Stesura di tutta la documentazione tecnica: protocolli, report di convalida delle nuove metodiche analitiche sviluppate, transfer delle nuove metodiche analitiche provenienti da laboratori esterni e report di sviluppo formulativo dei progetti in svilluppo.




Requisiti richiesti:

Esperienza di almeno 1-2 anni in sviluppo analitico/controllo qualità
Autonomia nello svolgimento delle analisi analitiche e nella predisposizione della relativa documentazione
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta




Cosa offriamo:

Inserimento in un team giovane e dinamico, in cui poter esprimere al meglio le proprie capacità e poter acquisire nuove competenze
Contratto e trattamento economico in linea con l’esperienza pregressa nel ruolo
Orario di lavoro a giornata dalle 8,30 alle 17,00
Show more

Title: Scientist III, Data Sciences
Description:
Work Schedule

Standard (Mon-Fri)

Environmental Conditions

Office

Data Scientist III

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you will discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer. As we continue to invest in our digital transformation, our Data Science COE is expanding to our newest facility in Milan, Italy. We are excited to launch this new digital center, bringing together innovative and passionate colleagues to drive the strategic priorities for our businesses.

How will you make an impact?

Innovators please apply! As a Data Scientist III working in the Corporate Data Science Center of Excellence, you will be part of a team dedicated to increasing the business efficiency of a Fortune 100 Company. This position provides an exciting way for an early-career, high-aptitude employee to work with an experienced team and make immediate contributions. If you enjoy math, programming, and problem solving this may be the job you are looking for.

Working with a team of great people you will learn how to navigate complex business concerns from across the enterprise and translate them into processes and algorithms. These solutions will be presented to fellow analysts and business collaborators. There will be a continuous challenge to develop new analytic capabilities and improve existing ones on a wide variety of projects. Our Data Scientists will typically choose the approach taken.

Responsibilities:


Apply advanced data algorithms to build models which could include: customer acquisition, upsell and cross-sell, customer retention, recommendation engines, and others
Create, validate, and stress-test the algorithms that are employed
Pull data in from various sources and work with business leaders to develop revenue-generating strategies
Develop analytical and visual metrics to measure and compare campaign performance
Transform data on customer behavior and web engagement into product recommendations
Work with our Data Scientists to leverage machine learning, generative AI, and automation to enhance business processes
Share ideas across the team to come up with the best algorithms and approaches


Skills employed in this job will include:


Extracting data from multiple sources, cleaning and validating for duplicates and other anomalies
Identify patterns in data and turn those patterns into market opportunities
Employ math and statistics into algorithms to generate real-time predictive systems
Align and adapt business problems to the most efficient machine-learning algorithm
Write code from scratch to create solutions that don’t align with any available turnkey packages
Selecting and explaining the best analytical technique for the particular problem
Understanding how to create a computationally efficient solution
Accurately manage data coming from multiple domestic and international sources
Proactively create solutions as opportunities are identified


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree with 2 years of relevant experience in data science, analytics, statistics, applied math or related
Willingness to wrangle data and solve elusive problems
Strong interest in math and numerical estimation
Proficiency in Python (or PySpark) and SQL
Experience with version control / source code management systems (Git, GitHub)
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including an ability to communicate effectively with individuals from diverse technical and business backgrounds.
Passionate about continuous learning


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in eCommerce desirable but not required
Solid understanding of SQL Server, Databricks, Spark, Oracle or Power BI
AWS/Cloud Computing
Exposure to a variety of operating systems and computing platforms
Familiarity with available Open Source solutions that will boost the team’s effectiveness

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Cosa ti proponiamo

All’interno della divisione ENG DIGITAL per la business line Eng AI&Data siamo alla ricerca di una figura di Data Scientist per progettualità legate al Machine Learning, AI e Data Science nella nostra unità di sviluppo di LLM proprietari.

Quali saranno le tue attività e responsabilità?

Sarai Responsabile Di Attività Di Analisi, Sviluppo e Implementazione Di Soluzioni Avanzate Di Basate Sul Machine Learning, AI e Generative AI All’interno Di Un Team Di Data Scientist Ed AI Engineer. In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Delle Seguenti Attività

  • Progettare e sviluppare soluzioni di AI/ML robuste e scalabili;
  • Ottimizzare algoritmi e modelli di AI/ML;
  • Supportare la gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita di progetti di Data Science e Artificial Intelligence, dalla concezione al deployment;
  • Redigere e mantenere la documentazione tecniche relativa a Soluzioni e Modelli di AI.

Qualifiche e competenze richieste

Qualifiche Richieste

  • Almeno due anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di soluzioni Python con le principali librerie per il Machine Learning (es. Scikit Learn) e per la visualizzazione (es. Matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh, ecc.);
  • Esperienza nell’uso di framework di deep learning e NLP (es. PyTorch, Hugging Face, Langchain);
  • Esperienza nell’uso di sistemi di versionamento del codice (es. GIT);
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di valutazione delle performance di Algoritmi di AI;
  • Familiarità nello sviluppo di API, basate su architetture a microservizi;
  • Familiarità nell’uso di tecnologie cloud a supporto dello sviluppo dello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI, su almeno uno dei principali hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform);
  • Laurea in discipline informatiche, ingegneristiche o statistiche (Master o specializzazione in ambito Data Science vengono considerati un plus):
  • Buone capacità comunicative e di presentazione.

Competenze Aggiuntive Preferenziali

  • Conoscenze di base della teoria dei modelli generativi e LLM;
  • Conoscenza di framework e best practice per il serving LLM in Production (es. vLLM, LLMOps,
  • Pachyderm);
  • Esperienza nella creazione di soluzioni basate su container tramite l’uso di strumenti di virtualizzazione e scaling (es. Docker, Kubernetes);
  • Conoscenza delle piattaforme Cloudera e Databricks;
  • Conoscenza del framework Ray per il calcolo distribuito;
  • Esperienza nella redazione di documentazione tecnica;

Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?

  • Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo;
  • Proattività, nell’anticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa;
  • Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi;
  • Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.

Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza. 

SEDE DI INSERIMENTO

Milano | Roma | Torino | Padova

L’annuncio è rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunità di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
Unisciti al nostro team AI di EY basato sulle sedi di Milano, Roma, Bari, Cagliari e Trieste e dai una svolta alla tua carriera entrando in EY.

Chi è EY?

EY è una delle società Big 4 della consulenza. Quello che ci caratterizza rispetto alle altre aziende è la possibilità di trasformare il business e il modo di lavorare dei nostri clienti, che siano grandi multinazionali, piccole imprese o pubbliche amministrazioni. La nostra cultura del lavoro si basa sulla fiducia, l’autonomia e il rispetto tra le persone, ed è incentrata sul raggiungimento dei risultati attraverso una modalità di lavoro ibrida.

#TELLMEY – Cosa dicono di noi

Questi sono i fattori più influenti che hanno spinto colleghe e colleghi a sceglierci nel 2024!

  • Learning and Development: oltre 50 ore all’anno di formazione per ciascuna persona;
  • Progressione di carriera: solo negli ultimi 12 mesi il 65% delle persone di EY si è vista riconoscere un avanzamento di carriera;
  • Salary e Benefits: con un’ampia gamma di convenzioni aziendali, dalla palestra allo shopping, fino a servizi gratuiti di telemedicina e supporto psicologico;
  • Mobilità e opportunità internazionali, compresa la possibilità di lavorare dall’estero fino a 20 giorni senza essere in trasferta;
  • Smart working senza giornate prestabilite centralmente.

La divisione AI&Data si caratterizza per avere una forte connessione con altre aree di competenza e di supportare i clienti in programmi di trasformazione di processo, con il supporto di soluzioni innovative e integrate. Farai parte del team AI&Advanced Analytics: una struttura consolidata, con elevata expertise, caratterizzata da un team giovane.

Siamo alla ricerca di un potenziale AI Engineer che si occuperà di:

  • Implementare soluzioni di AI Generativa con tecniche avanzate (Agenti, RAG);
  • Ottimizzare pipeline di dati e modelli AI utilizzando uno dei principali cloud provider;
  • Integrare soluzioni AI nei sistemi aziendali complessi (clienti e prodotti interni).

Chi stiamo cercando? Persone con:

  • Laurea in materie ingegneristiche o scientifiche;
  • 2-4 anni di esperienza in progetti nel settore industriale, preferibilmente in società di consulenza
  • Esperienza con Python e modelli avanzati di Generative AI e NLP;
  • Conoscenza pipeline di MLOps e risorse cloud, preferibilmente Azure;
  • Conoscenza di Framework come LangChain e LangGraph;
  • Esperienza nella gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall’esigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi;

Cosa ti aspetta in EY 

  • Progetti di ogni tipo per clienti di ogni settore;
  • + 450.000 ore di formazione erogate per accrescere le tue competenze tecniche e il tuo talento personale;
  • Un Counselor che ti supporterà nel tuo percorso professionale;
  • Policy di smart working flessibile e possibilità di lavorare dall’estero; 
  • Benefits e programmi di welfare aziendale diversificati.

EY promuove la diversità, l’equità e l’inclusione, valorizzando l’unicità, indipendentemente da età, genere, abilità, esperienza, cultura, orientamento sessuale, religione, disabilità e background socioeconomico. Tutte le nostre offerte di lavoro si rivolgono allo stesso modo a persone con disabilità, in conformità con la legge italiana L. 68/99. Il nostro obiettivo è creare un ambiente di lavoro equo e accessibile.

Title: Python developer
Description:
l nostro obiettivo è sempre stato quello di creare e ampliare nel tempo un gruppo di persone qualificato, affidabile e disponibile; puntando su professionisti esperti, ma anche sulla formazione, investendo risorse nella crescita professionale.

Dipendenti e collaboratori attraverso consolidate competenze tecniche, contribuiscono a rendere Craon un’azienda altamente qualificata e competitiva sul mercato ICT

Stiamo ricercando Python developer con esperienza comprovata di almeno 3 anni

Competenze tecniche necessarie:


Buona conoscenza di Python
Conoscenza dei principi di sviluppo back-end
Esperienza di sviluppo API e microservizi
Esperienza con DB SQL e NoSQL
Gradita la conoscenza dell'architettura Cloud



Competenze trasversali utili sono:


La propensione al lavoro in team
L'orientamento alla risoluzione dei problemi
Proattività ed organizzazione



Sede: Milano (ibrido)

Si offre contratto a tempo indeterminato CNNL Commercio e Servizi; RAL in relazione all’esperienza effettivamente maturata

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

Location/Division Specific Information

The team focuses on commercial audience generation through audience segmentation, time-to-event analysis, recommendation engines, generative AI, and other forms of predictive modeling. You will work closely with experts throughout the company to develop tailored targeting strategies. Your work will be seen and used by fellow data scientists, collaborators within the business, sales representatives, and customers of Thermo Fisher. You will be expected to learn quickly and offer creative and effective solutions to novel challenges.

You will report to a member of the data science team and operate as a key asset within the Corporate Data Science Center of Excellence, a team comprised of data scientists, data engineers, business analysts, program/product managers, and others.

Key Responsibilities


Identify and embed within business functions throughout the company with high data science potential.
Move quickly to build proof of concepts, scalable solutions, and anything else required to drive business value quickly.
Leverage modern tools and techniques to develop novel insights.
Promote standard methodologies in the field, encompassing data warehousing, performance monitoring, and a balanced approach.
Work with senior members to build novel audience-creation and targeting strategies
Voracious pursuit of knowledge and an unwavering dedication to the scientific process


Keys to Success:

Education


Graduate degree in a quantitative field, such as statistics, economics, mathematics, etc.


Experience


Proven track record (3 to 6 years) applying industry standard data science tools to tackle previously unsolved problems
Ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day oversight


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities


Extensive knowledge and application of the scientific process in industry
Command of statistical topics, including distributions, hypothesis testing, and experiment design.
Sophisticated technical proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and others.
Proficiency with distributed computational frameworks, such as Spark
Foundational understanding in digital marketing, sales operations, and key performance indicators
Fluent English both written and spoken is required.


Show more

Title: Data Science Consultant
Description:
Sei un neolaureato e vuoi acquisire competenze nel settore informatico?




Le Tech Academy Digital & Technologies di Adecco hanno il preciso obiettivo di essere, per tutti i candidati interessati al mondo tecnologico, il tramite con il mercato del lavoro ICT e Digital Innovation. Le Tech Academy Digital &Technologies ti permettono di apprendere le competenze tecniche più richieste dal mercato informatico e di metterti in contatto con le più grandi aziende del settore.




Digital & Technologies – Divisione Specializzata di Adecco – ricerca, per nota società di Consulenza Strategica in ambito IT, neolaureati e/o laureandi in ambito STEM per la Tech Academy Data Science Consultant.




L’Academy verrà erogata in modalità ibrida e sarà completamente gratuita per chi vi parteciperà.




L’ obiettivo del corso è quello di formare DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT, professionisti del mondo della consulenza che, al superamento con successo del percorso formativo, verranno inseriti all’interno della realtà Cliente con l’obiettivo di lavorare sulla possibilità di proporre soluzioni innovative o apportare miglioramenti a pratiche, processi e sistemi principalmente riferiti all’area Financial Services.




Nello specifico ci si occuperà di: Advance Analytics, Reportistica BI, Process Mining, Machine Learning, etc. al fine di semplificare le metodologie adottate dall’azienda cliente.




L’Academy avrà una durata di 4 settimane circa con orario full time 9:00/18:00 dal Lunedì al Venerdì.




Requisiti:




Neolaureati/Laureandi in materie STEM (Matematica, Fisica, Statistica, Economia ad indirizzo statistico-quantitativo, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica);

Ottima capacità di problem determination e problem solving;

Ottimo standing;

Buona capacità di relazionarsi con diversi stakeholders;

Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese




A coloro che termineranno con successo il percorso formativo verrà proposto un contratto di assunzione.




Inizio della formazione: 17 marzo 2025

Fine della formazione: 16 aprile 2025

Modalità della formazione: ibrida

Contratto: Apprendistato CCNL Metalmeccanico 24 Mesi

Sede di Lavoro: Milano in modalità ibrida

Show more

Title: AI Software Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an experienced AI senior software engineer to lead adoption of cloud services (mainly Azure and GCP) and develop E2E applications, leveraging on machine learning and AI capabilities.
You will be involved in E2E application development life-cycle for our AI solutions, starting from architecture design until final delivery and production maintenance. Moreover, you should collaborate in the adoption, maintenance and evolution of our cloud workbench for analytics and generative AI.What you can expect from us
 Designing and develop scalable on-cloud applications.

 Identify the relevant cloud architectures, with attention to scalability, cost, and efficiency.

 Develop and test AI applications with a focus on system performances and integration within the digital landscape.
 Support the definition and documentation of best practices and standards for cloud usage and adoption with a focus on AI services.
What we expect from youThe ideal candidate has:

 University degree in computer science, engineering.

 4+ years of practical relevant experience.

 In-depth knowledge of Cloud Architecture, Azure preferred.

 Proven experience in object oriented application development (Python, .NET, Go) leveraging cloud components.

 Practical knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker.

 Practical knowledge of serverless functions

 Knowledge of DevOps best practices.

Preferred qualifications:

 Cloud Architect Certification (Azure / Google)

 Experience in designing and developing cloud-native architecture.

 Experience in designing and leading extensive system testing (unit, integration).

 knowledge of APIsdesign and implementation

Our offer to you#MakeInnovationHappen: Chance to make an impact in terms of transformation
#UnlockYourPotential: Join a young and stimulating environment
#ComeAsYouAre: Working within a global team
#UnlockYourPotential: Play a role of autonomy with high visibility and exposure
#BalanceLifeAndCareer: Flexible working hours;
#EnjoyTheBest: Access to our Benefits platform with a dedicated budget that you will be able to use, in order to choose the most suitable benefits for you
About UniCredit GroupUniCredit is a pan-European Commercial Bank with a unique service offering in Italy, Germany, Central and Eastern Europe. Our purpose is to empower communities to progress, delivering the best-in-class for all stakeholders, unlocking a better tomorrow for our clients and our people across Europe. We serve over 15 million customers worldwide. They are at the heart of what we do in all our markets. Digitalisation and our commitment to ESG principles are key enablers for our service. They help us deliver excellence to our stakeholders and creating a sustainable future for our clients, our communities and our people.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We stand together in nurturing a workplace that welcomes diverse thinking and inclusive behaviors.

Making all voices heard and leveraging "diversity of thought" regardless of gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, ability, cultural background, we ensure sustainable growth and new business opportunities, a strong drive for innovation and creativity, as well as a general improvement of the work climate with positive impact on productivity, well-being and engagement of our people.

Title: AI Engineer, Internship, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

You’ll be part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development life cycle
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics
Fluent in English and Italian


What You'll Bring

Requirements

Currently enrolled in a university master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related fields:

Technologies


Programming: Python, Java/Scala
Frameworks/Libraries: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras
Data Processing: NumPy, Pandas, Apache Spark, Dask
Cloud Platforms: AWS (SageMaker, EC2), GCP (AI Platform), Azure (ML Studio)
DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Jenkins
Data Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly/Dash, Tableau
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Google Colab, Git (GitHub/GitLab), MLflow, TensorBoard
Deployment: Flask, FastAPI, TensorFlow Serving, Streamlit


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!

WHY JOIN US
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
* Fast-paced, multidisciplinary and supportive environment.
* Global onboarding process.
* Bespoke training and development programs accessible to all.
* Competitive welfare and benefits package.
* International mobility opportunities.
DRIVE YOUR FUTURE
You will be part of an international agile team of data scientists and data engineers. Together you will solve problems and deliver value across R&D, manufacturing, sales & marketing and connected tyres. You will apply statistical analysis and machine-learning techniques to a wide range of data (from sensors, to telemetry, to manufacturing) and you will change how decisions are made across all business units.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES
You will be in charge of coming up with effective and scalable solutions that, leveraging internal and external data, will answer questions such as:
1. How can we optimize our supply chain flow in a particular geographic region?
2. How can we build an effective and scalable real time monitoring system for production quality control?
3. How can we use IoT data to derive crucial insights and deliver impactful results?
4. How to improve B2C services with data-driven solutions?
5. How to drive new product development?
6. How to design personalized campaign based on consumer behavior?

* Translate business questions to data science problems, often exploring data and finding insights
* Develop, tune, and deploy custom, scalable, predictive models
* Present to non-technical stakeholders, even complex concepts, in a simple manner
* Manage a data science product end-to-end from concept to production

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Must-have:
* Excellent knowledge of machine learning models
* Experience in model development (from business question to the model application)
* Advanced knowledge of Python
* Data visualization expertise
Required:
* Advanced knowledge of SQL
* Broad knowledge of statistical learning
* Extensive knowledge of scientific libraries (pandas, scipy, numpy, jupyter), scikit-learn, statsmodels and related machine learning/stats/data mining packages
* Deep knowledge of applied statistics including multivariate statistical analysis, Bayesian statistics, Time Series analysis
* Experience in machine learning model deployment
* Experience with GIT
* Knowledge of CI/CD
Desired skills:
* Experience with deep learning
* Experience in Apache Spark
* Working experience with AWS cloud framework and services
* Experience with Docker
Core skills:
* Ability to effectively communicate findings and rationale behind predictive models implemented to executives and management
* Ability to communicate and collaborate with other team members

WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
* Prior experience using agile and scrum
* Previous experience in professional end-to-end deep learning projects using TensorFlow

APPLY NOW, DRIVE YOUR FUTURE!
#WePirelli
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.





About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.




What You'll Do

Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.



Requirements


5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.



Benefits



Working pattern and location

40 hours per week, permanent contract 
Monday - Friday
Hybrid role




Benefits

Meal Vouchers (€7 per working day)
26 days holidays + national bank holidays 
Individual training paths
Opportunity to develop and move within the company
National and international mobility options 
Yearly team activities
Food canteen at the office




MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.
