  • Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
  • Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
  • Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.


Requirements

  • 5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
  • Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
  • Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
  • Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
  • Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.


Benefits

Working pattern and location

  • 40 hours per week, permanent contract 
  • Monday - Friday
  • Hybrid role


Benefits

  • Meal Vouchers (€7 per working day)
  • 26 days holidays + national bank holidays 
  • Individual training paths
  • Opportunity to develop and move within the company
  • National and international mobility options 
  • Yearly team activities
  • Food canteen at the office


MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Senior Specialist - Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

We’re looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you’ll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of topics.







Activities

Apply data workflow tasks as extraction, mining, preparation, quality control, KPI optimization, modelling, validation and business insight consideration.
Apply advanced analytics techniques in a big data paradigm considering multiple data sources
Develop and deploy machine/deep learning models applied to cross-functional use cases to increase customer value or operational efficiency.







Preferred Qualifications

A Master’s Degree in a highly quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, etc.) or equivalent experience
3+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling, data science and analysis
Fluent in data wrangling and preparation: exploratory analysis, profiling & cleansing, feature selection, feature engineering, segmentation, clustering and PCA
Strong working knowledge on programming languages as Python, SQL, R, data science libraries (Pandas, Scikit-learn, XGBoost) and MLOps tools (Git, Airflow, Kubernetes)
Experience using ML/DP libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllib, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Experience with cloud resources, usage of IDE (PyCharm, visualbasic) and version control systems (git) are highly valued
Experience working with GPUs to develop models
Preferred experience with Natural Language and Cognitive applications
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Fluent in Italian and English
Familiarity with digital marketing or advertising is a plus
Show more

Job Description

  • Apply advanced analytics techniques in a big data paradigm considering multiple data sources

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Familiarity with digital marketing or advertising is a plus

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Saipem is a global leader in the engineering and construction of major projects for the energy and infrastructure sectors, both offshore and onshore. Saipem is “One Company” organized into five business lines - Asset Based Services, Energy Carriers, Offshore Wind, Sustainable Infrastructures, Robotics & Industrialized Solutions. The company has 8 fabrication yards and an offshore fleet of 29 construction vessels (of which 26 owned and 3 owned by third parties and managed by Saipem) and 15 drilling rigs, of which 8 owned. Always oriented towards technological innovation, the company’s purpose is “Engineering for a sustainable future”. As such Saipem is committed to supporting its clients on the energy transition pathway towards Net Zero, with increasingly digital means, technologies and processes geared for environmental sustainability. Listed on the Milan Stock Exchange, it is present in more than 50 countries around the world and employs about 30,000 people of over 120 nationalities.

Always committed to promoting and supporting the values of diversity and inclusion, Saipem confirms its commitment to valuing differences as a source of mutual enrichment. To this end, it promotes and encourages conditions that allow the removal of every obstacle that limits the full expression of people and their complete development within the organization. It protects and guarantees work conditions that respect individual dignity, while promoting a collaborative, harmonious, fair and supportive work environment.

The resource will be part of the important transformation program that involves all Saipem Group and plays a key role in ensuring Digital Transformation projects meet objectives and she/he will govern the data management architectures and the related technology authority methodologies.

The resource will contribute on transformation initiatives related to existing technologies, focusing also on new project digital imprinting leveraging on new technology introduction to meet project requirements.

The Person Will Focus On These Areas


Responsible for designing and evolving of Data Technologies and Data Architecture for the Group.
Identification and selection of new solutions offered by the major Technology Providers.
Ensure that applications and data related services during their evolution are sustainable, maintainable and efficient.
Guide and develop the Data Governance processes and environments, contributing to the definition of the technological and procedural guidelines for the Group.
Guide and develop Machine Learning environment and initiatives.
Design and maintain the lifecycle of data integration and data virtualization tools and services.
Manage project initiatives and govern their delivery.
Support and improve the internal data platform and data ops tools leveraging the new paradigms of data mesh and data fabric.
Ensure that information security risks are properly identified, assessed and managed.



From a Technical Point Of View, Required Knowledges Are


In-depth knowledge of Cloud data platforms and related catalogue offers for the ‘end to end’ design of the data Enterprise architecture.
Excellent knowledge of Informatica, Cloudera and Denodo.
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure environment.
Knowledge of IoT platform and Edge applications will be considered a plus.
Knowledge of cloud computing and the specific features of IaaS, PaaS and SaaS services.
Good knowledge of the Dev & Ops and IAC paradigms and management/evolution of CI / CD pipelines.
Familiarity with relevant data tools and technologies is beneficial. This may include experience with databases (e.g., Sql-and NoSql based databases), data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, PowerBI), and data analysis platforms (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow).
Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL, is highly desirable. Understanding how to write efficient code and work with data-related libraries and frameworks can significantly help.



Competencies / Experience Are


At least 5 years of experience in data management teams, technology system integration or Vendor player and 5 years’ experience in the technology transformation journey and Cloud technologies.
A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline is mandatory together with a strong foundation in STEM subjects.
Experience of working on large-scale software projects.
Fluency in English.
Good communication skills, flexible and adaptable, collaborative, enthusiastic with a high level of energy, self–motivation, resilience, drive and initiative.
Availability to possible business trips.
Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving is crucial. This includes the ability to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization, would be advantageous.
Show more

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
About Viceversa:

Viceversa is an innovative fintech company supported by international investors, envisioning a new way of funding based on transparency and technology to support companies in sustainable and ethical growth.




We are on a very new and exciting journey and looking for talented people that could help us improve our vision and make a significant impact in the financial services sector.




Our investment model relies on our proprietary forecasting algorithms and machine learning models, leveraging data extracted from various API connections to evaluate and monitor the companies we invest in. We are looking for a Data Scientist Intern with a passion for forecasting models, artificial intelligence, and agent-based AI systems.




Main Responsibilities:

·       Learn and contribute to the development and improvement of our forecasting models for financial and business performance analysis.

·       Assist in designing and implementing Generative AI (GenAI) solutions, focusing on AI agents that enhance our decision-making processes.

·       Support the optimization and evaluation of our machine learning models, ensuring accuracy and reliability.

·       Work with large datasets, extracting insights to enhance our predictive analytics and risk assessment capabilities.

·       Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to ensure efficient data pipelines and ETL processes for AI/ML applications.

·       Engage with the Tech and Product teams to integrate AI-powered solutions into our platform.

·       Work closely with the Portfolio Team to translate business needs into actionable AI solutions.




Who We Are Looking For:

·       Academic background in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.

·       Some experience (academic or professional) in working with forecasting models, ML, and AI.

·       Curious and strong analytical mindset, with the ability to tackle complex problems.

·       Passion for Generative AI and AI agents, and eager to explore their application in fintech.

·       A great team player with strong collaboration skills.




Required Skills:

·       Proficiency in Python and its data science ecosystem (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch, etc.).

·       Knowledge of time series forecasting models (ARIMA, Prophet, LSTMs, etc.).

·       Familiarity with Generative AI techniques and frameworks (e.g., LangChain, OpenAI, Hugging Face models).

·       Strong understanding of SQL and ability to work with structured data.

·       Basic understanding of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and cloud-based AI solutions.




Nice to Have:

·       Knowledge of BI tools (e.g., Data Studio, Tableau, Power BI).

·       Experience with financial data analysis or previous exposure to fintech.

·       Hands-on experience with LangChain, AI agents, or AutoGen frameworks.




Working Modality:

·       Hybrid




Terms and Conditions:

·       Salary range based on experience. Our HQ is in Milan, Italy, and we currently meet in the office three times per week.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
More digital. More human. More Minsait.

Siamo una società leader globale nella tecnologia e nella consulenza digitale che collega persone e aziende per generare crescita, trasformazione e impatto positivo e sostenibile.




I nostri valori ci aiutano a creare soluzioni che siano di valore aggiunto per i nostri clienti. Creiamo un impatto tangibile, che faccia la differenza verso clienti e società, apriamo nuove strade innovando i processi in chiave digitale, ci muoviamo con un atteggiamento proattivo e con grande flessibilità, collaborando continuamente con tutti i nostri stakeholders.




Modelliamo il futuro con il nostro ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e promuoviamo la parità di genere, siamo certificati UNI/PdR 125 a sostegno del nostro impegno quotidiano sulla gender equality.




Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Data Scientist per partecipare alla progettazione e l'implementazione di soluzioni software innovative e performanti.




Qual è la sfida che ti proponiamo?

Preparare e studiare i dati ai fini di preparazione dei dataset da usare nei modelli analitici
Effettuare feature engineering
Applicare tecniche di data pre-processing sia su dato strutturato che non strutturato (testi, immagini, video, ecc.)
Individuazione dei modelli analitici migliori da utilizzare in fase di training
Valutazione dell’output dei modelli in fase di training
Deploy in produzione dei modelli analitici realizzati
Guidare team di Data Scientist più junior




Cosa ci aspettiamo?

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nella realizzazione di modelli analitici utilizzando tecniche di Machine-Learning e Deep Learning
Conoscenza del linguaggio Python
Conoscenza delle tecniche di trattamento di testi in ottica NLP
Conoscenza di trattamento immagini tramite OpenCV
Conoscenza delle principali librerie per la creazione di modelli, come Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch
PLUS: Una o più conoscenze delle seguenti tecnologie: Cloudera Machine Learning AWS SageMaker, Azure Machine Learning, Google Vertex AI, Databricks
Esperienza nella conduzione di team di progetto
Ottima conoscenza dell'italiano scritto e parlato
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese scritto e parlato




Sede: Roma/Milano




Perché ti piacerà essere un #Minsaiter:

Work-life balance: abbiamo un modello di lavoro che riflette i principi di flessibilità e autonomia
Carriera professionale in linea col tuo profilo professionale
Formazione continua on the job e mediante accesso alla nostra piattaforma di training, progettata per valorizzare il tuo talento e sviluppare le tue capacità professionali
Contratto a tempo indeterminato e retribuzione competitiva, assicurazione sanitaria, fondo pensionistico, ticket restaurant
Programma di benessere accessibile tramite portale di welfare aziendale e un Employee Assistant Program disponibile 24/7 per te




Minsait, tecnologia per un futuro più umano!

Il nostro impegno è quello di promuovere ambienti di lavoro in cui le persone siano trattate con rispetto e dignità, ricercando lo sviluppo professionale della forza lavoro e garantendo pari opportunità nella loro selezione, formazione e promozione offrendo un ambiente di lavoro libero da qualsiasi discriminazione basata su genere, età, disabilità, orientamento sessuale, identità o espressione di genere, Religione, etnia, stato civile o qualsiasi altra circostanza personale o sociale.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, (L. 903/77 e L.125/91), e a persone di tutte le età nazionalità (d.l. 215/03 e d.l. 216/03).

Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.





About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.




What You'll Do

Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.



Requirements


5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.



Benefits



Working pattern and location

40 hours per week, permanent contract 
Monday - Friday
Hybrid role




Benefits

Meal Vouchers (€7 per working day)
26 days holidays + national bank holidays 
Individual training paths
Opportunity to develop and move within the company
National and international mobility options 
Yearly team activities
Food canteen at the office




MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

  • Meal Vouchers (€7 per working day)
  • 26 days holidays + national bank holidays 
  • Individual training paths
  • Opportunity to develop and move within the company
  • National and international mobility options 
  • Yearly team activities
  • Food canteen at the office


MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Junior – ML & RPA Developer
HTML:
Stiamo cercando una figura Junior da inserire nel team Digital Controls CPP di Deloitte per la sede di Milano e Roma che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business Digital Controls CPP si occupa di fornire servizi di Digital Transformation, che hanno l’obiettivo di supportare la digitalizzazione dei processi di business, mettendo in atto attività che prevedono l’utilizzo di strumenti di Robotic Process Automation, Data Analytics, Machine Learning e AI sfruttando i principali servizi messi a disposizione dai più importanti player del settore dell’automazione di processo e cloud.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:

  • Aiutare nella progettazione e design di soluzioni IT sia di tipo applicativo che di integrazione;
  • Porterà avanti attività di troubleshooting e reverse engineering su soluzioni già implementate;
  • Implementazione di nuovi processi di automazione a partire dall’analisi di requisiti di Business fino al rilascio in produzione dopo opportuni Unit e User Acceptance Test.

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea triennale in informatica o in un campo STEM correlato;
  • Esperienza su progettualità di trasformazione digitale e/o automazione di processo;
  • Forte predisposizione al problem solving e mentalità analitica;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata);
  • Conoscenza dei linguaggi C#, SQL, .Net’;
  • Ottime abilità comunicative nei confronti degli stakeholder di progetto (colleghi, cliente, etc.);
  • Voglia di imparare, propositività e capacità di teamworking.

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

Title: Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Fluency in both Italian and English


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Requirements

Master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Technologies


Programming: Python


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
Show more

Title: Digital & Media - Data Scientist
Description:
Descrizione azienda




JAKALA è un'azienda che lavora su dati, intelligenza artificiale e sviluppo di esperienze per generare un impatto significativo e duraturo a livello globale.

Presenti in oltre 30 città in 21 paesi, i nostri team uniscono competenze su strategia, tecnologia, creatività e operations per offrire esperienze personalizzate e soluzioni trasformative ai nostri clienti, grazie al supporto di dati e intelligenza artificiale. I Jakalers sono un gruppo eterogeneo di oltre 3.000 persone, animate da passione, ambizione e idee brillanti. Proprio questa combinazione unica di talenti è il fattore distintivo che ha ispirato il nostro purpose: Together to get there.




Creare un mondo migliore è il nostro obiettivo ultimo: la nostra ambizione è generare valore per tutti i nostri stakeholder in modo sostenibile, con particolare attenzione a etica, clima e qualità. Nel 2021, abbiamo scelto di diventare una Società Benefit, dimostrando il nostro impegno di lungo periodo e la volontà di proteggere i principi e i valori che ogni giorno guidano le nostre azioni.




Crediamo che la diversità sia la chiave del nostro successo e, per questo, siamo impegnati a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, dove ciascuno possa sentirsi valorizzato per la propria unicità. Tutte le nostre opportunità di lavoro sono aperte ai candidati appartenenti alle categorie protette L.68/99.




Posizione




Per il potenziamento della Business Line Digital & Media ricerchiamo un Data Scientist con ottime capacità di lavoro in squadra, di apprendimento e di problem solving. Come Data Scientist verrai inserito nel Team Data e ti occuperai della progettazione, implementazione, gestione di processi big data e machine learning pipelines lavorando a stretto contatto con Data Engineers e Data Viz specialists.




Ecco un esempio delle attività che seguirai:

Applicazione di modelli di Marketing Mix Model per valutare l'impatto dei canali media sulle vendite;
Applicazione di modelli di Attribuzione per il marketing;
Analisi dei Big Data per i nostri clienti su Data warehouse in Cloud come Google BigQuery o similare;
Applicazione di modelli di segmentazione, clustering, churn della customer base;
Utilizzo di modelli di Generative AI (OpenAI, Google, Open Source) applicati ad use-cases di marketing come creazione e generazione di contenuti, traduzione, generazione di immagini, valorizzazione di know how aziendale;




Requisiti

Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede:




Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Ingegneria o altre discipline scientifiche
Almeno 3-6 anni di esperienza nella progettazione di soluzioni analitiche in ambito gestione e analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics e machine learning
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per la Data Science: Python, SQL, R.
Passione/Interesse per il digital marketing
Familiarità con le principali soluzioni cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) o precedenti esperienze nel digital marketing costituiranno elemento preferenziale.
Capacità di lavorare in team
Buona conoscenza lingua inglese scritta e orale




Nice to have:




Conoscenza di base del framework di elaborazione di Big Data Spark
Precedenti esperienze lavorative nel marketing digitale, inclusa esperienza di consulenza
Esperienza / progetti con librerie di Bayesian Modeling.




Se investi tempo nel nostro percorso di Recruiting, avrai tutto il nostro impegno. E oltre.

La tua candidatura verrà presa in carico da un Recruiter del nostro Team Talent Acquisition, che si prenderà cura di visionare il tuo CV e le informazioni fornite. Sarà poi il tuo Recruiter di riferimento a ricontattarti per condividere il nostro feedback per te, indipendentemente dall’esito. Riceverai in ogni caso suggerimenti di sviluppo legati all’ottimizzazione del tuo CV, spunti per consolidare il tuo percorso di carriera e insight sull’arena competitiva in cui sei inserit*. Niente AI: lo facciamo a mano, col cuore, per te.
Ogni ora che vorrai investire nel conoscere JAKALA te la restituiamo per conoscerti meglio: grazie all’iniziativa “Your Time Back” e la nostra partnership strategica con Unobravo, hai diritto ad un percorso di empowerment di sessioni equivalenti al numero di interviste che hai sostenuto e che potrai spendere come vorrai. Sappiamo che cercare lavoro può essere sfidante: insieme a Unobravo vogliamo esserti vicini, anche se ancora non ci conosciamo.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST




Are you curious and ready to accept a new challenge in your career? Are you eager to join a dynamic company and bring innovation through your work and skills?

Prometeia offers you opportunities for growth and training in a Group with over 1000 professionals working for more than 500 clients in 20 countries around the world.

We are looking for motivated and talented Data Scientists to join our Data Science team. You will have the opportunity to work on complex and innovative projects, using cutting-edge tools and collaborating with high-level professionals to face the challenges of the global financial market. If you are looking for a challenging environment where your curiosity and creativity can make a difference, this is the right opportunity for you.




RESPONSIBILITIES:




● Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data in banking and insurance, identifying useful patterns and insights to support business processes and decisions.

● Design, develop and implement advanced machine learning, data mining and statistical models to solve complex problems in finance.

● Collaborate in cross-functional teams to define project requirements and propose innovative solutions.

● Contribute to the development of proprietary frameworks and algorithms to improve the performance of solutions offered to our clients.

● Present complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders, making analysis results understandable.

● Support customers in implementing solutions, ensuring knowledge transfer and customization.




REQUIREMENTS:




● Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration and feature extraction.

● Excellent knowledge of Python and the most important analytical libraries.

● Knowledge of statistics, Machine Learning and major clustering, classification and regression algorithms

● Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques, predictive modeling with the application of Machine Learning models, and data analysis.

● Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

● Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

● Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

● Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.




NICE TO HAVE:




● Experience with code versioning systems (git).

● Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

● Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

● Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)

● Prior analytical experience in the financial industry




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:




● Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields

● Experience in a corporate setting (including internships), preferably in finance or insurance




LOCATION:

Milan




WHAT WE OFFER:




COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT




Our history, as well as our future, is based on the value of our people. Prometeia’s biggest investment is in our people and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it “Total Compensation” and it is made of three elements: Compensation, consisting of a fixed and a variable component, a Welfare Plan active since 2015 –we were among the first companies in Italy to introduce it–, and Benefits, including all initiatives for the well-being of our people.




REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of our way of working. In Prometeia, remote working is an organizational method based on trust. It results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results through autonomy and empowerment of people.




PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of our people and on continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Within the projects, several moments are dedicated to transparent discussions between managers and team members. This allows for reciprocal and prompt feedback. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the strategic growth of both the individual and the company.




TRAINING

Prometeia means continuous training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. We pay specific attention to younger colleagues, the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important and is made of immediate and direct confrontation with the market.




WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees and you recommend a person who is later hired, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.




PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

We have completely digitalized the management of our physical and virtual environments through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia. Access to the office, remote working, workstations, meeting rooms, carpooling... everything is just a click away.




COMMUNITY

Our Community is highly diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities we actively cooperate with are stakeholders representing a great value for us in terms of trust and collaboration.




DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the recruitment phase to everyday life, promoted also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and uniqueness.




IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, territories and communities we operate in. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards recognizing the efficiency of the building in terms of energy and water savings, CO2 emissions reduction, and improvement of the ecological quality of interiors, materials and resources. In the Sustainability Report we outline the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda drafted by the UN in 2016, that we have been supporting since 2020.

Our Community is highly diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities we actively cooperate with are stakeholders representing a great value for us in terms of trust and collaboration.


DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the recruitment phase to everyday life, promoted also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and uniqueness.


IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, territories and communities we operate in. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards recognizing the efficiency of the building in terms of energy and water savings, CO2 emissions reduction, and improvement of the ecological quality of interiors, materials and resources. In the Sustainability Report we outline the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda drafted by the UN in 2016, that we have been supporting since 2020.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
M.C. Engineering è una società di consulenza specializzata in Information Technology nata agli inizi degli anni Duemila. Con 3 sedi sul territorio nazionale -Torino, Milano, Roma- siamo un partner strategico ad alto contenuto tecnico.

Approccio umanocentrico, competenza e innovazione tecnologica sono gli elementi grazie ai quali guardiamo ad obiettivi ambiziosi, consapevoli di poterli raggiungere.

Desideri sperimentarti in una realtà dinamica e in crescita? Unisciti a noi!

Posizione:

AI Engineer

Requisiti:

  • Diploma tecnico e/o laurea;
  • Gradita esperienza pregressa nell'implementazione di pratiche RAG o nel Chatbot Developement;
  • Buona conoscenza di Python;
  • Buona conoscenza di Google Gemini;
  • Buona conoscenza di Vertex AI;
  • Buona conoscenza dei concetti di AI Generativa e dei principali tool di Deep Learning, quali TensorFlow & PyTorch;
  • Conoscenza di Git, GitHub & Bitbucket;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.

L'attività sarà svolta in modalità Full Remote.

Altre informazioni:

Completano il profilo un'elevata attitudine al lavoro in team, doti di precisione, flessibilità mentale e capacità proattiva nella gestione delle problematiche professionali.

Si offre inserimento in organico con inquadramento commisurato all'esperienza professionale pregressa e retribuzione in linea con le reali capacità del candidato.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei DLgs 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!

WHY JOIN US
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
* Fast-paced, multidisciplinary and supportive environment.
* Global onboarding process.
* Bespoke training and development programs accessible to all.
* Competitive welfare and benefits package.
* International mobility opportunities.
DRIVE YOUR FUTURE
You will be part of an international agile team of data scientists and data engineers. Together you will solve problems and deliver value across R&D, manufacturing, sales & marketing and connected tyres. You will apply statistical analysis and machine-learning techniques to a wide range of data (from sensors, to telemetry, to manufacturing) and you will change how decisions are made across all business units.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES
You will be in charge of coming up with effective and scalable solutions that, leveraging internal and external data, will answer questions such as:
1. How can we optimize our supply chain flow in a particular geographic region?
2. How can we build an effective and scalable real time monitoring system for production quality control?
3. How can we use IoT data to derive crucial insights and deliver impactful results?
4. How to improve B2C services with data-driven solutions?
5. How to drive new product development?
6. How to design personalized campaign based on consumer behavior?

* Translate business questions to data science problems, often exploring data and finding insights
* Develop, tune, and deploy custom, scalable, predictive models
* Present to non-technical stakeholders, even complex concepts, in a simple manner
* Manage a data science product end-to-end from concept to production

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Must-have:
* Excellent knowledge of machine learning models
* Experience in model development (from business question to the model application)
* Advanced knowledge of Python
* Data visualization expertise
Required:
* Advanced knowledge of SQL
* Broad knowledge of statistical learning
* Extensive knowledge of scientific libraries (pandas, scipy, numpy, jupyter), scikit-learn, statsmodels and related machine learning/stats/data mining packages
* Deep knowledge of applied statistics including multivariate statistical analysis, Bayesian statistics, Time Series analysis
* Experience in machine learning model deployment
* Experience with GIT
* Knowledge of CI/CD
Desired skills:
* Experience with deep learning
* Experience in Apache Spark
* Working experience with AWS cloud framework and services
* Experience with Docker
Core skills:
* Ability to effectively communicate findings and rationale behind predictive models implemented to executives and management
* Ability to communicate and collaborate with other team members

WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
* Prior experience using agile and scrum
* Previous experience in professional end-to-end deep learning projects using TensorFlow

APPLY NOW, DRIVE YOUR FUTURE!
#WePirelli
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Il settore manifatturiero è il cuore pulsante dell’economia mondiale con 33 milioni di professionisti in Europa, creando i beni di uso quotidiano. Grazie all'analisi dei dati e all'IA, le opportunità di ottimizzare qualità ed efficienza sono innumerevoli. Qui entra in gioco smartFAB: la nostra piattaforma guida decisioni strategiche, supportando aziende di ogni calibro nella loro evoluzione.




Posizione: Milano, con opzioni flessibili di lavoro remoto.




Il Tuo Ruolo:

Stiamo cercando un Senior Machine Learning Engineer talentuoso e appassionato, dotato di ottime capacità di programmazione, di analisi critica e con esperienza sul Cloud. La figura sarà coinvolta in tutte le fasi del ciclo di vita del prodotto, dallo sviluppo alla consegna al cliente, avendo un ruolo centrale nello svolgimento delle seguenti attività:

Sviluppare, gestire e scalare pipeline di analytics e data.
Migliorare la scalabilità, stabilità, velocità ed efficienza della piattaforma esistente.
Ideare, sviluppare, testare ed implementare estensioni, modelli, librerie, framework o interi sistemi per il nostro sistema principale.
Collaborare con ingegneri e product owner esperti per creare strumenti avanzati per automatizzare la gestione dei dati, le analisi, e la visualizzazione dei risultati.
Interfacciarsi con clienti di diverso livello di esperienza e conoscenza.




Requisiti necessari:

5+ anni di esperienza come Machine Learning Engineer (Python e SQL indispensabile)
5+ anni di esperienza lavorativa nella progettazione, realizzazione e manutenzione di pipeline di dati end-to-end, specificatamente nella gestione di flussi di dati asincroni e orientati agli eventi (eg: Apache Kafka, Celery o SQS).
Esperienza nella creazione di modelli teorici di ottimizzazione.
Familiarità con AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker e Kubernetes.
Ottime conoscenze in data modelling, data preparation, e tecniche di automazione.
Laurea magistrale STEM.
Ottime abilità comunicative e fluente in inglese.




smartFAB offre un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e orientato alla crescita, con un team di persone entusiaste e motivate a raggiungere gli obiettivi e la visione dell'azienda. Se sei appassionato di analisi dati e vuoi unirti a una start-up innovativa che sta cambiando il modo in cui le aziende manifatturiere operano e competono, inviaci il tuo curriculum vitae e una lettera motivazionale.




Unisciti a noi!

Title: R&D Junior Analyst
Description:
Chi siamo:

Doppel Farmaceutici Srl è un’azienda leader nella ricerca, sviluppo, formulazione, produzione e confezionamento farmaci per conto terzi.

Organizzata su due stabilimenti produttivi, Rozzano, in provincia di Milano, e Cortemaggiore, in provincia di Piacenza, Doppel offre un’ottima opportunità per entrare in contatto con un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e sfidante, sia per i professionisti già affermati nel settore e sia per i giovani che stanno maturando la loro prima esperienza lavorativa in azienda.

Passione, energia e dedizione sono solo alcuni dei valori che contraddistinguono Doppel e guidano quotidianamente il lavoro di ogni dipendente.

L’ambiente lavorativo positivo, informale e particolarmente collaborativo consente a ciascun lavoratore di esprimere al meglio le proprie qualità personali e di portare a termine le mansioni quotidiane.

Da settembre 2024, Doppel Farmaceutici, insieme a Mipharm e Alfa Omega, è entrata a far parte del gruppo DMX PHARMA, gruppo leader nel terzismo farmaceutico.




Chi cerchiamo:

Per la divisione R&D, situata sullo stabilimento di Rozzano (MI), si ricerca la figura di uno/a analista da inserire nel laboratorio di Sviluppo Analitico, che andrà a svolgere le seguenti




Principali Attività:

Analisi su materie prime e prodotto finito
Stesura di tutta la documentazione tecnica: protocolli, report di convalida delle nuove metodiche analitiche sviluppate, transfer delle nuove metodiche analitiche provenienti da laboratori esterni e report di sviluppo formulativo dei progetti in svilluppo.




Requisiti richiesti:

Esperienza di almeno 1-2 anni in sviluppo analitico/controllo qualità
Autonomia nello svolgimento delle analisi analitiche e nella predisposizione della relativa documentazione
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta




Cosa offriamo:

Inserimento in un team giovane e dinamico, in cui poter esprimere al meglio le proprie capacità e poter acquisire nuove competenze
Contratto e trattamento economico in linea con l’esperienza pregressa nel ruolo
Orario di lavoro a giornata dalle 8,30 alle 17,00

Title: Data Scientist - Data&AI
HTML:
In Accenture, potrai portare la tua visione innovativa al cuore del cambiamento, lavorando con le aziende più importanti a livello mondiale per trasformare interi settori di mercato. Modella il futuro del business e della tecnologia sviluppando soluzioni all'avanguardia in grado di generare nuovo valore. Il tuo ruolo e le tue prospettive Entra a far parte del nostro network internazionale di talenti Strategy & Consulting in ambito Data&AI. Lavorerai con tecnologie innovative su progetti entusiasmanti, aiutando le aziende leader a livello mondiale a sviluppare le loro strategie IT. In particolare, potrai:


  • Disegnare soluzioni per progetti in ambito Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence e Generative AI;

  • Raccogliere, sintetizzare e analizzare dati complessi sviluppando use-case ad hoc utilizzando il miglior stack tecnologico per generare insight e risultati di valore;

  • Applicare tecniche di Advanced Analytics all’interno di paradigmi Big Data per lo sviluppo e l’implementazione di modelli statistici tradizionali e di Machine Learning da applicare in contesti cross-functional & cross-mercato;

  • Gestire attività progettuali con metodologie di lavoro Agile e Waterfall.


    • Se condividi la nostra passione per la consulenza in ambito Data & AI e hai le seguenti caratteristiche, ti stiamo aspettando:


  • Laurea Magistrale in materie STEM;

  • Da 2 a 5 anni di esperienza in ambito AI per lo sviluppo di modelli di Advanced Analytics (ad es. Time series analysis , Clustering, Classification), Computer Vision, NLP e Generative AI;

  • Ottima conoscenza di Python (in alternativa C++, Java) e delle librerie di Data Science (Pandas, Scikit Learn, Keras, Tensor Flow, Matplotlib, fastapi);

  • Esperienza di almeno un anno nello sviluppo di soluzioni di AI su uno dei maggiori providers di Soluzioni Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google);

  • Conoscenze delle MLOps e delle architetture a microservizi;

  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese.


    • Scopri di più su di noi Accenture è un’azienda globale di servizi professionali con capacità avanzate in campo digitale, cloud e security. Combinando un’esperienza unica e competenze specialistiche in più di 40 settori industriali, fornisce servizi in ambito Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Industry X, Operations e Accenture Song, sostenuta dalla più ampia rete di Advanced Technology e Intelligent Operations centers a livello mondiale. I nostri 742.000 talenti combinano ogni giorno tecnologia e ingegno umano, servendo clienti in oltre 120 Paesi. Se desideri prepararti al meglio al nostro processo di selezione ti invitiamo a consultare la nostra sezione FAQ: https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/explore-careers/area-of-interest/journey-to-accenture Policy Qualora il tuo percorso di selezione andasse a buon fine, avrai la possibilità di aderire all’Accordo di smart working, ove compatibile con l’attività svolta, e lavorare da remoto secondo quanto previsto dalle policy aziendali. Per informazioni sulla nostra protezione della privacy art13 L.679/2016 (GDPR) vai su https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/privacy-policy Accenture garantisce le pari opportunità.

Title: AI Engineer, Internship, Italy - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

You’ll be part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development life cycle
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics
Fluent in English and Italian


What You'll Bring

Requirements

Currently enrolled in a university master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related fields:

Technologies


Programming: Python, Java/Scala
Frameworks/Libraries: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras
Data Processing: NumPy, Pandas, Apache Spark, Dask
Cloud Platforms: AWS (SageMaker, EC2), GCP (AI Platform), Azure (ML Studio)
DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Jenkins
Data Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly/Dash, Tableau
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Google Colab, Git (GitHub/GitLab), MLflow, TensorBoard
Deployment: Flask, FastAPI, TensorFlow Serving, Streamlit


#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Scientist III, Data Sciences
Description:
Work Schedule

First Shift (Days)

Environmental Conditions

Office

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

Location/Division Specific Information

The team focuses on commercial audience generation through audience segmentation, time-to-event analysis, recommendation engines, generative AI, and other forms of predictive modeling. You will work closely with experts throughout the company to develop tailored targeting strategies. Your work will be seen and used by fellow data scientists, collaborators within the business, sales representatives, and customers of Thermo Fisher. You will be expected to learn quickly and offer creative and effective solutions to novel challenges.

You will report to a member of the data science team and operate as a key asset within the Corporate Data Science Center of Excellence, a team comprised of data scientists, data engineers, business analysts, program/product managers, and others.

Key Responsibilities


Identify and embed within business functions throughout the company with high data science potential.
Move quickly to build proof of concepts, scalable solutions, and anything else required to drive business value quickly.
Leverage modern tools and techniques to develop novel insights.
Promote standard methodologies in the field, encompassing data warehousing, performance monitoring, and a balanced approach.
Work with senior members to build novel audience-creation and targeting strategies
Voracious pursuit of knowledge and an unwavering dedication to the scientific process


Keys to Success:

Education


Graduate degree in a quantitative field, such as statistics, economics, mathematics, etc.


Experience


Proven track record (3 to 6 years) applying industry standard data science tools to tackle previously unsolved problems
Ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day oversight


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities


Extensive knowledge and application of the scientific process in industry
Command of statistical topics, including distributions, hypothesis testing, and experiment design.
Sophisticated technical proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and others.
Proficiency with distributed computational frameworks, such as Spark
Foundational understanding in digital marketing, sales operations, and key performance indicators
Fluent English both written and spoken is required.


Show more

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Department

At Sappi, our Digital Transformation team thrives on tackling business challenges by harnessing the power of analytics, AI, and user-centric design. Driven by a passionate group of data and analytics experts, we optimise processes, uncover valuable insights, and empower proactive decision-making to drive success. Join us as we innovate and transform the future

Role and Responsibilities

In this role you will report to the Head of Data Analytics (based in Brussels).

You will be responsible for:

Collaborating with various teams to analyze key business problems and develop innovative ML solutions, continuously delivering valuable output.
Designing and implementing scalable machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions into daily operations.
Establishing testing, monitoring and continuous improvement of ML processes.
Making relevant, detailed, well-structured data available for analytics
Applying data science best practices focusing on data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation. Enable rapid prototyping and evaluation.

Required Qualifications

Experience developing and optimizing scalable machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS).
Strong expertise in ML operations and coding with Python; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, adaptable to both technical and business audiences.
Intellectual curiosity and a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering).
Fluent in English.

Traveling:

It is expected to have some traveling (up to 10%) to the locations of group.

What we offer:

An excellent opportunity to work, learn & grow with us. With our culture of learning & development, you can access thousands of online trainings
A multi-cultural & international environment to share and collaborate with colleagues from more than 68 nationalities in 31 locations globally.
A unique opportunity to join a global wood fibre solution company. We are constantly innovating toward a circular economy working to achieve our sustainability goals & reduce our carbon foot print.
Friendly atmosphere and team-work oriented culture
Work-life balance
Training opportunities

All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neurodiversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique.

Title: AI/NLP/ML Expert (hybrid, Brussels / Belgium)
Description:
We are urgently seeking an AI/NLP/ML Expert willing to join our Client’s team in Brussels, Belgium.

This senior role is designed for a highly experienced professional in the fields of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning (ML) with robust expertise in programming languages, large language models (LLMs), and deploying AI solutions in the cloud. The project demands a hands-on expert who can design, implement, and manage cutting-edge AI solutions in a real-world production environment.

Key Requirements And Expertise

The ideal candidate must meet the following mandatory criteria:

Programming Expertise


15+ years of experience in Java (Competence Level: 5—Expert).
5+ years of experience in Python (Competence Level: 5—Expert).


AI/ML And NLP Skills


3+ years of experience with foundational technologies including:
OpenAPI (Competence Level: 4—Advanced).
LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation), Feature Learning, and Semantic Search (Competence Level: 4—Advanced).
2+ years of experience with LangChain for NLP workflows (Competence Level: 4—Advanced).
3+ years of experience in deploying and managing AI applications and models in public cloud environments (Competence Level: 4—Advanced).


Responsibilities

As an AI/NLP/ML Expert, you will:


Design complex AI/NLP/ML solutions tailored to business needs, ensuring scalability, security, and operational efficiency.
Develop and maintain AI solutions and APIs using Java and Python.
Leverage LangChain, OpenAPI, and LLMs for cutting-edge enhancements such as semantic search and feature learning.
Deploy and manage AI/NLP/ML models in public cloud environments, optimizing performance and ensuring operational robustness.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to ensure alignment of AI functionalities with organizational goals.
Act as a thought leader and mentor, driving the adoption of best practices in AI/ML development and deployment.


Required Attributes And Competencies


Demonstrated ability to conceptualize, implement, and manage AI applications across diverse domains.
Proven expertise in semantic search, retrieval-augmented generation, and cutting-edge NLP tools.
Strong programming proficiency in Java and Python with a keen eye for optimized code and robust implementations.
Solid hands-on experience with LangChain and deploying AI/ML models in public cloud infrastructures like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Deep familiarity with OpenAPI specifications for seamless integration of APIs in AI systems.
Strong analytical problem-solving skills to tackle complex real-world problems using AI/NLP/ML.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills to collaborate with technical teams and business leaders effectively.


About Us

Join a dynamic organization that values innovation, expertise, and continuous learning. As a key contributor to cutting-edge AI/NLP/ML initiatives, you will have the chance to work on impactful projects, challenge your technical expertise, and grow in a highly collaborative environment.

Skills: retrieval augmented generation,nlp,semantic search,machine learning,cloud,cloud deployment (aws, azure, google cloud),natural language processing,large language models,langchain,java,python,ai,ml,openapi

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
О компании и проекте:

Компания-разработчик всемирно известного браузера в поисках специалиста Data Scientist.

Продукт компании стал символом безопасности и инноваций, завоевав доверие миллионов пользователей по всему миру. Он позволяет скрывать информацию о посещаемых страницах, блокировать трекеры и рекламу, а также оснащен инновационной функцией VPN.

Присоединившись к международной команде, вы станете частью ее главной миссии, а Ваш вклад будет важным шагом в создании совершенного продукта, который делает Интернет безопасным и удобным местом для каждого пользователя.

Компания предлагает возможность долгосрочного сотрудничества, где вы сможете развиваться вместе с ней и принести свой вклад в развитие продукта мирового значения.

Вам предлагается удаленное сотрудничество или работа в офисе компании на Кипре, где Вы сможете наслаждаться не только работой, но и потрясающей культурой и теплым климатом.

Задачи на позиции:


Решение прикладных бизнес-задач, связанных с развитием продукта и улучшением пользовательского опыта
Участие в создании инновационного решения: масштабный, многопрофильный проект с использованием современных технологий, таких как computer vision, ML Ops, LLM
Вклад в разработку творческих и комплексных инструментов, направленных на достижение стратегических целей компании



Requirements


1-2+ года опыта в data science / machine learning
Глубокое теоретическое понимание современных архитектур машинного обучения, особенно transformers и neural networks
Подтвержденный опыт разработки и внедрения моделей машинного обучения в производственных средах
Опыт в области математического моделирования и оптимизации
Степень магистра в области прикладной математики, информатики, физики
Английский B1+



Будет плюсом, если у Вас есть:


Опыт развертывания модели на устройстве для мобильных платформ (iOS/Android)
Практический опыт с методами оптимизации моделей (quantization, pruning, distillation)
Опыт в обучении и тонкой настройке LLM
Опыт разработки и внедрения рекомендательных систем
Опыт работы с ограниченными ресурсами ML-сред (edge devices, tiny LLMs)
Понимание технологий обслуживания моделей ML (например, vLLM)



Benefits

Достойная официальная заработная плата, основанная на вашей квалификации и опыте до 5000 EUR gross

100% удаленка или работа в офисе в центре Лимассола, на Кипре

21 рабочий день отпуска + 10 рабочих больничных дней "без справок"

Карьерный рост и профессиональное развитие в быстрорастущем проекте
Show more

  • Участие в создании инновационного решения: масштабный, многопрофильный проект с использованием современных технологий, таких как computer vision, ML Ops, LLM
  • Вклад в разработку творческих и комплексных инструментов, направленных на достижение стратегических целей компании


Requirements

  • 1-2+ года опыта в data science / machine learning
  • Глубокое теоретическое понимание современных архитектур машинного обучения, особенно transformers и neural networks
  • Подтвержденный опыт разработки и внедрения моделей машинного обучения в производственных средах
  • Опыт в области математического моделирования и оптимизации
  • Степень магистра в области прикладной математики, информатики, физики
  • Английский B1+


Будет плюсом, если у Вас есть:

  • Опыт развертывания модели на устройстве для мобильных платформ (iOS/Android)
  • Практический опыт с методами оптимизации моделей (quantization, pruning, distillation)
  • Опыт в обучении и тонкой настройке LLM
  • Опыт разработки и внедрения рекомендательных систем
  • Опыт работы с ограниченными ресурсами ML-сред (edge devices, tiny LLMs)
  • Понимание технологий обслуживания моделей ML (например, vLLM)


Benefits

Достойная официальная заработная плата, основанная на вашей квалификации и опыте до 5000 EUR gross

100% удаленка или работа в офисе в центре Лимассола, на Кипре

21 рабочий день отпуска + 10 рабочих больничных дней "без справок"

Карьерный рост и профессиональное развитие в быстрорастущем проекте

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the Company

Our client is an innovative real estate company committed to enhancing the way people interact with the real estate market. Their mission is to leverage cutting-edge technology to provide exceptional user experiences. They are building a state-of-the-art large language model (LLM) function for their website to revolutionize customer interactions and simplify property searches.




Role Overview

The client is seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to develop, implement, and optimize a large language model for their platform. The role involves creating intelligent, user-focused solutions that transform the Real Estate experience. This position is fully remote, requiring availability during EU business hours.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy LLM-based features tailored to the client's real estate platform.
Implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to enhance LLM performance and relevance.
Fine-tune pre-trained models (e.g., GPT, Llama, etc.) to meet specific business and user needs.
Integrate LLM capabilities into the client's website to enable natural language search, chatbot functionality, and personalized property recommendations.
Collaborate with front-end and back-end development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI-powered solutions.
Optimize model performance for speed, accuracy, and cost-efficiency.
Conduct thorough testing and validation to ensure reliability and scalability.
Stay informed of the latest advancements in machine learning and natural language processing.




Key Skills & Qualifications

Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning and NLP models, particularly large language models.
Strong expertise in Python and ML frameworks/libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face Transformers.
Hands-on experience with fine-tuning pre-trained LLMs for specific applications.
Knowledge of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and its implementation.
Familiarity with APIs and integration of AI solutions into web applications.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for deploying ML models.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a results-driven approach.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in remote team environments.
