Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist to support our financial analytics and machine learning initiatives in Brussels. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will apply data science, AI, and predictive modeling to enhance financial decision-making, risk assessment, and customer insights.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning models for financial forecasting, risk analysis, and fraud detection.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large financial datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, ensuring quality and consistency.
Build and optimize predictive models, including time-series forecasting, credit scoring, and anomaly detection.
Automate data pipelines and improve data workflows for real-time analytics.
Collaborate with finance, risk, compliance, and IT teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Create clear visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or R for data science and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of financial statistics, risk modeling, and time-series analysis.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for deploying and monitoring ML models.

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated and able to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail, especially regarding financial data accuracy.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, insurance, fintech).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Experience in credit risk modeling, fraud detection, and algorithmic trading.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or email me directly at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization’s infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am currently searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to join my client in Belgium on a payroll basis.




The ideal candidate will have knowledge of Python, Machine Learning and Java (Spring Boot).




**This position is also open to fully remote candidates based in the CET time-zone**




Your Role:

Architect and Develop ML Integration: Design and implement the software architecture for machine learning integration within the product.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with stakeholders (product owners, data scientists, architects, front-end engineers) to align user requirements and standards with technical specifications and integration strategies.
Back-End Oversight: Lead the design and review of back-end systems, including data access layers, ensuring seamless functionality and scalability.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on emerging tech (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Azure ML) to refine back-end architecture and enhance ML integration capabilities.







Required Skills:

Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Technical Expertise:
Strong experience in software architecture and engineering.
Skilled in Python and Java (Spring Boot).
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and OOP.
Proficient in machine learning concepts and tools.
Solid knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and RESTful API design.
Work Environment: Agile/Scrum experience with a collaborative mindset.
Communication: Clear articulation of technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




The Offer:

What We Offer:

Exciting Opportunities: Be part of a dynamic, fast-growing company in the industrial analytics space, working with a global team of experts in data science, software engineering, and industrial automation.
Competitive Benefits: Attractive salary, benefits package, and a company car or mobility budget.
Top-Tier Equipment: Developer laptop (MacBook Pro).
Flexibility: Work remotely up to 60% or fully remote if outside Belgium, with flexible working hours and a strong focus on work/life balance.
Prime Location: Access to a modern office at the Corda Campus in Hasselt.
Career Growth: Expand your skills and advance your career in a fast-expanding company with state-of-the-art tools and a visionary approach.
Supportive Environment: Collaborative, open-minded culture that encourages personal and professional development.
Learning Opportunities: Personal learning and development budget, company-managed, and external training opportunities.

Title: Research Engineer - AI - $100k
Description:
We offer a unique opportunity to join a early stage startup, in San Francisco (USA), dedicated to accelerating progress in decentralized AI.




Their mission is to enable global contributions of compute, code, and capital to create cutting-edge, openly accessible AI models. By advancing these technologies, they aim to democratize AI development and make its benefits available to everyone.




They've recently secured a $5.5 million seed round from leading investors and are looking for innovative thinkers to help shape the future of decentralized AI.




Our partner is seeking a Research Engineer to join their team focused on mid-training processes. This role involves shaping technical strategies, optimizing compute usage, and advancing synthetic data solutions.




Core Responsibilities:

Lead research to develop large-scale synthetic data generation pipelines and orchestration solutions.
Optimize AI inference workloads for performance, cost, and resource efficiency using the latest techniques.
Contribute to open-source tools for synthetic data generation and mid-training frameworks.
Publish research at leading AI conferences, including ICML and NeurIPS.
Communicate technical outcomes through blogs tailored for developers and customers.
Stay at the forefront of AI/ML tools and infrastructure, driving platform improvements.




What They Require:

Strong expertise in AI/ML engineering, with experience building pipelines for large-scale model training or inference.
Knowledge of distributed inference frameworks and performance optimization techniques.
Proficiency in MLOps, including model versioning and CI/CD pipelines.




What They Value:

Passion for synthetic data generation and making AI accessible to researchers and developers.
High energy and eagerness to learn and contribute to new areas of development.




Perks:

$80k to $100k with equity and token incentives.
Flexible work options, including remote or in-office opportunities.
Visa sponsorship and relocation assistance for eligible candidates.

Show more
HTML:
We offer a unique opportunity to join a early stage startup, in San Francisco (USA), dedicated to accelerating progress in decentralized AI.


Their mission is to enable global contributions of compute, code, and capital to create cutting-edge, openly accessible AI models. By advancing these technologies, they aim to democratize AI development and make its benefits available to everyone.


They've recently secured a $5.5 million seed round from leading investors and are looking for innovative thinkers to help shape the future of decentralized AI.


Our partner is seeking a Research Engineer to join their team focused on mid-training processes. This role involves shaping technical strategies, optimizing compute usage, and advancing synthetic data solutions.


Core Responsibilities:

  • Lead research to develop large-scale synthetic data generation pipelines and orchestration solutions.
  • Optimize AI inference workloads for performance, cost, and resource efficiency using the latest techniques.
  • Contribute to open-source tools for synthetic data generation and mid-training frameworks.
  • Publish research at leading AI conferences, including ICML and NeurIPS.
  • Communicate technical outcomes through blogs tailored for developers and customers.
  • Stay at the forefront of AI/ML tools and infrastructure, driving platform improvements.


What They Require:

  • Strong expertise in AI/ML engineering, with experience building pipelines for large-scale model training or inference.
  • Knowledge of distributed inference frameworks and performance optimization techniques.
  • Proficiency in MLOps, including model versioning and CI/CD pipelines.


What They Value:

  • Passion for synthetic data generation and making AI accessible to researchers and developers.
  • High energy and eagerness to learn and contribute to new areas of development.


Perks:

  • $80k to $100k with equity and token incentives.
  • Flexible work options, including remote or in-office opportunities.
  • Visa sponsorship and relocation assistance for eligible candidates.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Bij Customaite transformeren we de douanemarkt met een robuust AI SaaS-product om douaneaangiften te versnellen. Ons product heeft het vertrouwen gewonnen van toonaangevende bedrijven in de logistieke sector, en we zijn klaar om dit verder op te schalen.

Vanuit Leuven werken we met een klein, dynamisch team en omarmen we een echte start-up mentaliteit, terwijl we profiteren van de middelen en expertise van ons moederbedrijf AE.




Als Machine Learning Engineer speel je een cruciale rol in de AI-systemen die ons product aandrijven om automatisch douaneaangiften voor te bereiden.




Wat is je focus?

Je werkt samen met je team aan nieuwe algoritmes en modellen voor gegevensextractie.
Je past onze bestaande algoritmes aan en optimaliseert ze voor meer efficiëntie en kwaliteit.
Je implementeert schaalbare Machine Learning modellen in onze productieomgeving.
Je verkent nieuwe technologieën om ons groeiende product vooruit te helpen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt een master diploma in Computerwetenschappen (of equivalent) met een specialisatie in AI.
Je hebt sterke software engineering skills.
Je hebt een product- en start-up mentaliteit, met een drive voor ondernemerschap en ownership.
Je hebt ervaring met Python en cloudtechnologie.
Je hebt ervaring met het implementeren van ML modellen in productieomgevingen.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in Intelligent Document Processing projecten met behulp van NLP.
Je wil deel uitmaken van een productteam en bijdragen aan de toekomst van ons product.
Je beheerst het Nederlands goed, aangezien ons team in Leuven werkt en voornamelijk Nederlands spreekt.




Wat biedt Customaite jou?

Een uitdagende rol in een dynamische werkomgeving met veel ruimte voor initiatief.
Direct zichtbare impact op het product.
Een mensgerichte organisatie met een collegiale atmosfeer.
Een hybride werksysteem met veel flexibiliteit.




Zie jij jezelf in deze rol?




Reageer vandaag nog of solliciteer via deze pagina (AE - Machine Learning Engineer) en ontdek hoe jij een verschil kunt maken bij Customaite. Heb je vragen over de job, ons sollicitatieproces of onze unieke bedrijfscultuur? Neem contact op via onze Recruitment Lead voor Customaite: julie.vandenbossche@ae.be

 

Bij Customaite houden we van een persoonlijke aanpak en korte lijnen. Of je nu digitaal of fysiek langskomt, we kijken ernaar uit om je te ontmoeten!

Show more

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - AI/ML (Previous pharmaceuticals experience)

Fully remote - Europe based

1 Year contract




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement AI/ML models for pharmaceutical applications (e.g., drug discovery, biomarker identification, patient stratification).
Work with large-scale clinical, genomic, and real-world datasets to derive insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including biostatisticians and researchers.
Optimize data pipelines and ensure model reproducibility.
Stay updated with industry trends and regulatory considerations in AI-driven healthcare.
Develop and implement NLP and Generative AI products using LLMs.
Identify key LLM/NLP use cases with stakeholders.




Requirements:

Strong experience in AI/ML, deep learning, and statistical modeling.
Background in pharmaceuticals, biotech, or healthcare data.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, and data visualization tools.
Knowledge of best practices in code generation, documentation, data security, and compliance in cloud-based workflows.
Ability to work independently and communicate insights effectively.

Show more

  • Background in pharmaceuticals, biotech, or healthcare data.
  • Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, and data visualization tools.
  • Knowledge of best practices in code generation, documentation, data security, and compliance in cloud-based workflows.

Title: Data Scientist Senior - H/F (CDI)
Description:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Metrum est une société spécialisée dans l'accompagnement des entreprises dans leur transformation digitale, l'excellence opérationnelle et la gestion du changement. Forts de plus de 20 ans d'expérience, nous aidons nos clients à relever les défis technologiques de demain grâce à des expertises solides en développement, intégration de solutions, gestion de performance, transformation digitale et gouvernance des données. Chez Metrum, nous valorisons la collaboration, l'innovation et une culture d'entreprise conviviale où chaque talent peut s'épanouir.

Si vous êtes passionné par la technologie et motivé par l'excellence, rejoignez notre équipe pour un rôle clé dans l'accompagnement stratégique de nos clients !

Votre rôle

En tant que Data Scientist Senior, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l'exploitation des données pour transformer les enjeux stratégiques de nos clients en solutions concrètes et innovantes. Vous interviendrez dans toutes les étapes du cycle de vie des projets Data Science, en apportant une expertise technique approfondie et une vision stratégique.

Vos principales missions incluront  :2. Analyse et exploration des données3. Développement de modèles avancés4. Collaboration pour l'industrialisation des solutions5. Veille technologique et innovation6. Encadrement et partage de connaissances


Compréhension et analyse des besoins métiers
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes métiers et décisionnaires pour comprendre leurs défis et objectifs stratégiques
Traduire les problématiques métiers en cas d'usage concrets et en solutions analytiques exploitables
Identifier les opportunités de création de valeur grâce à l'exploitation des données (optimisation, automatisation, personnalisation, etc.)
Effectuer des analyses exploratoires approfondies pour identifier des tendances, anomalies ou patterns dans les données (data profiling)
Évaluer la qualité et la pertinence des données disponibles en vue de leur utilisation dans des modèles ou algorithmes
Mettre en œuvre des techniques avancées de visualisation pour communiquer efficacement les insights aux parties prenantes
Concevoir, implémenter et optimiser des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs pour répondre aux problématiques métiers (régression, classification, clustering, optimisation, etc.)
Travailler sur des projets d'IA générative pour des cas d'usage tels que l'exploitation de capital intellectuel, automatisation intelligente,etc
Tester et valider la robustesse des modèles (ex : cross-validation, performance metrics) et ajuster les paramètres pour améliorer leur précision et fiabilité
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de data engineers et data architects pour industrialiser les modèles développés
Participer à la mise en place de pipelines de données automatisés pour le déploiement et la maintenance des solutions de Data Science
Garantir l'intégration des modèles dans les systèmes existants, avec une attention particulière à la scalabilité et à la performance
Assurer une veille active sur les technologies émergentes, outils et frameworks en Data Science et IA
Explorer de nouvelles méthodes ou approches pour améliorer les performances des modèles ou répondre à des problématiques complexes
Participer à des conférences, meetups ou formations pour rester à la pointe des avancées dans le domaine
Encadrer et accompagner les data scientists plus juniors dans leur montée en compétences, tant sur les aspects techniques que méthodologiques
Encourager la collaboration et la création d'une dynamique d'apprentissage au sein de l'équipe



Requirements

Votre profil

Vous êtes doté(e) d'une solide expertise en Data Science et faites preuve d'un esprit analytique et d'un excellent sens relationnel. Voici les qualités et compétences recherchées :


Formation et expérience : Diplômé(e) Bac+5 en Management, Économie, Ingénieur, Mathématiques, Physique ou similaire avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist, idéalement dans différents secteurs, notamment l'industrie
Compétences techniques indispensables :
Maîtrise des concepts de probabilité et statistiques
Maîtrise de la modélisation en machine learning, optimisation, IA generative et traitement de séries de temps
Excellente maîtrise de Python et/ou R pour l'analyse de données
Expérience avec des frameworks de machine learning : scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL et NoSQL
Compétences complémentaires qui représentent un plus :
Connaissance en manipulation de grandes masses de données et en programmation (Javascript, Spark, C)
Expérience avec des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) et des outils Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Capacités analytiques et organisationnelles : Aptitude à analyser des processus complexes et à vulgariser des résultats d'analyse
Polyvalence linguistique : Excellentes compétences en français et en anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit. La maîtrise d'autres langues (allemand, luxembourgeois) est un plus
Soft skills : Autonomie, esprit d'équipe, bonne communication


Benefits

Pourquoi rejoindre Metrum ?


Une entreprise à taille humaine qui valorise le travail en équipe et le développement personnel
L'opportunité de contribuer à des projets stratégiques et innovants
Un cadre collaboratif, bienveillant et stimulant pour progresser dans votre carrière
Une culture qui prône l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle


Envie de relever le défi ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature dès maintenant et intégrez une équipe passionnée où votre expertise sera pleinement reconnue !
Show more

  • Encourager la collaboration et la création d'une dynamique d'apprentissage au sein de l'équipe

Votre profil

Vous êtes doté(e) d'une solide expertise en Data Science et faites preuve d'un esprit analytique et d'un excellent sens relationnel. Voici les qualités et compétences recherchées :

  • Formation et expérience : Diplômé(e) Bac+5 en Management, Économie, Ingénieur, Mathématiques, Physique ou similaire avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist, idéalement dans différents secteurs, notamment l'industrie
  • Compétences techniques indispensables :
    • Maîtrise des concepts de probabilité et statistiques
    • Maîtrise de la modélisation en machine learning, optimisation, IA generative et traitement de séries de temps
    • Excellente maîtrise de Python et/ou R pour l'analyse de données
    • Expérience avec des frameworks de machine learning : scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch
    • Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL et NoSQL

    • Expérience avec des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) et des outils Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)

  • Soft skills : Autonomie, esprit d'équipe, bonne communication

Benefits

Pourquoi rejoindre Metrum ?

  • Une entreprise à taille humaine qui valorise le travail en équipe et le développement personnel
  • L'opportunité de contribuer à des projets stratégiques et innovants
  • Un cadre collaboratif, bienveillant et stimulant pour progresser dans votre carrière

Title: Junior Data Scientist (B2B SaaS in Brussels)
Description:
Join Novable, a pioneering force in corporate innovation. We connect startups with the industrial power of corporations to drive meaningful transformation.

Goal

Grow and maintain our cutting-edge database of innovative companies. Improve our Deep Matching technology to match the right startups with client needs.

Key Responsibilities


Work on R&D projects to improve smart crawlers through the use of LLM Agents
Develop efficient data processing pipelines
Develop evaluation processes for quality improvement
Improve our Deep Matching algorithm


Environment


Be part of a forward-thinking company with an inspiring mission to connect innovation with industrial power for global transformation.
Grow your skills by tackling challenging projects with real business impact.
Enjoy a fun work environment in Brussels, surrounded by passionate professionals committed to making an impact.


Profile


Strong Python skills
Familiar with MySQL and MongoDB
Passionate about generative AI and machine learning techniques
Familiar with Python API frameworks: Django, Flask, …
You love to solve problems, you can troubleshoot complex issues
Fun to work with, we take the sense of humour very seriously
Perfectly fluent in EN
Bonus: experience with AWS or other cloud provider


NOVABLE VISION: ENABLE INNOVATION THROUGH STARTUP RELATIONS

Novable is a tech startup active in the corporate innovation space, providing a startup scouting solution made of advanced technology software and dedicated analyst reviews. In particular, Novable develops an advanced AI-based technology to scout and match startups.

Startups have the innovation power - We believe that startup ecosystems (entrepreneurs, startups, scaleups, hubs, accelerators, venture capital funds) are a glimpse of the future, as they crystallize the forefront of technology innovation everywhere in the world. They are the crystal ball to anticipate future industry trends.

Corporations have the industrial power - On the other side, we believe that corporations have the necessary resources to get things done and to put the best ideas at work on a global scale. In that sense, it is critical that they collaborate with startups, not only for themselves, not only for their survival but also for the greater good of humanity on this planet.

Bring the best of those two worlds together - We are technology optimists. We believe that tech innovation can contribute to solving major societal issues and world problems, provided that enough industrial power is injected into the process. We envision a world where innovation and industry powers connect seamlessly and globally, to speed up the world’s transformation.

Novable mission is to enable innovation through startup relations, by connecting the brightest minds from the startup ecosystem with the strong industrial ambitions of the business world. We allow corporations and companies to identify the most suitable, enterprise-ready innovations matching their strategic agenda.
Show more

  • Be part of a forward-thinking company with an inspiring mission to connect innovation with industrial power for global transformation.
  • Grow your skills by tackling challenging projects with real business impact.
  • Enjoy a fun work environment in Brussels, surrounded by passionate professionals committed to making an impact.

Profile

  • Strong Python skills
  • Familiar with MySQL and MongoDB
  • Passionate about generative AI and machine learning techniques
  • Familiar with Python API frameworks: Django, Flask, …
  • You love to solve problems, you can troubleshoot complex issues
  • Fun to work with, we take the sense of humour very seriously
  • Perfectly fluent in EN
  • Bonus: experience with AWS or other cloud provider

NOVABLE VISION: ENABLE INNOVATION THROUGH STARTUP RELATIONS

Novable is a tech startup active in the corporate innovation space, providing a startup scouting solution made of advanced technology software and dedicated analyst reviews. In particular, Novable develops an advanced AI-based technology to scout and match startups.

Startups have the innovation power - We believe that startup ecosystems (entrepreneurs, startups, scaleups, hubs, accelerators, venture capital funds) are a glimpse of the future, as they crystallize the forefront of technology innovation everywhere in the world. They are the crystal ball to anticipate future industry trends.

Corporations have the industrial power - On the other side, we believe that corporations have the necessary resources to get things done and to put the best ideas at work on a global scale. In that sense, it is critical that they collaborate with startups, not only for themselves, not only for their survival but also for the greater good of humanity on this planet.

Bring the best of those two worlds together - We are technology optimists. We believe that tech innovation can contribute to solving major societal issues and world problems, provided that enough industrial power is injected into the process. We envision a world where innovation and industry powers connect seamlessly and globally, to speed up the world’s transformation.

Novable mission is to enable innovation through startup relations, by connecting the brightest minds from the startup ecosystem with the strong industrial ambitions of the business world. We allow corporations and companies to identify the most suitable, enterprise-ready innovations matching their strategic agenda.

Title: AI/ML Software Engineer
Description:
Are you looking for a new opportunity to take your career to a higher orbit? To join an international group with a successful track record in Space Engineering? A job adapted to your career ambitions and in which you could have an impact for the years to come.




We’re seeking a talented AI/ML Software Engineer to work at our office in Diegem, near Brussels, Belgium.




Your initial mission will be to develop, implement, and maintain advanced machine learning models and algorithms to drive data analysis and predictive capabilities for the in-orbit early demonstration of the European RF Spectrum Monitoring System.




Tasks and activities

The scope of work will include:

Develop, implement, and maintain advanced machine learning models and algorithms to drive data analysis and predictive capabilities within the organization.
Work closely with data scientists to integrate machine learning models into data pipelines. Enhance data quality and structure to facilitate effective model training and validation.
Utilize embedded software knowledge to optimize data collection and transmission in IoT devices and other hardware interfaces.
Apply knowledge of SDR technologies to process and analyze radio frequency signals within the data engineering framework.
Support space mission operations by developing and implementing data engineering solutions tailored to space-related data processing needs.




Skills and experience

The following skills and experience are mandatory:

University Degree or equivalent in Computer science or a relevant field.
Strong understanding of machine learning principles, algorithms, and frameworks.
Proven experience in data science, including statistical analysis, data modelling, and machine learning.
Knowledge of embedded software development and hardware-software integration.
Familiarity with SDR technologies and their application in signal processing.
Previous experience in space operations, preferably in data engineering or related fields.
Experience with writing requirements, design documentation, and test documentation.
Desire to work both autonomously and as part of a team, in an international multicultural environment.
Solution oriented mindset, with a customer focused communication skill.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.




The following skills and experience would be highly desirable:

Proficient in programming languages such as Python, Java, Scala, and SQL.
Deep understanding of databases, both relational and NoSQL, including design, implementation, and optimization.
Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, and Hive.
Familiarity with ETL tools such as Apache Nifi, Talend, and Apache Airflow.
Strong understanding of distributed systems and fault tolerance.
Knowledge of data warehousing solutions and data architecture.
Ability to develop and maintain data pipelines for real-time and batch processing.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Strong collaboration and communication skills.
Knowledge of space system engineering and design methodologies.
Knowledge of industry standards ECSS.




Why should you apply?

You will have the opportunity to work within leading space organisations across Europe.
We encourage everyone to think outside the box and to push the boundaries of traditional knowledge. This role is an opportunity to join a forward-thinking company and allows for a deeper understanding of the industry.
To be part of a company that values integrity, inspiration, care and collaboration.
Benefits include: competitive remuneration packages; unique career opportunities, including working in other countries; access to training and development programmes; flexible relocation support.
We welcome applications from people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, all genders, LGBTQ+ individuals and ex-service personnel.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.







Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!




At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you ready to learn fast and have a real impact in your job?




Join Odoo, a growing software company with an open source product,

a huge global community, as well as a fun and exciting work environment.




We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our FP&A team. This person will play a strategic role in making the most of transactional data. Our Data Scientist will improve efficiency, anticipate risks, and make informed decisions to optimize commercial and financial operations.




We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our Finance department. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in analysing large datasets, identifying patterns, and developing predictive models to enhance our FP&A department.

You will analyse transaction data, such as purchases, payments or transfers, to detect trends and patterns. Another key role is to optimise transaction processes to improve efficiency. For example, by analysing processing times, bottlenecks or transaction failure rates, you will suggest adjustments to smooth operations and reduce costs.

You'll build cash flow or revenue forecasting models based on historical transaction trends. These forecasts will help Odoo to better manage their budget and anticipate their cash flow needs. You'll monitor transaction performance, in terms of success rate, turnaround time, and customer satisfaction. Thanks to these analyses, Odoo will be able to adjust its strategies to improve the overall performance of its transactional services.

Your work will directly impact our ability to deliver secure, efficient, and optimized analysis within our company.




Programming Languages: Python
Database: SQL
Machine learning models: regression, classification, clustering
Framework: Odoo (ORM, Workflows, Report Engine, BI, AI)







Responsibilities:

Create complex and custom data models in Odoo, often working with financial, accounting, and other enterprise data. Compile, normalize, and analyse disparate datasets to help solve problems.
Help improve efficiency in processing large quantities of data by automating repeatable processes
Perform advanced querying techniques in SQL (and other database languages) to profile, summarize, make sense of, and trace information across systems
Assist with drafting reports, presentations, and other deliverables to create dashboards in Odoo to present analytics-driven insights to internal teams
Communicate effectively to all levels of engagement management and externally







Must Have

Master Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
1+ year of experience in data science, with a focus on the transaction services
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or SQL
Good Communication
Attention to Detail
Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to the success of cross-functional projects
Excellent command of English







Nice to have

Experience in the financial services or transaction services industry
Demonstrated experience in programming or contributing to large codebases
Knowledge of statistical methods, data mining, and predictive analytics
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards in the transaction services industry
Knowledge of transaction processing systems, or financial services is highly desirable

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Freelance AI Engineer (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are looking for a skilled Freelance AI Engineer to work closely with our data team and drive AI-powered innovations in the financial sector. Based in Brussels, this 12-month contract involves collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI models for fraud detection, risk assessment, and automated financial decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data team (data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers) to build and deploy AI-driven financial solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning and deep learning models for risk management, fraud detection, algorithmic trading, and credit scoring.
Optimize AI models for real-time financial applications while ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Work with big data platforms to process large-scale structured and unstructured financial datasets.
Develop and maintain end-to-end AI pipelines, including data ingestion, model training, and deployment.
Deploy AI models using MLOps best practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, and retraining).
Ensure AI solutions comply with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for scalable AI deployment.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve financial analytics and decision-making.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or C++ for AI/ML development.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience in AI model deployment using Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases for working with financial data.
Familiarity with big data processing technologies (Apache Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Experience in cloud computing (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).
Solid understanding of MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow).

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset.
Ability to collaborate effectively with data scientists, analysts, and engineers.
Excellent communication skills to explain AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, with a focus on model accuracy and ethical AI considerations.

Preferred Experience

Prior experience in the financial sector (banking, fintech, insurance).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II) as they relate to AI.
Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT), robo-advisors, or automated financial systems is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or directly email me at adam@kodastaff.com

Show more
HTML:
Freelance AI Engineer (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are looking for a skilled Freelance AI Engineer to work closely with our data team and drive AI-powered innovations in the financial sector. Based in Brussels, this 12-month contract involves collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI models for fraud detection, risk assessment, and automated financial decision-making.


Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the data team (data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers) to build and deploy AI-driven financial solutions.
  • Design, develop, and implement machine learning and deep learning models for risk management, fraud detection, algorithmic trading, and credit scoring.
  • Optimize AI models for real-time financial applications while ensuring scalability and efficiency.
  • Work with big data platforms to process large-scale structured and unstructured financial datasets.
  • Develop and maintain end-to-end AI pipelines, including data ingestion, model training, and deployment.
  • Deploy AI models using MLOps best practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, and retraining).
  • Ensure AI solutions comply with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
  • Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for scalable AI deployment.
  • Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve financial analytics and decision-making.


Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

  • Strong proficiency in Python or C++ for AI/ML development.
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
  • Hands-on experience in AI model deployment using Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases for working with financial data.
  • Familiarity with big data processing technologies (Apache Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
  • Experience in cloud computing (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).
  • Solid understanding of MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow).

Soft Skills

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with data scientists, analysts, and engineers.
  • Excellent communication skills to explain AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Detail-oriented, with a focus on model accuracy and ethical AI considerations.

Preferred Experience

  • Prior experience in the financial sector (banking, fintech, insurance).
  • Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II) as they relate to AI.
  • Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT), robo-advisors, or automated financial systems is a plus.


Contract Details

  • Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
  • Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
  • Type: Freelance Contract
  • Start Date: ASAP
  • Compensation: Competitive, based on experience


If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or directly email me at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
To reinforce our Benelux Data Office department, Allianz is currently looking for a Data Scientist. Are you looking for a role where you can be at the forefront of using cutting-edge data analytics techniques to drive strategic decisions and provide innovative solutions for business challenges? Join us at Allianz and be part of our dynamic team that leverages data science to drive innovation and make a meaningful impact in the insurance sector!




As a Data Scientist at Allianz, you will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions to support decision-making systems at Allianz. You will engage with business functions to develop ideas, proof of concept to support a transformation business case and release your models to cloud-based state of the art production platform together with IT, senior engineers and scientists. You will analyze information from various data sources using statistics, including machine learning, to provide insights on various business problems. You will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions (incl. GenAI) to support decision-making systems at Allianz.




What do you get in return?




We offer you a full-time challenging role in an international landscape based in Brussels or Rotterdam;
Working in a dynamic environment at Allianz, world leader in insurances;
You will work from our new office, from walkable distance from Brussel-North or Rotterdam Central station;
A pleasant working atmosphere within an experienced and enthusiastic team;
Development opportunities and a nice salary package supplemented with fringe benefits.




As Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will be:




Model Development and Integration: Build, implement, and continuously enhance machine learning and statistical models using cutting-edge tools. Focus on integrating these models into our IT infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Collaborate with IT and DevOps teams to deploy models in production environments, monitor their performance, and optimize for efficiency. Translate business problems into robust data-driven solutions while maintaining best practices in version control, testing, and documentation.
Collaborate with Stakeholders: Partner with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and convert them into actionable data science projects, ensuring that the solutions align with business objectives.
Data Management and Analysis: Acquire, clean, and integrate data from various sources to address business issues. Use advanced data analytics techniques to manipulate and interpret complex datasets, providing clear insights and answers to critical business questions.
Knowledge and Trend Analysis: Stay informed about the latest industry trends to maintain a competitive edge and apply this knowledge to drive strategic decisions and methodologies within the company.




Let’s do the match?




You have a Bachelors/Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Physics, Actuarial, Statistics, or Mathematics? Check! Knowledge of machine learning principles and unsupervised machine learning techniques, including linear models and tree-based methods for regression and classification? Check! Ability to easily interpret common performance metrics? Check! Advanced skills in Python or R, proficiency in SQL and good knowledge of cloud data environments (e.g., Microsoft Azure)? Double check!




Have we peaked your interest? Join us and #LetsCareForTomorrow




Allianz is an equal opportunity employer and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Would Require Relocation) EU Citizens Only




Senior Machine Learning Engineer – Malmö (Onsite, 5 Days a Week)




Seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer for a long-term contract (6-12 months to start) with a high-impact project in Malmö. You'll work closely with engineers, researchers, and designers to develop and deploy advanced ML models.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and build scalable ML systems for real-world applications.
Develop and deploy cutting-edge models for complex problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate user needs into technical solutions.

Requirements:

Strong experience in developing, deploying, and optimising ML models in production.
Proficiency in Python and frameworks like PyTorch.
Hands-on experience with large-scale datasets and distributed systems.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Nice-to-Have:

Experience with Transformer models and real-time inference.
Background in dataset curation and annotation.
Knowledge of GIS data and/or Scala.
Advanced degree (MSc/PhD) in ML, AI, or related fields.
Contributions to open-source ML projects or published research.

Title: AI Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
AI Deep Learning Engineer




👉 About Scalian




Join our team of industry leaders at Scalian, where for over 30 years, innovation and expertise come together. As a leading multinational engineering consultancy firm, we have over 6000 highly skilled specialists. Our focus on Digital Systems and Operational Performance, including IT, software and systems engineering, quality assurance, supply chain management, and project management, sets us apart in the industry.

Our expertise serves various technology sectors such as automotive, aerospace, medical, defense, rail, and energy while providing distinctive support for their development and operations.




👉 Project Description




We are currently looking for an experienced AI Deep Learning Engineer for one of our clients specializing in the semiconductor sector. In this role, you will play a critical part in advancing semiconductor imaging processes by leveraging cutting-edge AI and deep learning models. You will collaborate with global teams and cross-functional experts to develop innovative AI-driven solutions for image analysis and enhancement.




Your tasks will involve:




Designing and implementing AI sub-system components.
Leading and mentoring junior engineers in AI development.
Evaluating and applying state-of-the-art Deep Learning (DL), Generative AI (GenAI), and Computer Vision (CV) algorithms for image processing.
Implementing and optimizing DL/GenAI/CV models for data preprocessing, analysis, and postprocessing phases using C++ and Python.
Performing model evaluation, fine-tuning, A/B testing, and performance validation.
Presenting technical concepts and results to peers and customers to drive project success.




👉 Your strengths




Background: PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in applying AI and deep learning to industrial applications, particularly image processing.
Strong programming skills in Python and C++, with proficiency in frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX.
Expertise in DL, reinforcement learning, LLMs, vision foundation models, or multi-modal modeling.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional and multicultural teams.
Self-driven, proactive, and results-oriented.




👉 What Scalian can offer you




We offer a competitive salary package and attractive extra-legal conditions, including:

An interesting bonus system.
A company car.
Hospitalization insurance.
Meal vouchers and eco-vouchers.




At Scalian, you will find a people-oriented environment where values such as community, teamwork, and career management are key.




Position to be filled on a permanent basis, based around Leuven.




Do you recognize yourself in this project summary? Do not hesitate to contact us and send us your CV!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🔵 Capitole is still growing and we want to do it with you! 🚀




We are seeking an experienced Deep Learning Engineer to support our semiconductor analysis efforts and reduce the number of mistakenly rejected semiconductors. This role will enable you to work with cutting-edge technology and contribute to the development of solutions that improve the accuracy of semiconductor classification. As part of a dynamic team, you will have the opportunity to strengthen your expertise in deep learning while directly impacting the business.




🤖 Responsabilities and Requirements:

Work on strengthening the company's expertise in deep learning to improve the semiconductor classification process, reducing the number of mistakenly rejected units.
Partner with local teams and AI specialists based in Israel to implement and refine deep learning techniques.
Analyze data and continually optimize models to ensure high-quality results in classifying semiconductors as defective or suitable for sale.
Attend on-site meetings and contribute to project needs as required, with an expected on-site presence of two days per week (potentially more based on project demands).
Contribute to programming efforts, primarily in Python, to support deep learning models and system implementations.




🛠️ Technical Requirements:

Strong skills in Python for developing deep learning models and data manipulation.
Previous work in the semiconductor industry or deep learning projects is an advantage.
Fluency in English is mandatory. Knowledge of one of the national languages (Dutch or French) is a plus but not required.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in deep learning or a related field




Additional informations:

The candidate must reside in Belgium due to internal company policies




🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.




📜 Permanent contract or Freelancing
🚗 Company car
🏥 Health Insurance with DKV
🍽️ Meal voucher
🏠💼 Hybrid working




Don't know us yet? Discover us!!




Home - Capitole Consulting







Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Title: AI/NLP/ML Expert (hybrid, Brussels / Belgium)
Description:
Company Description

We Cook iT is an international software house that delivers software development to its corporate customers by providing highly skilled, communicative IT professionals to build their customized products through outsourcing, nearshoring and turn-key projects’ solutions.

How do we differentiate ourselves? By investing in the professional growth and personal care of our software developers. We provide them with a premium service so that they can do the same for our customers.

Our talented team holds software engineers and sales experts, spread across offices in Europe and South America, and we represent a go-getting and driven company who aims to be an inspiring software house, knowing our future relies on IT.

We Cook iT stand for growth, support, dynamic, companionship and communication. Our head office is located in Portugal in the heart of Lisbon (Avenida da Liberdade) and we work mainly for the European market.

Job Description

We are urgently seeking an AI/NLP/ML Expert to join our Client’s team in Brussels, Belgium.

This senior role is designed for a highly experienced professional in the fields ofArtificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning (ML)with robust expertise in programming languages, large language models (LLMs), and deploying AI solutions in the cloud. The project demands a hands-on expert who can design, implement, and manage cutting-edge AI solutions in a real-world production environment.

Responsibilities:

As an AI/NLP/ML Expert, you will:


Design complex AI/NLP/ML solutions tailored to business needs, ensuring scalability, security, and operational efficiency.
Develop and maintainAI solutions and APIsusing Java and Python.
LeverageLangChain, OpenAPI, andLLMsfor cutting-edge enhancements such as semantic search and feature learning.
Deploy and manageAI/NLP/ML modelsin public cloud environments, optimizing performance and ensuring operational robustness.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to ensure alignment of AI functionalities with organizational goals.
Act as a thought leader and mentor, driving the adoption of best practices in AI/ML development and deployment.


Qualifications

Programming Expertise:


15+ years of experience in Java
5+ years of experience in Python


AI/ML and NLP Skills:


3+ years of experiencewith foundational technologies including:
OpenAPI
LLMs (Large Language Models),RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation),Feature Learning, andSemantic Search
2+ years of experiencewithLangChainfor NLP workflows
3+ years of experienceindeploying and managing AI applications and models in public cloud environments


Required Attributes and Competencies:


Demonstrated ability toconceptualize, implement, and manage AI applicationsacross diverse domains.
Proven expertise insemantic search,retrieval-augmented generation, and cutting-edge NLP tools.
Strong programming proficiency inJavaandPythonwith a keen eye for optimized code and robust implementations.
Solid hands-on experience withLangChainand deploying AI/ML models inpublic cloud infrastructureslike AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Deep familiarity withOpenAPI specificationsfor seamless integration of APIs in AI systems.
Strong analytical problem-solving skills to tackle complex real-world problems using AI/NLP/ML.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills to collaborate with technical teams and business leaders effectively.


Additional Information

If you meet the outlined requirements and are ready for your next challenge, we want to hear from you.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

DeepRec.ai is collaborating with a rapidly growing, innovative entertainment company.




Their Machine Learning R&D team designs, creates & uses state-of-the-art solutions to solve problems in live streaming apps. They apply AI where it is beneficial and profitable, thus not limiting temselves to a single topic in the AI world.




For the client, it's always important to work with as motivated and passionate people.

If you are looking for real-life challenges, join them to build an independent ML system together.




Design, build, train and test Machine Learning models which can learn and respond to complex situations
Brainstorm solutions to the toughest problems alongside a team of smart, creative, passionate engineers and scientists
Write production-level code to convert your ML models into working pipelines that are used every day
Work closely with Data Scientists, other Machine Learning Engineers, and Scientists to create, train, evaluate and deploy models
Optimize model and code to perform at scale
Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and distribute knowledge




Qualifications

5+ years of industry or research experience developing Machine Learning models
Fluency in Python and experience with commonly used data science packages
Interest in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Audio Processing projects
Deep knowledge of ML libraries like Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.
Excellent understanding of classical and deep machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with common statistics methodologies (distributions, clustering, regression, forecasting, classification, regularization, resampling)
"Engineer at heart" with a high degree of comfort in designing software systems and producing high-quality code
Great communication and collaboration skills

Title: Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Description:
Job Description




My client are at the forefront of technology, specializing in AI-driven solutions within a rapidly evolving industry. Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.




They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.




What You'll Do

Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We’re committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here’s what we offer:

An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.
