Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.


They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.


What You'll Do

  • Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
  • Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
  • Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
  • Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
  • Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
  • Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

  • 3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
  • A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
  • Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
  • Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We’re committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here’s what we offer:

  • An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
  • A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
  • An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
  • Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Company:

Our client is at the forefront of transforming how creators and advertisers connect. By combining AI-driven insights with the dynamic possibilities of the creator economy, they’re building a platform that empowers creators and gives advertisers unmatched transparency and ROI.




With groundbreaking features like Squad key trading and AI-based engagement matching, the company is redefining what’s possible in Web3. Their mission is clear: to unlock the full potential of creators while setting new standards for innovation in the industry.




Job Summary:

As a Data Scientist at the company, you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing the systems that determine creator pricing. Your work will directly influence the success of their creators, the satisfaction of advertisers, and the growth of the company as the go-to platform in Web3.




You’ll join a fast-paced, innovative environment where your ideas will be heard, your expertise valued, and your impact felt.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop Data Models: Design and implement data-driven frameworks to dynamically price creators based on engagement metrics, Squad key prices, market trends, and other key variables.
Leverage Machine Learning: Build predictive models to forecast creator performance, audience engagement, and campaign outcomes.
Analyze Large Datasets: Process and analyze social media metrics, creator activity, and transactional data to identify trends and opportunities for optimization.
Collaborate with Engineering Teams: Work closely with backend developers to ensure seamless integration of pricing algorithms into the platform.
Monitor and Optimize: Continuously evaluate the effectiveness of pricing models, testing and refining based on platform and market data.
Create Visualizations and Reports: Generate dashboards and reports to communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Innovate Data Pipelines: Design and implement scalable data pipelines for real-time analytics and decision-making.
Stay Ahead of Trends: Research advancements in AI, data science, and the creator economy to keep Hub’s platform innovative and competitive.




What You Bring




Technical Skills:

Advanced experience in data science, machine learning, or econometrics, with a strong focus on marketplace or dynamic pricing models.
Deep understanding of social media engagement metrics and their role in the creator economy.
Proficiency in tools such as Python, R, TensorFlow, or similar.
Familiarity with blockchain technology, tokenomics, and Web3 ecosystems (preferred).
Strong skills in data visualization and conveying insights to cross-functional teams.




Soft Skills:

Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous, complex challenges.
Strong communication skills and a proven ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
A passion for innovation, creativity, and empowering the creator economy.




Why Join Us?

Make an Impact: Your work will define how creators are valued and shape the future of the creator economy.
Grow with Us: Be part of a fast-growing company at the cutting edge of AI, Web3, and creator-driven innovation.
Collaborate with Talent: Work alongside a passionate, high-performing team dedicated to tackling big challenges.
Enjoy Flexibility: Remote work with a dynamic and empowering culture.
Competitive Benefits: Attractive salary, performance-based incentives, and token bonuses tied to platform growth.




Benefits:

Competitive salary and token bonuses.
Fully remote with flexible working hours.
Opportunities to shape the direction of a fast-growing platform.
Professional development opportunities in AI, Web3, and creator economy expertise.
An inclusive, empowering company culture where your contributions matter.
Show more

Title: Python Developer (Gen AI)
Description:
Location: Headquarters Brussels, Anderlecht (on-site 2 days/week)

Languages: English

Employment Type: Freelance

Start Date: 6-month project with potential for extension

Context of the mission/objective(s) of the job


We have developed several innovative Generative AI assistants to streamline high-value tasks across the company. With solutions that bring trials closer to patients, or that transform our internal helpdesks, Generative AI brings new opportunities to generate value for patients and the company.
Your initial project will involve collaborating with app developers and users to productize an existing prototype (built in Streamlit) using Python FastAPI and our custom internal framework. Beyond this initial project we will be looking to leverage your experience to enrich our Generative AI capabilities.


Responsibilities


Develop FastAPI application back-ends that combine large language with business logic
Act as a team player within the platform team and collaborate closely with the teams that built the Prototypes
Work with the infra teams to deploy the app, ensuring its supportability and maintainability
Maintain well-documented code, complete with necessary unit and integration tests.


Requirements


Proficient in Python and FastAPI
Experience with Generative AI, including the use of. Familiarity with standard data analytics libraries such as pandas, matplotlib, Streamlit, langchain, etc.
Expertise in development tools, including GIT, IDE (preferably Vscode), and CI/CD (preferably Azure DevOps-based).
Ability to work independently, breaking down complex tasks into manageable subtasks and executing them. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven track record of collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
A proactive and results-driven mindset, capable of resolving issues independently or seeking help and driving issues to resolution.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on developing innovative solutions.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🎉 Join the Future of Fun! Become a Machine Learning Engineer in the iGaming Industry! 🎉

Are you a tech wizard with a passion for working with cool tech? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! We’re on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team in the thrilling world of iGaming. As a key player in our innovative team, you’ll be diving into the latest ML algorithms, crafting intelligent systems that enhance customer experience, and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in the iGaming universe.




This role requires you to have the right to work in Europe no work visa on offer




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Design, develop and maintain ML pipelines, ensuring high reliability and scalability.
Implement scalable machine learning infrastructure, to deploy advanced algorithms based on image, text, audio and tabular data.
Optimize trained AI models (latency, memory, throughput, ...)
Develop CI/CD pipelines and containerize production applications
Automate existing workflows withing Data Science team
Monitor and troubleshoot production ML systems to ensure smooth operation using alert systems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across data and engineering to come up with solutions to complex problem statements.
Lead research initiatives to explore new methodologies, tools, and technologies, and contribute to the development of best ML OPs practices within the company.







REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python, with extensive experience in PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Extensive knowledge of key machine learning metrics and optimization techniques.
Strong knowledge of version control systems (Git, data versioning, ...).
Experience in model management and experiment tracking frameworks
Strong knowledge and practical understanding of different ML Ops techniques.
Prior experience in handling very large datasets across different business functions.
Practical experience of deploying and monitoring scalable machine learning models in real-world applications.
Prior experience in CI/CD pipelines, containerization, scheduling and automation.
Prior experience in designing production ready and large-scale AI/ML systems end-to-end in a very fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Self-motivated individual who can work independently, and stay updated on updated with the latest advancements in AI, deep learning, generative AI and related system design areas.







PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:




Extensive experience with Azure ecosystem, in particular Azure Machine Learning.
Experience developing computer vision, text, audio, and/or tabular data models.
Strong proficiency in Gitlab CI, Jenkins, Grafana, Docker.
Excellent software engineering skills in API design and development, and concurrency design skills.




If you are a skilled Machine Learning Enginner who has passion to work in a fast-paced environment, have an eye for details and ready to experiment new things, we encourage you to apply and be part of our dynamic and innovative team and organization.

Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer - Remote - Up to $50K




I’m partnered with an innovative startup that’s building AI-driven solutions for the Financial Services sector, currently focused on delivering a groundbreaking product set to launch later this year. They’re building cutting-edge tools to solve complex problems in the world of qualitative equity research, and they need an AI Engineer to help make it happen.




We’re looking for someone with:




1-2 years of experience in AI/ML development.
Expertise in text extraction from PDFs, including OCR and natural language processing techniques.
Experience fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) for specialised use cases.
Proficiency in Python, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Knowledge of NLP libraries such as spaCy, Hugging Face, or similar tools.




This is a unique opportunity to join an early-stage startup and make a real impact on the development of transformative products. You’ll work closely with a talented team, using cutting-edge technologies to solve real-world challenges in the financial industry.




If you’re passionate about AI and excited to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now.

Title: Data Scientist - Banking
Description:
Who We Are

NORRIQ is an international organization headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to driving business transformation through innovative technology.

Our expanding Financial Services (FS) practice includes a team of 100+ specialists committed to helping banks and financial institutions adapt to evolving client demands, adopt cutting-edge technologies, and navigate complex regulatory environments.

At NORRIQ, we believe our people are our greatest asset. We cultivate a culture of innovation, growth, and excellence, offering tailored training, opportunities for advancement, and a strong sense of community. Join us on this remarkable journey and become a valued member of the NORRIQ family—connected for life!

The Opportunity

NORRIQ FS is seeking a Senior/Medior Data Scientist to drive our data analytics and machine learning initiatives while delivering innovative solutions to our financial services clients.

Roles & Responsibilities

Client-Facing Responsibilities:


Design and implement machine learning solutions for complex business problems
Conduct exploratory data analysis and create insightful visualizations
Develop and maintain data pipelines for model deployment
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions
Provide technical guidance on data science best practices


Technical Responsibilities


Develop and maintain ML models using scikit-learn and other Python libraries
Implement version control for both code and data using GitLab and DVC
Create and maintain Jupyter notebooks for analysis and documentation
Ensure reproducibility of data science workflows
Optimize existing models and data pipelines for improved performance
Follow ML ops best practices for model deployment and monitoring


Internal Contributions


Contribute to NORRIQ's data science expertise through knowledge sharing
Participate in proposal writing and solution architecture
Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance
Stay current with latest developments in data science and ML


Your Profile

Experience : 2-6 years in the following areas:


Professional experience as a data scientist or ML engineer
Proven track record of implementing ML solutions in production
Experience with financial services industry preferred
Strong background in statistical analysis and machine learning


Technical Skills


Expert in Python programming and data science libraries
Proficiency with scikit-learn, pandas, and numpy
Experience with version control (GitLab) and DVC
Strong knowledge of Jupyter Lab and notebook-based development
Understanding of ML ops and deployment practices
Experience with SQL and data manipulation
Education: Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Languages: Fluency in English, and Dutch or French, with at least passive knowledge of the other


What NORRIQ Offers You


Be part of a fast-growing, international organization with a unique and people-centered culture
Enjoy a highly competitive compensation package, including a company car, iPhone, and additional allowances
Access extensive training programs in Belgium and Denmark, focusing on both technical expertise and soft skills
Work with a dynamic and diverse team of experienced professionals and young talent in a collaborative environment within the financial services sector


Join NORRIQ to elevate your career, contribute to transformative projects, and make a lasting impact in the financial services industry!

Title: Freelance Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

OpenResearch (OR) is an innovative software engineering company with a focus on mobility and connected vehicle solutions. With nearly 15 years of experience our team has a deep understanding of our clients domains and is able to apply cutting edge technology to solve their problems.




Are you a highly skilled freelance Data Scientist with a passion for tackling exciting, impactful projects? Are you looking to expand your opportunities while retaining the freedom and flexibility that freelance work provides? We’d love to hear from you!




We’re building a network of talented developers who want to join forces with us and collaborate on innovative projects. By joining our freelancer talent pool, you’ll gain access to diverse opportunities!




We are looking for freelance Data Scientists who




Bring expertise in data analysis, machine learning, statistical modeling and predictive analytics.
Are proficient in Python or R and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch or Scikit-learn.
Have experience working with structured and unstructured data and using SQL/NoSQL databases.
Understand the end-to-end ML lifecycle, including data preprocessing, feature engineering and model deployment.
Have experience working in agile environments and collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Possess strong communication skills and thrive in remote project setups.
Stay updated on trends in artificial intelligence, big data and analytics.




How it works

Submit your application to join our freelance talent pool. Share your CV and portfolio at jobs@openresearch.com.
After reviewing your application and matching it against our qualification criteria, we will invite you to our recruitment process. This step includes a technical assessment and a cultural-fit interview to better understand your skills, experience, and working style
Once approved, you’ll officially join our freelance network and sign an NDA with us.
When an opportunity that aligns with your skills and interests arises, we’ll notify you and present the project.




Selection qualifications




Excellent English skills are mandatory, as it is our primary language for communication, documentation and collaboration. German language skills are a plus and may open additional opportunities in german-speaking projects.
Several years of experience is required to ensure candidates have the expertise to manage projects independently and deliver high-quality results.
To ensure seamless collaboration, time-zone compatibility and adherence to regional standards such as the NIS2 Directive on cybersecurity and data protection, we can only consider applications from freelancers based in Europe.
Show more

Title: Applied AI Research Engineer
Description:
Company Goal:

We are committed to enhancing human potential through advanced robotics. Our goal is to revolutionize the manufacturing sector by introducing intelligent, adaptable robots that work alongside people and existing systems to drive superior quality, reduce waste, and cut costs.




Company Vision:

We envision a future where every step of the manufacturing process, from design to production, is optimized with smart automation. Our aim is to make flexible robotic solutions, powered by cutting-edge hardware and AI-driven software, accessible and economically viable for businesses of all sizes, particularly small and medium enterprises. We are not just creating robots; we are developing key building blocks for the autonomous, intelligent systems of the future.




The Role:

As an AI Research Engineer, you will be instrumental in exploring and deploying innovative AI technologies for our state-of-the-art robotics platform, with a focus on embodied AI.

This role provides an opportunity to tackle complex challenges and turn leading research into impactful, practical applications.




What you'll be responsible for:

Engage in research and development across the following domains:

Computer Vision: Improve perception capabilities for our monocular and stereo camera systems in targeted applications.
AI Models: Leverage advancements in foundational models to enable our robots to perform tasks intuitively and accurately.
Reinforcement Learning: Develop and implement effective control strategies for robotic manipulation.
Depth and Scene Analysis: Enhance perception capabilities with additional modalities such as depth estimation and 3D reconstruction from video.
Simulation-to-Reality: Enhance model deployment through synthetic data to close the gap between simulated environments and real-world performance.

Collaborate with engineering teams to translate research breakthroughs into practical solutions ready for deployment.




Your profile:

Demonstrated experience and knowledge in machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision.
Proven track record of applying research to solve challenging problems and deliver tangible outcomes.
Strong grasp of modern AI models and reinforcement learning methodologies.
Expertise in Python, with proficiency in frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with multi-modal foundational models.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and creative thinking skills.
Strong communication abilities to effectively convey ideas and present findings.
A strategic thinker with a pragmatic approach to decision-making and planning.




Essential experience:

Python programming
AI platforms such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Huggingface.
Experience with tools like Conda, Docker, Linux, Git, and project management platforms.
Experiment tracking and MLOps tools such as W&B, ClearML, or MLFlow.
Cloud platforms including AWS, GCE, or Azure for AI workflows.




Desirable experience:

Knowledge of advanced AI models.
Familiarity with robotics frameworks such as ROS/ROS2.
Exposure to AI agent-based systems.
Experience with hardware platforms like NVIDIA Jetson and AI acceleration tools.




Why Join Us?

Be part of an innovative company shaping the future of robotics and manufacturing.
Contribute to groundbreaking technology in an environment that values creativity and growth.
Competitive compensation package, including equity options, and a flexible work culture that fosters learning and excellence.

Show more
HTML:
Company Goal:

We are committed to enhancing human potential through advanced robotics. Our goal is to revolutionize the manufacturing sector by introducing intelligent, adaptable robots that work alongside people and existing systems to drive superior quality, reduce waste, and cut costs.


Company Vision:

We envision a future where every step of the manufacturing process, from design to production, is optimized with smart automation. Our aim is to make flexible robotic solutions, powered by cutting-edge hardware and AI-driven software, accessible and economically viable for businesses of all sizes, particularly small and medium enterprises. We are not just creating robots; we are developing key building blocks for the autonomous, intelligent systems of the future.


The Role:

As an AI Research Engineer, you will be instrumental in exploring and deploying innovative AI technologies for our state-of-the-art robotics platform, with a focus on embodied AI.

This role provides an opportunity to tackle complex challenges and turn leading research into impactful, practical applications.


What you'll be responsible for:

Engage in research and development across the following domains:

  • Computer Vision: Improve perception capabilities for our monocular and stereo camera systems in targeted applications.
  • AI Models: Leverage advancements in foundational models to enable our robots to perform tasks intuitively and accurately.
  • Reinforcement Learning: Develop and implement effective control strategies for robotic manipulation.
  • Depth and Scene Analysis: Enhance perception capabilities with additional modalities such as depth estimation and 3D reconstruction from video.
  • Simulation-to-Reality: Enhance model deployment through synthetic data to close the gap between simulated environments and real-world performance.

Collaborate with engineering teams to translate research breakthroughs into practical solutions ready for deployment.


Your profile:

  • Demonstrated experience and knowledge in machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision.
  • Proven track record of applying research to solve challenging problems and deliver tangible outcomes.
  • Strong grasp of modern AI models and reinforcement learning methodologies.
  • Expertise in Python, with proficiency in frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
  • Familiarity with multi-modal foundational models.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and creative thinking skills.
  • Strong communication abilities to effectively convey ideas and present findings.
  • A strategic thinker with a pragmatic approach to decision-making and planning.


Essential experience:

  • Python programming
  • AI platforms such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Huggingface.
  • Experience with tools like Conda, Docker, Linux, Git, and project management platforms.
  • Experiment tracking and MLOps tools such as W&B, ClearML, or MLFlow.
  • Cloud platforms including AWS, GCE, or Azure for AI workflows.


Desirable experience:

  • Knowledge of advanced AI models.
  • Familiarity with robotics frameworks such as ROS/ROS2.
  • Exposure to AI agent-based systems.
  • Experience with hardware platforms like NVIDIA Jetson and AI acceleration tools.


Why Join Us?

  • Be part of an innovative company shaping the future of robotics and manufacturing.
  • Contribute to groundbreaking technology in an environment that values creativity and growth.
  • Competitive compensation package, including equity options, and a flexible work culture that fosters learning and excellence.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) Engineer / AI Engineer




Who we are?

NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.




We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).




At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!




Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization’s infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.




Key Responsibilities

Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.




Requirements:

Education

Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.




Technical Expertise

Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).

Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.

Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.




Soft Skills

Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.




Language Proficiency

Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.




Why Joining Us?

You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: AI Engineer Internship
Description:
AI engineer Internship




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




With 30 years of expertise, we remain at the forefront of innovation, revolutionizing business transformation across industry with the full potential of AI and GenAI technologies at scale in a sustainable way.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. By joining us, you will be part of a global impact on businesses around the world.




Check out some of our ongoing projects:




Orange Business dives into restoration of the coral reefs with Tēnaka:
In order to monitor the effects of coral restoration programs, we are designing, implementing and monitoring a fish diversity counting system using Computer Vision.
Our customer Sappi, a global pulp and paper company, requested our help to significantly reduce energy costs and offer capacity in energy balancing markets on a daily basis. You could join the team creating, deploying and optimizing multiple forecasting algorithms.
“Talk with your RFP” is an internal tool, using Generative AI, developed to build upon and leverage past RFP answers to create better and faster answers to new RFPs.




Orange Business gets recognized “Best in Class” in Europe for 4 AI Categories including “GenAI services” in the 2024 PAC Radar.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if that matches your profile!




What You’ll Do:




All the responsibilities we’ll trust you with




As an AI Engineer intern, you will support the development of an AI-powered application by focusing on data preprocessing, retrieval pipeline design, and integration with state-of-the-art AI models. This role will involve working with cloud-based environments, specifically on Azure, and contributing to the foundational components that enable our AI solution to deliver high-quality results.




Data collection & preprocessing:

Gather and preprocess datasets, including code files, for Azure storage.

Metadata extraction & chunking:

Extract key metadata from code files.
Split files into manageable chunks while preserving context.

Embedding generation & retrieval pipeline:

Generate vector embeddings for data chunks using pre-trained models.
Design and optimize the retrieval pipeline for user queries.

Model Integration & Prompt Flow:

Integrate AI models with prompt flows to process user inputs.
Experiment with prompt engineering to improve AI-generated answers.

Evaluation & Feedback:

Develop evaluation scripts to measure key metrics.
Implement mechanisms to collect and integrate user feedback.

Collaboration in Azure Environment:

Work within Azure, leveraging AI services to build and test solutions




Who you are:




What matters most for this role




Your interests & soft skills:




Proactive mindset and outside the box thinking to tackle challenges with your strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Enthusiasm for learning and working on innovative AI applications.
You value collaboration as a way to succeed in a team setting.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English




Your technical expertise:




Familiarity with machine learning or AI concepts:
MLOPs: Deployment & Monitoring of AI models at scale
Techniques and algorithms: Understanding of basic principles of NLP and techniques relevant to generative AI models. Understanding of the architecture and operation of LLMs and their applications.
Programming: Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation and model integration.
Cloud Data Platforms: Experience with Cloud platform, preferably Azure
Version control tools: Good knowledge (e.g., Git).




Why you should join us:




Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities with a possibility to be hired with a permanent contract.
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid way of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Lead AI & Backend Engineer (Java, Python, LLM, Cloud)




Role Overview

As a Lead AI & Backend Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and deploying AI-driven solutions. You will work on LLMs, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), feature learning, and semantic search, leveraging Java and Python to build high-performance applications. You will also integrate OpenAPI standards and use LangChain for advanced AI workflows. This role requires strong expertise in deploying and managing AI applications in public cloud environments.




Key Responsibilities

Architect, develop, and optimize backend applications using Java (15+ years) and Python (5+ years).
Design and implement AI-driven solutions using LLMs, RAG, feature learning, and semantic search.
Develop and document APIs following OpenAPI specifications.
Utilize LangChain to build scalable AI workflows.
Deploy, manage, and optimize AI applications in public cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Ensure high performance, scalability, and security of AI applications.
Collaborate with data scientists, ML engineers, and DevOps teams to integrate AI models into production.
Stay ahead of emerging AI technologies and best practices.




What We’re Looking For

15+ years of experience with Java (Competence Level 5).
5+ years of experience with Python (Competence Level 5).
3+ years of experience with OpenAPI (Competence Level 4).
3+ years of hands-on experience with LLM, RAG, feature learning, and semantic search (Competence Level 4).
2+ years of experience with LangChain (Competence Level 4).
3+ years of experience deploying and managing AI applications in public cloud environments (Competence Level 4).
Strong understanding of software architecture, microservices, and API development.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, DevOps, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively.




Nice to Have

Experience with MLOps and AI model deployment in production.
Knowledge of Graph Neural Networks, Knowledge Graphs, and NLP techniques.
Hands-on experience with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, Weaviate).
Familiarity with cloud AI/ML services (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).

Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer you promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the Machine Learning and AI community. You do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.




You participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means you contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.




AND IN DETAIL

You facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.
You work with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry …).
You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests …).
You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.




YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES

A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
You have at least 3 years of relevant experience with:

- Basic knowledge of Linux platform

- Containerization/virtualization

- AI platforms & IDEs

- CI/CD

- Code, model & data versioning

- Python

- Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management

- PostgreSQL

It is preferable you have experience with:

- Integration using different technologies and infra components

- Model compression techniques

- ELT/ETL tools

- Big data tools (Spark)

- Data flow processing

- Data visualization tools

You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback.
You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success.




WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.




YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.




OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.




OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.




TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.




Good luck!




Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Show more

  • You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests …).
  • You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
  • You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
  • You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.


YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES

  • A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
  • You have at least 3 years of relevant experience with:

- Basic knowledge of Linux platform

- Containerization/virtualization

- AI platforms & IDEs

- CI/CD

- Code, model & data versioning

- Python

- Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management

- PostgreSQL

  • It is preferable you have experience with:

- Integration using different technologies and infra components

- Model compression techniques

- ELT/ETL tools

- Big data tools (Spark)

- Data flow processing

- Data visualization tools

  • You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
  • You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback.
  • You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
  • You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
  • You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success.


WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.


YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.


OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.


OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.


TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.


Good luck!


Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:


You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals


Main Qualifications


Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing


Top reasons to work with us:


Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Junior Developer (Python)
Description:
Squareflow is a growing company founded in 2020 by entrepreneurs (just like you). We embrace technology to create business value with Odoo as an enabler. We believe that any business can be digital first.




To strengthen our team, we are looking for junior developer. As a developer, you'll be in regular contact with clients and our teams in order to deliver solutions based on understanding of their specific needs in terms of business business/IT alignment.




Function:




As a junior developer, your specific tasks and responsibilities may include:




Develop solutions for our clients from many different industries, sectors and company size
Support and maintain those specific solutions
Implement the client's needs in the Odoo solution before configuring it
Create training material and documentation for Odoo users
Deliver informative, well-organized demos to business teams
Accompany and train end-users to the new tool (train the trainer approach) on Odoo and related applications
Develop and maintain processes to continuously monitor data quality
Coordinate test execution to ensure that all technical customizations and configurations follow industry and delivery best practices
Contribute to the daily development of Squareflow




Your profile :




Bachelor or Master degree (preferably in business, engineering or computer science)
Several programming languages ( Python & JavaScript)
Excellent communication (written and oral) in French and English and interpersonal skills
Structural thinking
Ability to learn and evolve quickly
Ability to work autonomously but also in team with a “Can Do attitude”
Creatively and pragmatic in a problem-solving environment
Fast-learner with a specific interest in Digital




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?




More that a technical knowledge combined with our business positioning, we live our values on a daily basis : teamwork, transparency, commitment.




We offer:

A competitive salary package, with car and other benefits
Exciting projects with a strong use of Odoo
The opportunity to grow your superpower in a challenging context
The possibility to follow regular trainings
The opportunity to think, build and adopt beyond solutions




Squareflow is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability or sexual orientation, in any of its activities or operations.

Title: AI Engineer Internship
Description:
AI engineer Internship




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




With 30 years of expertise, we remain at the forefront of innovation, revolutionizing business transformation across industry with the full potential of AI and GenAI technologies at scale in a sustainable way.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. By joining us, you will be part of a global impact on businesses around the world.




Check out some of our ongoing projects:




Orange Business dives into restoration of the coral reefs with Tēnaka:
In order to monitor the effects of coral restoration programs, we are designing, implementing and monitoring a fish diversity counting system using Computer Vision.
Our customer Sappi, a global pulp and paper company, requested our help to significantly reduce energy costs and offer capacity in energy balancing markets on a daily basis. You could join the team creating, deploying and optimizing multiple forecasting algorithms.
“Talk with your RFP” is an internal tool, using Generative AI, developed to build upon and leverage past RFP answers to create better and faster answers to new RFPs.




Orange Business gets recognized “Best in Class” in Europe for 4 AI Categories including “GenAI services” in the 2024 PAC Radar.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if that matches your profile!




What You’ll Do:




All the responsibilities we’ll trust you with




As an AI Engineer intern, you will support the development of an AI-powered application by focusing on data preprocessing, retrieval pipeline design, and integration with state-of-the-art AI models. This role will involve working with cloud-based environments, specifically on Azure, and contributing to the foundational components that enable our AI solution to deliver high-quality results.




Data collection & preprocessing:

Gather and preprocess datasets, including code files, for Azure storage.

Metadata extraction & chunking:

Extract key metadata from code files.
Split files into manageable chunks while preserving context.

Embedding generation & retrieval pipeline:

Generate vector embeddings for data chunks using pre-trained models.
Design and optimize the retrieval pipeline for user queries.

Model Integration & Prompt Flow:

Integrate AI models with prompt flows to process user inputs.
Experiment with prompt engineering to improve AI-generated answers.

Evaluation & Feedback:

Develop evaluation scripts to measure key metrics.
Implement mechanisms to collect and integrate user feedback.

Collaboration in Azure Environment:

Work within Azure, leveraging AI services to build and test solutions




Who you are:




What matters most for this role




Your interests & soft skills:




Proactive mindset and outside the box thinking to tackle challenges with your strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Enthusiasm for learning and working on innovative AI applications.
You value collaboration as a way to succeed in a team setting.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English




Your technical expertise:




Familiarity with machine learning or AI concepts:
MLOPs: Deployment & Monitoring of AI models at scale
Techniques and algorithms: Understanding of basic principles of NLP and techniques relevant to generative AI models. Understanding of the architecture and operation of LLMs and their applications.
Programming: Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation and model integration.
Cloud Data Platforms: Experience with Cloud platform, preferably Azure
Version control tools: Good knowledge (e.g., Git).




Why you should join us:




Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities with a possibility to be hired with a permanent contract.
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid way of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels

Show more

  • We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification

Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer you promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the Machine Learning and AI community. You do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.




You participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means you contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.




AND IN DETAIL

You facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.
You work with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry …).
You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests …).
You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.




YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES

A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
You have at least 3 years of relevant experience with:

- Basic knowledge of Linux platform

- Containerization/virtualization

- AI platforms & IDEs

- CI/CD

- Code, model & data versioning

- Python

- Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management

- PostgreSQL

It is preferable you have experience with:

- Integration using different technologies and infra components

- Model compression techniques

- ELT/ETL tools

- Big data tools (Spark)

- Data flow processing

- Data visualization tools

You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback.
You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success.




WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.




YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.




OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.




OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.




TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.




Good luck!




Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - McKinsey Transformation
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will work in our McKinsey Transformation Client Capabilities Network in EMEA and will be part of our Wave Transformatics team.

Wave is a McKinsey SaaS product that equips clients to successfully manage improvement programs and transformations. Focused on business impact, Wave allows clients to track the impact of individual initiatives and understand how they affect longer term goals. It is a mix of an intuitive interface and McKinsey business expertise that gives clients a simple and insightful picture of what can otherwise be a complex process by allowing them to track the progress and performance of initiatives against business goals, budget and time frames.

Our Transformatics team builds data and AI products to provide analytics insights to clients and McKinsey teams involved in transformation programs across the globe. The current team is composed of data engineers, data scientists and product managers who are spread across several geographies. The team covers a variety of industries, functions, analytics methodologies and platforms – e.g. Cloud data engineering, advanced statistics, machine learning, predictive analytics, MLOps and generative AI.

What You'll Do

You will collaborate closely with a team comprising data scientists, data engineers, product developers, and analytics-focused consultants.

You will work on topics such as descriptive analytics, predictive models (e.g., boosted trees), and large language models (LLMs), particularly for segmentation use cases. Additionally, you will design and deliver products that adhere to MLOps best practices, ensuring they are both maintainable and deployable. By doing so, you will help bring advanced analytics capabilities into one of McKinsey’s flagship products, named "Wave". Your work will be the backbone for how McKinsey runs future Transformations, leveraging data science assets, to improve the odds of success for our clients.

In this role, you will be responsible for the following, as the primary focus


Advanced insight generation transforming complex business questions into statically relevant analyses and these analyses into easy to digest insights. Delivering this through well documented and tested pipelines, that allow easy collaboration with other team members.
Upholding technical excellence Together with the tech lead(s) define how to build, maintain and scale our pipelines. Often piloting new technical approaches & automation. Using your business understanding to critically review model results, trends, analyses and classifications.
Coach & help other colleagues Coach & help you peers when needed, we deliver as a team.
Machine learning model development Lead the design and refinement of statistical models, optimization techniques, advanced machine learning, and predictive models
LLM optimization and evaluation Fine-tune and evaluating the performance and efficiency of Large Language Models, leveraging the latest advancements in neural network architectures and machine learning techniques


Your role might also include, as the secondary focus


Design & build creative approaches to further optimize accuracy & reduce cost In addition to optimizing the LLM through prompts and settings, you will design and test alternative approaches, such as pre-filters and non-LLM-based text models, within parallel multi-agent setups.
Build for scale Together with the tech lead(s), you will define how to maintain and scale our LLM classifier pipeline. The classifier pipeline will, in the long term, run as a on-demand batch process, and will, once stable, be refactored with scalability in mind.
Deploying pipelines at scale Although not core to your role, you will be exposed to cloud deployments & orchestration of our pipelines and can shape these if you have an interest in this field.
Expert guidance for client teams You will work closely with global client service teams to deliver high-quality advanced analytics solutions, offering expert guidance to ensure analytical excellence and understanding at client teams.
Knowledge and research You will contribute to influential articles, white papers, and research, positioning the firm as a thought leader in analytics and transformation, with a focus on LLMs and predictive modeling


Qualifications


Familiarity with neural network architectures (Transformers), RAG models, deep learning libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch) and machine learning libraries (scikit-learn) is a plus
Exposure to extra tooling such as Snowflake, Excel and Tableau is a plus
Experience in leading complex engagements to deploy advanced analytics and data science methods at scale in real world organizations
Programming experience in the following languages Python and SQL 
3+ years of relevant experience with classical descriptive statistics, standard statistical modelling (e.g. advanced regressions, clustering, classification models) and machine learning techniques (e.g. random forest, support vector machines, gradient boosting, XGBoost) 
Strong data translation and presentation skills with the ability to clearly and effectively communicate complex analytical and technical content
MSc or PhD level in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics or equivalent by experience
Show more
HTML:
Who You'll Work With

You will work in our McKinsey Transformation Client Capabilities Network in EMEA and will be part of our Wave Transformatics team.

Wave is a McKinsey SaaS product that equips clients to successfully manage improvement programs and transformations. Focused on business impact, Wave allows clients to track the impact of individual initiatives and understand how they affect longer term goals. It is a mix of an intuitive interface and McKinsey business expertise that gives clients a simple and insightful picture of what can otherwise be a complex process by allowing them to track the progress and performance of initiatives against business goals, budget and time frames.

Our Transformatics team builds data and AI products to provide analytics insights to clients and McKinsey teams involved in transformation programs across the globe. The current team is composed of data engineers, data scientists and product managers who are spread across several geographies. The team covers a variety of industries, functions, analytics methodologies and platforms – e.g. Cloud data engineering, advanced statistics, machine learning, predictive analytics, MLOps and generative AI.

What You'll Do

You will collaborate closely with a team comprising data scientists, data engineers, product developers, and analytics-focused consultants.

You will work on topics such as descriptive analytics, predictive models (e.g., boosted trees), and large language models (LLMs), particularly for segmentation use cases. Additionally, you will design and deliver products that adhere to MLOps best practices, ensuring they are both maintainable and deployable. By doing so, you will help bring advanced analytics capabilities into one of McKinsey’s flagship products, named "Wave". Your work will be the backbone for how McKinsey runs future Transformations, leveraging data science assets, to improve the odds of success for our clients.

In this role, you will be responsible for the following, as the primary focus

  • Advanced insight generation transforming complex business questions into statically relevant analyses and these analyses into easy to digest insights. Delivering this through well documented and tested pipelines, that allow easy collaboration with other team members.
  • Upholding technical excellence Together with the tech lead(s) define how to build, maintain and scale our pipelines. Often piloting new technical approaches & automation. Using your business understanding to critically review model results, trends, analyses and classifications.
  • Coach & help other colleagues Coach & help you peers when needed, we deliver as a team.
  • Machine learning model development Lead the design and refinement of statistical models, optimization techniques, advanced machine learning, and predictive models
  • LLM optimization and evaluation Fine-tune and evaluating the performance and efficiency of Large Language Models, leveraging the latest advancements in neural network architectures and machine learning techniques

Your role might also include, as the secondary focus

  • Design & build creative approaches to further optimize accuracy & reduce cost In addition to optimizing the LLM through prompts and settings, you will design and test alternative approaches, such as pre-filters and non-LLM-based text models, within parallel multi-agent setups.
  • Build for scale Together with the tech lead(s), you will define how to maintain and scale our LLM classifier pipeline. The classifier pipeline will, in the long term, run as a on-demand batch process, and will, once stable, be refactored with scalability in mind.
  • Deploying pipelines at scale Although not core to your role, you will be exposed to cloud deployments & orchestration of our pipelines and can shape these if you have an interest in this field.
  • Expert guidance for client teams You will work closely with global client service teams to deliver high-quality advanced analytics solutions, offering expert guidance to ensure analytical excellence and understanding at client teams.
  • Knowledge and research You will contribute to influential articles, white papers, and research, positioning the firm as a thought leader in analytics and transformation, with a focus on LLMs and predictive modeling

Qualifications

  • Familiarity with neural network architectures (Transformers), RAG models, deep learning libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch) and machine learning libraries (scikit-learn) is a plus
  • Exposure to extra tooling such as Snowflake, Excel and Tableau is a plus
  • Experience in leading complex engagements to deploy advanced analytics and data science methods at scale in real world organizations
  • Programming experience in the following languages Python and SQL 
  • 3+ years of relevant experience with classical descriptive statistics, standard statistical modelling (e.g. advanced regressions, clustering, classification models) and machine learning techniques (e.g. random forest, support vector machines, gradient boosting, XGBoost) 
  • Strong data translation and presentation skills with the ability to clearly and effectively communicate complex analytical and technical content
  • MSc or PhD level in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics or equivalent by experience

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Vacature: Data Scientist

Locatie: Brussel & Gent (50% on site)
Team: Data Insights - AI & Analytics
Dienstverband: Voltijds

Functieomschrijving:

Als Data Scientist ontwikkel en implementeer je innovatieve datagedreven oplossingen voor een efficiëntere en transparantere overheid. Samen met data-ingenieurs, data-architecten en domeinexperten zorg je voor datavoorbereiding, modellering en transformatie.

Verantwoordelijkheden:

Ontwikkelen en implementeren van AI- en machine learning-modellen
Data voorbereiden, modelleren en transformeren
Toepassen van machine learning, deep learning en NLP-technieken
Uitvoeren van analytische experimenten
Documenteren van methodologieën en processen
Coaching

Technische competenties:

Expertise in machine learning-algoritmen
Kennis van deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras)
Ervaring met NLP
Bekendheid met cloudplatformen (AWS, Azure)
Vaardigheid in Python en data science libraries (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn)
Ervaring met datavisualisatie-tools (Power BI, matplotlib, seaborn)

Persoonsgebonden competenties:

Sterke communicatievaardigheden
Kritisch analytisch en conceptueel denkend
Teamplayer met resultaatgerichte aanpak

Interesse?

Stuur je CV en motivatiebrief naar f.maes(a)computerfutures.be en sluit je aan bij ons team om samen te werken aan de digitale toekomst van Vlaanderen!
