Title: AI Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Tasks:

  • Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data;
  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques;
  • Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language;
  • Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
  • Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality and integrity;
  • Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance;
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
  • Design the IT architecture for solitons in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts;
  • Contributing for the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and derive the IT requirements;
  • Contributing to the design of the IT architecture considering master- and meta-data management concepts.


Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 15 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • At least 15 years of experience with JAVA;
  • At least 5 years of experience with Python;
  • At least 3 years of experience with OpenAPI;
  • At least 3 years of experience with LLM, RAG, feature learning and semantic search;
  • At least 3 years of experience in deploying and managing AI applications and models in public cloud environments;
  • At least 2 years of experience with LangChain;
  • Excellent command in English


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18043/01/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading European Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, age, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

 

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Lead AI Application Engineer
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Lead AI Application Engineer to integrate foundational models into innovative tools and workflows for our clients, with a strong focus on building agentic tools that adapt and respond to complex user needs. You will be at the forefront of AI-powered product development, focusing on embedding foundational models into applications, fine-tuning workflows, and ensuring seamless performance. The ideal candidate has experience working in a consulting or agency environment and thrives in dynamic, project-based work.

This is a hands-on role where you will be responsible for building and implementing systems from the ground up. You would write production-level code while defining processes and best practices for future team growth.

Responsibilities


Integrate APIs for foundational models (e.g. OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face) into scalable applications
Develop and optimize workflows for foundational model use cases, including prompt engineering, embedding generation, and real-time decision-making for agentic tools
Implement and manage vector-based search systems and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) setups
Build and refine tools with adaptive agentic capabilities to enable autonomous decision-making and user interactions
Monitor the performance of AI systems, troubleshoot issues, and improve outputs to align with client needs
Collaborate with data engineers to integrate harmonized data into AI workflows
Work with full-stack engineers to embed AI functionalities into user-facing applications
Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI APIs, tools, and techniques to deliver innovative solutions.



Requirements


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field
A minimum of 6 years of professional experience in AI application development or software engineering
Proven experience working in a consulting or agency environment on project-based work
Advanced proficiency in Python and frameworks like LangChain for building AI-powered applications
Strong knowledge of foundational model APIs and embedding techniques
Hands-on experience with vector databases (e.g. Pinecone, Weaviate) and RAG workflows
Familiarity with deploying AI applications in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Ability to translate complex client needs into technical solutions using foundational models
Experience building tools with agentic capabilities to adapt and automate workflows
Advanced English skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate effectively in an international team.



Preferred Qualifications


Experience with MLOps practices for managing AI systems in production
Knowledge of schema design and structured data preparation for AI workflows
Understanding of model performance evaluation and optimization

Title: Python Developer
Description:
SII Belgium is seeking a highly motivated and ambitious Python Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and developing software applications, as well as maintaining and improving existing systems. You would join various teams working in AGILE mode for projects in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Media sectors. 

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.  

Key Responsibilities: 


Support design and troubleshooting efforts
Determine operational feasibility by evaluating analysis, problem definition, requirements, solution development, and proposed solutions.
Develop software solutions by studying information needs, conferring with users, and studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes.
Promote technical growth, making recommendations on software.
Ensure continuous integration and deployment of solutions
Deliver scalable web applications according to agreed planning and budget
Test applications and overcome technical issues encountered
Add value to the sales cycle by giving input to your commercial colleagues (presales)
Train customers and users


Requirements:


Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science
At least 3 years of relevant experience, you’re able to write clear and maintainable code
Familiar with Agile methodology such as Scrum; TDD
Good knowledge of Python (Flask, Pandas, Celery ...)
Experienced in Unit-testing
Experience with Angular, PostgreSQL is an added value.
Problem solving and debugging skills
General best practices and design practices
Fluent in English and Dutch or French


We offer: 


A challenging and varied role in a growing company 
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies 
Competitive salary and benefits 
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and certification 
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group 


   If you are an ambitious and motivated Python developer looking for an exciting opportunity with a growing company, we encourage you to apply for this posit.

Title: AI Solutions Engineer (Netherlands based)
Description:
About Us

Axelera AI is not your regular deep-tech startup. We are creating the next-generation AI platform to support anyone who wants to help advancing humanity and improve the world around us.

In just three years, we have raised a total of $120 million and have built a world-class team of 180+ employees (including 55+ PhDs with more than 40,000 citations), both remotely from 11 different countries and with offices in Belgium, Switzerland, Italy, the UK, headquartered at the High Tech Campus in Eindhoven, Netherlands.

We have also launched our Metis™ AI Platform, which achieves a 3-5x increase in efficiency and performance, and have visibility into a strong business pipeline exceeding $100 million.

Our unwavering commitment to innovation has firmly established us as a global industry pioneer.

Are you up for the challenge?

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented and experienced AI Solutions Engineer to be based in Eindhoven or Amsterdam, with expertise in machine learning and computer vision to join our dynamic team. As a Solutions Engineer at Axelera AI, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing AI-driven solutions tailored to our clients' specific needs. You will work closely with clients, sales teams, and technical stakeholders to understand requirements, develop solution designs, and oversee the implementation of scalable and robust machine learning systems.

Responsibilities:


Work closely with clients to understand objectives, then design AI-driven machine learning and computer vision solutions to address their needs.
Develop and optimize computer vision architectures with a focus on GStreamer-based pipelines for enhanced video and data processing efficiency.
Collaborate with the sales team to craft proposals and effectively present solution designs and technical benefits to clients.
Oversee the implementation process, guiding cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with solution designs and project goals.
Work alongside data scientists and engineers to prototype, develop, and deploy machine learning models, with a focus on efficient GStreamer integration.
Conduct performance optimizations, troubleshoot solutions, and assess scalability for reliable solution delivery.
Stay current with industry advancements to drive innovation within the team.
Mentor junior team members, fostering knowledge-sharing and a collaborative work culture.


Requirements:


5+ years of experience in designing and implementing computer vision solutions, with specific expertise in GStreamer for pipeline optimization.
Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts, experience in developing, training, and deploying models.
Proficient in Python, C/C++, and machine learning libraries (e.g., PyTorch, OpenCV, TensorFlow) and highly experienced with GStreamer, CUDA, and TensorRT.
Skilled in integrating various hardware platforms, including cameras, LiDAR, and other sensors, with GStreamer.
Familiar with Linux (Ubuntu) and other operating systems.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
Effective communication skills for engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with agile practices, DevOps, and CI/CD pipelines is advantageous.
Relevant certifications in machine learning, cloud computing, or architecture are a plus, along with a commitment to ongoing learning and innovation.


Location

We support relocation to Amsterdam or Eindhoven for talent based abroad and interested in this role. Please note that this position requires presence in the Eindhoven office approximately 3-5 times per month / as required by business & cannot be done remotely.

What We Offer

This is your chance to shape and be part of a dynamic, fast-growing, international organization. We offer an attractive compensation package, including a pension plan, extensive employee insurances and the option to get company shares.

An open culture that supports creativity and continual innovation is awaiting you. Collaborative ownership and freedom with responsibility is characteristic for the way we act and work as a team.

At Axelera AI, we wholeheartedly embrace equal opportunity and hold diversity in the highest regard. Our steadfast commitment is to cultivate a warm and inclusive environment that empowers and celebrates every member of our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in shaping the future of AI.

Title: Expert Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀 Your Role

At Dataroots, our consulting services are focused on designing and delivering AI-powered solutions tailored to optimize business processes. As an Expert Machine Learning Engineer, you'll join a collaborative team focused on building machine learning models that bring production-ready solutions to life.




Your passion for data and its potential will allow you to develop, deploy, and optimize advanced machine learning models. You’ll experiment with the latest approaches to ensure that every client receives best-in-class solutions. Working closely with our Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists, you’ll help execute projects across diverse industries with a comprehensive, quality-driven, end-to-end approach.




As a senior team member, you'll mentor your peers, share your expertise, and keep up with the latest advancements in the field, ensuring continuous growth for yourself and the team.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

Master’s or Doctorate in a quantitative field, with mastery in Machine Learning.
4+ years of industry experience in machine learning and big data.
In-depth understanding of software design principles.
Strong theoretical grounding and practical expertise in general machine learning and deep learning.
Strong skills in Python & SQL. Knowledge of an additional programming language is an advantage.
Proven track record in deploying ML models and deep expertise in MLOps.
Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools like Airflow, Prefect or Dagster.
Solid grasp of cloud- & data engineering. Proven experience with cloud services like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
GenAI familiarity is a big advantage.
Excited to work with large datasets and be able to tackle problems pragmatically.
Excellent communication skills to translate complex solutions into clear client deliverables.
Fluency in English. Speaking Dutch/French fluently is a very big advantage.
Consulting experience is a big plus.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organisation of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to join Dataroots as an Expert Machine Learning Engineer? We can't wait to meet you—apply today! 🎉

Show more
HTML:
🚀 Your Role

At Dataroots, our consulting services are focused on designing and delivering AI-powered solutions tailored to optimize business processes. As an Expert Machine Learning Engineer, you'll join a collaborative team focused on building machine learning models that bring production-ready solutions to life.


Your passion for data and its potential will allow you to develop, deploy, and optimize advanced machine learning models. You’ll experiment with the latest approaches to ensure that every client receives best-in-class solutions. Working closely with our Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists, you’ll help execute projects across diverse industries with a comprehensive, quality-driven, end-to-end approach.


As a senior team member, you'll mentor your peers, share your expertise, and keep up with the latest advancements in the field, ensuring continuous growth for yourself and the team.


🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].


💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

  • Master’s or Doctorate in a quantitative field, with mastery in Machine Learning.
  • 4+ years of industry experience in machine learning and big data.
  • In-depth understanding of software design principles.
  • Strong theoretical grounding and practical expertise in general machine learning and deep learning.
  • Strong skills in Python & SQL. Knowledge of an additional programming language is an advantage.
  • Proven track record in deploying ML models and deep expertise in MLOps.
  • Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools like Airflow, Prefect or Dagster.
  • Solid grasp of cloud- & data engineering. Proven experience with cloud services like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • GenAI familiarity is a big advantage.
  • Excited to work with large datasets and be able to tackle problems pragmatically.
  • Excellent communication skills to translate complex solutions into clear client deliverables.
  • Fluency in English. Speaking Dutch/French fluently is a very big advantage.
  • Consulting experience is a big plus.


💰 The Offer

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

  • Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organisation of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
  • A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
  • Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.


📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Title: Service Now Developer
Description:
ServiceNow Developer Opportunity in Brussels ✅




We are currently looking for a ServiceNow Developer to strengthen the Cronos Europa team.

💻 The role is on-site and the main activity consists of:

·      ServiceNow development

·      General administration tasks on ServiceNow

·      Maintenance of the platform

·      Configuration management, incident resolution and request fulfilment (which may lead to some change management)

·      Providing daily support to users of the platform for client users of the platform including a number of teams providing first to third level support and using the platform itself to manage those activities

·      Liaise with business stakeholders

·      Attend meetings with key stakeholders as needed

·      Maintain technical documentation for the platform relating to modifications, changes and integrations with other systems.

·      Participate in the preparation of training and user guides for ServiceNow and contribute to the development of videos for the platform

💼 Nature of tasks

·      Collecting and analysing user needs related to the client service management tool

·      Proposing solutions and making estimations

·      Configuring the tool and updating existing configurations as required

·      Developing and testing new features

·      Providing support to users of the tool

·      Maintaining existing base line

·      Creating new reports according to business needs

·      Configuring and running reports

·      Updating existing reports

✔️ General

·      Highly autonomous

·      Time management and problem management

·      Highly analytical and able to solve problems

·      Analysis and technical skills

·      Very good skills in all the MS office applications

·      Knowledge and experience with ServiceNow

·      ITIL V4 Foundation Certified

·      ServiceNow certification

🔎 Experience

·      Minimum of 3 years of relevant professional experience in the development of ServiceNow

·      Language and communication skills

·      Fluent in both English/French both written and oral

·      Very good communication skills

📩 If you're interested or have any questions, feel free to reach out! ✍ elena.bulea@cronoseuropa.com

Show more

Title: Senior machine learning engineer
Description:
Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Summary

A Senior Machine Learning Engineer for the DSML - COE he would be responsible for designing, developing, maintaining and integrating complex application systems and developing pipelines to answer requirements and demands of the customer. He would provide technical expertise and ensure quality and functionality of application components by overseeing the entire development lifecycle from analysis and design to implementation and support while acting as a mentor to junior developers

Responsibilities


Transforms and develops data science prototypes into ML systems using appropriate datasets and data representation models with moderate complexity.
Researches and implements appropriate ML algorithms and tools that create new systems and processes powered with ML and AI tools and techniques according to business requirements
Designs and implements workflows and analysis tools to streamline the development of new ML models at scale both in batch and streaming mode.
Creates and evolves ML models and software that enable state-of-the-art intelligent systems using best practices in all aspects of engineering and modeling lifecycles.
Extends existing ML libraries and frameworks with the developments in the Data Science and ML field for enterprise use.
Establishes, configures, and supports scalable cloud components that serve prediction model transactions
Integrates data from authoritative internal and external sources to form the foundation of a new Data Product that would deliver insights that supports business outcomes that is necessary for ML systems.
Collaborates with skilled Designers, Architects, Software Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Engineers to deliver ML products and systems for the organization.



Qualifications


3-5+ years of experience in application development, with a proven track record of delivering successful projects
Proficiency in programming languages (Python, Java, C++) and knowledgeable with frameworks like PyTorchm Perl and Tensorflow or related
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP - Preferred) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes
Knowledgeable in machine learning engineering or related tasks, with a track record of developing and deploying models in production environments.
Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail, effective communication, and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical teams.
Understanding of different SDLC methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall)
Ability to design and implement scalable and robust application architectures



Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail, effective communication, and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical teams.


Effective communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to gather requirements and convey technical concepts
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field



Employee Type:

Permanent

UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.
Show more

Title: Freelance AI Security Engineer
Description:
About The Company

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

Our goal? Advance the field of artificial intelligence through collaborative Generative AI projects with domain experts. The Mindrift platform allows experts to dive into a variety of tasks ranging from creating training prompts for AI models to refining AI responses for better relevance.

You'll have the unique opportunity to contribute to AI development anywhere, at anytime. Flexible, community-focused, and innovative—without the need for developer skills.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills.

In this role, you will use your skills to train AI systems to identify and exploit security weaknesses in a controlled and ethical manner.

Your role will involve designing and executing a code injection attack to identify vulnerabilities in an AI-powered computer agent. You'll receive an onboarding session and sample documentation to guide you through the process. In practice, this means working with Docker containers, writing Bash and Python scripts, modifying HTML files, crafting malicious Linux commands, etc..

Requirements

Required Qualifications:


Strong Linux administration and automation skills (Bash, Python, PowerShell).
Experience with web security (HTTP, API security, web scraping, DOM manipulation).
Knowledge of AI security risks, including prompt injection, adversarial attacks, and AI red teaming.
Deep understanding of networking protocols, OS security, and web application security.
Cloud security expertise (AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD security)
Proficiency in English: advanced (C1) or above
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills for reporting findings and collaborating with teams
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Preferred Skills:


Hands-on experience with penetration testing tools (Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nessus, Nmap).
Experience in AI red teaming, adversarial ML, LLM security testing.
Knowledge of OWASP Top Ten, MITRE ATT&CK, and other security frameworks.
Relevant security certifications (OSCP, CEH, CISSP, OSWE, API Security Architect).
Experience in automating security tasks, securing DevOps workflows, and integrating security into CI/CD pipelines



Benefits


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that works with your schedule and commitments
Be part of an exciting AI project
Enrich your portfolio with new experience
Make a tangible impact on the quality of AI
Show more

Title: AI Engineer-Public sector
Description:
At CGI, we’re looking for AI experts who want to make a tangible impact. You’ll lead AI innovation, helping our clients unlock the true value of their data, while working with cutting-edge technologies in a team that values diversity and continuous learning.




Your role in our team

• Lead AI Awareness: Conduct workshops to increase awareness of AI and demonstrate its value for our clients’ businesses.

• Deliver AI Solutions: Use industry-specific methods to solve client challenges, create trusted data sets, and develop data pipelines for AI model training.

• Accelerate Decision-Making: Guide clients toward “speed to trusted action” through AI solutions, discovering AI opportunities via AI Design Sprint workshops, and building AI centers of excellence with a focus on governance and ethical AI.

• Develop & Optimize: Implement AI models and solutions, ensuring ethical and responsible practices, and optimize existing AI systems for better performance.

• Full AI Lifecycle: Be involved in the full AI lifecycle, including data preparation, design, coding, testing, deployment, and support.

• Best Practices & Knowledge Transfer: Create internal guidelines for AI, train internal teams, and contribute to best practices for ethical AI.

• Stay Current: Keep up with the latest AI trends, technologies, and ethical standards, and address biases in AI datasets and models.

• Document & Share: Maintain clear documentation of AI development processes and decisions, ensuring transparency




How you strengthen our team

We need someone who can bring both expertise and a passion for AI:

• Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models and AI solutions.

• Expertise in at least 2 areas: Statistics, Regression, Clustering, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series, Machine Learning Visualization, or Tree Ensembles.

• Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or Java, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.

• Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).

• Strong data management skills, including data preprocessing and analysis.

• Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.

• Commitment to ethical AI practices and staying up-to-date with the field’s advancements.

• Ability to handle multiple projects in a dynamic environment.

• Clear communication and documentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

• Fluency in French or Dutch, with strong English skills.

• A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a related field.

• Medior Profile: 3 to 5 years of experience.

• Senior Profile: More than 5 years of experience, preferably with a public sector background.




A pre-employment screening is part of the application process




Why join CGI?

At CGI, we believe in responsible and human-centric AI. For over 30 years, we’ve helped organizations realize lasting value from their AI investments. We prioritize outcomes that benefit stakeholders and align with societal values. Here’s what we offer:

• A collaborative environment in small, self-managing expert teams.

• The opportunity to drive your career with space for continuous development.

• Work with the latest AI technologies.

• An attractive salary with excellent benefits.

• A permanent contract from the start.

• The opportunity to become a CGI shareholder.




What's in it for you ?




• Direct impact on the future of AI within a leading IT & Business consultancy.

• Work with the latest technologies in a supportive and dynamic environment.

• Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.

• A focus on ethical AI and best practices in the field.

• A diverse and inclusive workplace where your ideas are valued.




Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Director Consulting Services, Public sector, via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com




We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Show more

Title: Software Engineer Python Confirmé H/F
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous,
Ingénieux, votre imagination débordante vient à bout de chaque problématique,
Force de proposition, vous êtes le roi des nouvelles idées pour améliorer les projets,
Bon communiquant, vous êtes adepte des formations, des feedbacks… de tous types d’échanges en fait.


Ensuite quoi

Au sein d'une équipe dynamique, vous serez amené à :


Prendre en compte les spécifications fonctionnelles, analyser, définir le problème et les exigences
Concevoir la solution technique et créer de nouvelles applications (web, services, APIs) en sélectionnant les frameworks appropriés
Estimer la charge de travail
Développer (et faire les tests unitaires) en respectant les bonnes pratiques de code, et documenter
Maintenir les services existants et assurer leur fiabilité
Rapporter l'avancée des tâches et actions de façon hebdomadaire
Assurer et garantir la livraison, et le respect des deadlines
Collaborer et partager son expérience avec d'autres équipes


Profil recherché


Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5) :
Vous justifiez d'une expérience de 2 ans minimum réussie en développement,
Vous disposez d’une maîtrise du langage Python et Flask, et libraries comme Pandas, FastAPI et Dash,
Vous disposez d’une connaissance en développement front-end avec Angular ou React,
Vous disposez d'une connaissance DevOps, incluant compréhension et expérience avec Jenkins, Azure DevOps et Kubernetes,
Vous êtes familier avec les plateformes cloud comme AWS et Azure,
Vous avez l’esprit créatif qui vous permet de proposer des solutions innovantes,
Vous parlez couramment anglais


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay


Show more
HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous,
  • Ingénieux, votre imagination débordante vient à bout de chaque problématique,
  • Force de proposition, vous êtes le roi des nouvelles idées pour améliorer les projets,
  • Bon communiquant, vous êtes adepte des formations, des feedbacks… de tous types d’échanges en fait.

Ensuite quoi

Au sein d'une équipe dynamique, vous serez amené à :

  • Prendre en compte les spécifications fonctionnelles, analyser, définir le problème et les exigences
  • Concevoir la solution technique et créer de nouvelles applications (web, services, APIs) en sélectionnant les frameworks appropriés
  • Estimer la charge de travail
  • Développer (et faire les tests unitaires) en respectant les bonnes pratiques de code, et documenter
  • Maintenir les services existants et assurer leur fiabilité
  • Rapporter l'avancée des tâches et actions de façon hebdomadaire
  • Assurer et garantir la livraison, et le respect des deadlines
  • Collaborer et partager son expérience avec d'autres équipes

Profil recherché

  • Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5) :
  • Vous justifiez d'une expérience de 2 ans minimum réussie en développement,
  • Vous disposez d’une maîtrise du langage Python et Flask, et libraries comme Pandas, FastAPI et Dash,
  • Vous disposez d’une connaissance en développement front-end avec Angular ou React,
  • Vous disposez d'une connaissance DevOps, incluant compréhension et expérience avec Jenkins, Azure DevOps et Kubernetes,
  • Vous êtes familier avec les plateformes cloud comme AWS et Azure,
  • Vous avez l’esprit créatif qui vous permet de proposer des solutions innovantes,
  • Vous parlez couramment anglais

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay

Title: Frontend Developer
Description:
Bolt is het allereerste energieplatform dat het Belgische stroomnet echt duurzaam wil maken. Via Bolt kan je jouw energie rechtstreeks kopen van lokale, groene opwekkers. Bijvoorbeeld van de zonnepanelen van Nico of van de waterkrachtcentrale van Stéphane. Zo weet jij exact waar je energie vandaan komt en waar je geld naartoe gaat.




Waarom doet Bolt dat? De energiemarkt is vandaag niet transparant. Traditionele leveranciers verkopen grijze energie als groene, en helpen ons land niet verduurzamen. Dat wil Bolt veranderen. Ga jij met ons tegen de stroom in?




Wij zijn op zoek naar een Frontend Developer om ons team te versterken.




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden:




Als Medior Frontend Developer creëer je aantrekkelijke en gebruiksvriendelijke features in onze tools. Je vertaalt ontwerpen naar kwalitatieve code en zorgt voor naadloze integraties met zowel onze eigen als externe backend-systemen. Daarnaast werk je ook met ons intern design systeem en help je dit continu te optimaliseren, zodat onze gebruikersinterface functioneel, visueel aantrekkelijk en intuïtief is.




Je komt terecht in ons 8 koppige Product & Service team dat bestaat uit analisten, designers en developers. Dit biedt je de perfecte basis om op terug te vallen en samen met ons te groeien.




Concreter:

Je helpt meebouwen aan een gebruiksvriendelijke website, portaal en designsysteem.
Je werkt zelfstandig volledige frontend-projecten uit.
Je verwerkt feedback na tests en zorgt voor een vlotte opvolging na de go-live.
Je werkt met Git en voert code reviews uit, zodat de code leesbaar en clean blijft.
Je denkt mee over de algemene architectuur van de codebases en fungeert als sparringpartner voor je collega-developers.




Wij bieden jou:




Een boeiende job binnen een groeiende scale-up die positieve impact maakt; met een gevarieerd pakket aan projecten.
Een gedreven en enthousiast team met een positieve mindset. Naast een leuke werksfeer, organiseren we regelmatig afterworks en legendarische teambuildings.
Een werkplek met uitzicht over Brussel, afgewisseld met thuiswerk.
Een marktconform loonpakket/vergoeding.




Wat wij verwachten van jou:




Relevante ervaring: Je hebt 3 jaar ervaring in een gelijkaardige rol.
Expertise: Je hebt HTML en CSS volledig onder de knie, idealiter heb je eerder met SASS gewerkt. Je hebt goede kennis van Next.js, React.js & Typescript en ervaring in het bouwen van schaalbare applicaties. Je begrijpt UX-principes en best practices. Je hebt bovendien ervaring met het integreren van backend systemen & het beheren van (globale) state (bv. Redux). Tot slot ben je vertrouwd met accessibility standaarden & responsive design principes.
Oog voor design: Je hebt oog voor esthetiek en hebt ervaring in het vertalen van designs (Figma) naar pixel-perfect, responsive & functional code.
Proactiviteit en energie: Je voelt verantwoordelijkheid om op een kwalitatieve manier je doelen te behalen en denkt hierbij graag mee aan oplossingen.
Vloeiend Nederlands of Frans en Engels: Je kan je perfect uitdrukken in Nederlands of Frans en spreekt vloeiend Engels.




Hoe solliciteren?




Zie jij het helemaal zitten? Solliciteer via de knop 'Apply' of stuur jouw cv naar talent@boltenergie.be




We bellen je op voor een korte, eerste kennismaking. Nadien nodigen we je uit op kantoor zodat je kennis kan maken met het team. Indien de gesprekken wederzijds positief verlopen, kan je zo snel mogelijk ons team vervoegen.




We are powered by people: Bolt streeft ernaar een inclusieve werkgever te zijn. Alle sollicitanten worden in overweging genomen en krijgen gelijke kansen.

Show more

Hoe solliciteren?


Zie jij het helemaal zitten? Solliciteer via de knop 'Apply' of stuur jouw cv naar talent@boltenergie.be


We bellen je op voor een korte, eerste kennismaking. Nadien nodigen we je uit op kantoor zodat je kennis kan maken met het team. Indien de gesprekken wederzijds positief verlopen, kan je zo snel mogelijk ons team vervoegen.

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We're not just another tech company; we're revolutionizing how millions of people experience their digital experience.

At Nexthink, we’re the pioneers of Digital Employee Experience (DEX) technology. Using a powerful mix of real-time analytics, clever automation, and cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning, we're helping some of the world's biggest companies create digital workplaces that delight their employees at work. Think of us as the architects of the future workplace!

We’re a team of passionate tech enthusiasts, problem solvers, and innovators. At Nexthink, collaboration is key—we encourage curiosity, creativity, and bold thinking. If you love solving real-world challenges and want to be part of an exciting growth journey, you might just be the Nexthinker we’re looking for!

Are you passionate about AI and eager to turn that enthusiasm into real-world impact? Do you want to learn from experienced AI engineers while working on cutting-edge solutions? If so, this is your opportunity to join Nexthink as a Junior AI Engineer!

As a Junior AI Engineer, you’ll be part of a dynamic and collaborative AI team, gaining hands-on experience in building AI solutions deployed on the cloud with an impact on millions of employees worldwide.

This role offers an incredible opportunity to:


Build your expertise in modern AI technologies (LLM, AI agents, …) and frameworks (Python, Langchain, …)
Learn how to develop scalable and resilient software in a cloud production-environment
Contribute to meaningful projects that impact our customers
Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team where questions are encouraged
Grow your career with mentorship from experienced AI and software engineers


If you're ready to start your journey in AI engineering and are excited about learning while doing so, we want to hear from you!

Even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply. We value potential and enthusiasm just as much as experience!

Qualifications

We're not expecting you to know everything! What we're looking for is:


MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, ML or related field
A solid foundation in AI, ML and software engineering
Genuine curiosity about building cloud product at scale and enthusiasm for solving real-world problems
Strong willingness to learn and adapt
Clear communication skills (English) with technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
Typewise (YC S22) is an AI Customer Service Platform for enterprises, designed to elevate and automate customer interactions through custom AI technology tailored to each company’s needs. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies like Unilever and DPD, Typewise reduces effort by up to 50% while enhancing communication quality and customer satisfaction. The platform seamlessly integrates with existing systems such as CRM, ERP, and knowledge bases and enterprise-grade security and privacy protection. We blend leading LLMs with our proprietary AI technology that we develop together with the world-leading ETH Zurich Institute’s AI Center.

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer (full-time, based in Zürich) to join our ML team, which currently comprises three ML Engineers and an MLOps Engineer.

About The Role

You will collaborate with our ML team to research, develop, and deploy cutting-edge NLP algorithms and have a direct impact on our product and business. You will have the opportunity to work directly with our enterprise customers, gaining valuable insights into their unique needs and challenges. By analyzing how their customers and employees interact with Typewise, you will develop tailored techniques and solutions that optimize workflows and measurably boost productivity. Additionally, you will contribute to the continuous improvement of our AI technology, ensuring that we remain at the forefront of innovation in the field of NLP.

Why work for Typewise

We’re a 20+ People, Passionate, International Team Based In Zurich, Amsterdam, Belgrade, And Beyond. Our Company Is Remote First And We Thrive On a Fast-paced, Fast-growing, Flexible Environment With Flat Hierarchy And Individual Ownership


Make a significant impact on the development of a fresh, innovative and growing product with global potential to reach millions of people
Short decision-making processes, lean and agile approach to development
Quarterly physical meetups in awesome locations (paid for by the company)
Flexible hours and calendar year with lean structure
Competitive salaries with stock option possibilities


Your profile


Degree in computer science or comparable experience
2+ years of professional experience building and deploying ML algorithms
Excellent programming skills in Python, including clean/modular and production-ready code
Knowledge of ML techniques, especially NLP, and experience working with LLMs
Understanding of cloud systems (preferably AWS), and experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a plus
Team player, inquisitive personality, and a (good) sense of humor
Positive and open attitude toward clients


Excited? Say hello!

If you want to be part of an innovative and awesome start-up team, and bring your own ideas to life for millions of people, say hello and send us your CV.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (100% remote)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we are at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence with brain-computer interface technologies. Our projects leverage deep learning, generative models, and representation learning to decode and interpret brain activity. With our foundation in both established and cutting-edge AI infrastructure, our mission is to bridge the gap between AI and neuroimaging, driving innovation that’s not only revolutionary but also accessible, transparent, and privacy-focused.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled machine learning engineer to join our dynamic Brain & AI team. This role focuses on developing AI models that enhance our understanding of neural mechanisms and apply this knowledge to real-world applications. You will be instrumental in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in AI and neuroscience, helping to solve some of the most complex and fascinating challenges in the field today.

Responsibilities:


Develop and evaluate scalable deep learning algorithms that are central to our brain decoding initiatives.
Collaborate closely with data scientists to pioneer research in generative modeling and representation learning.
Identify bottlenecks in data processing pipelines and devise effective solutions, improving performance and reliability.
Maintain high standards of code quality, organization, and automatization across all projects.
Adapt machine learning and neural network algorithms to optimize performance in various computing environments, including distributed clusters and GPUs.


Basic Qualifications:


Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in developing machine learning algorithms or infrastructure using Python and PyTorch.
Experience in deep learning techniques such as supervised, semi-supervised, self-supervised learning, and/or generative modeling.
Proficient in managing unstructured datasets with strong analytic skills.
Demonstrated project management and organizational skills.
Proven ability to support and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field.
Familiarity with deep learning libraries such as Huggingface, Transformers, Accelerator and Diffuser.
Hands-on experience in training and fine-tuning generative models like diffusion models or large language models such as GPTs and LLAMAs.
Experience with data and model visualization tools.
Show more
HTML:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we are at the forefront of integrating artificial intelligence with brain-computer interface technologies. Our projects leverage deep learning, generative models, and representation learning to decode and interpret brain activity. With our foundation in both established and cutting-edge AI infrastructure, our mission is to bridge the gap between AI and neuroimaging, driving innovation that’s not only revolutionary but also accessible, transparent, and privacy-focused.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled machine learning engineer to join our dynamic Brain & AI team. This role focuses on developing AI models that enhance our understanding of neural mechanisms and apply this knowledge to real-world applications. You will be instrumental in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in AI and neuroscience, helping to solve some of the most complex and fascinating challenges in the field today.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and evaluate scalable deep learning algorithms that are central to our brain decoding initiatives.
  • Collaborate closely with data scientists to pioneer research in generative modeling and representation learning.
  • Identify bottlenecks in data processing pipelines and devise effective solutions, improving performance and reliability.
  • Maintain high standards of code quality, organization, and automatization across all projects.
  • Adapt machine learning and neural network algorithms to optimize performance in various computing environments, including distributed clusters and GPUs.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in developing machine learning algorithms or infrastructure using Python and PyTorch.
  • Experience in deep learning techniques such as supervised, semi-supervised, self-supervised learning, and/or generative modeling.
  • Proficient in managing unstructured datasets with strong analytic skills.
  • Demonstrated project management and organizational skills.
  • Proven ability to support and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field.
  • Familiarity with deep learning libraries such as Huggingface, Transformers, Accelerator and Diffuser.
  • Hands-on experience in training and fine-tuning generative models like diffusion models or large language models such as GPTs and LLAMAs.
  • Experience with data and model visualization tools.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Tech)
HTML:
Job Description

A Pagaleve é uma empresa do setor de “Buy Now Pay Later”, uma startup fintech inovadora e uma das primeiras empresas a oferecer pagamento parcelado no PIX, sem juros, e sem a necessidade de usar cartão de crédito. Temos como objetivo oferecer a lojistas um novo método de pagamento, para aumentar suas vendas de um jeito simples, descomplicado e ágil, mas também temos como objetivo oferecer às pessoas a oportunidade de comprar aquilo que desejam, sem se comprometerem com os altos juros do cartão de crédito.

Responsibilities and assignments

Venha fazer parte do time de Tecnologia e crescer exponencialmente junto com a gente!

Responsabilidades e Atribuições

  • Apoiar os times Seniors na definição e implementação da estratégia de ciência de dados para o negócio;
  • Usar big data para desenvolver modelos de Inteligência Artificial;
  • Pesquisar e explorar novas metodologias para serem utilizada nos modelos de Inteligência Artificial;
  • Fornecer insights para os negócios (Crédito, Produto, Operações, Finanças);
  • Trabalhar em colaboração com as equipes de engenharia de dados e plataformas para melhorar e aprimorar ainda mais a plataforma de dados da Pagaleve;
  • Trabalhar em colaboração com as equipes de Analytics para melhorar e aprimorar as estratégias de dados aplicadas na Pagaleve;

Requirements And Qualifications

Requisitos e Qualificações:

  • Experiência em linguagem de programação de Dados (Python, SQL);
  • Conhecimento em modelagem estatística;
  • Análise estatística e machine learning;
  • Habilidade de comunicação com times técnicos e não-técnicos;
  • Inglês básico.

﻿

Diferenciais

  • Conhecimento em plataformas de Big Data (Spark, Snowflake, AWS Glue AWS EMR,);
  • Conhecimento em pacotes de funções de Machine Learning e visualizações(Scikit, AWS Personalize,Tensorflow, Pycaret, seaborn, etc);
  • Conhecimento em AWS Sagemaker ou plataformas de machine learning semelhantes;
  • Conhecimento em Cloud (AWS e/ou GCP);
  • Conhecimento em ferramentas de gerenciamento de código (Git);
  • Conhecimento básico em engenharia de dados;
  • Inglês avançado.

Additional information

  • Modelo de contratação PJ;
  • Remuneração competitiva;
  • Pensando no seu bem-estar e no de toda sua família, oferecemos plano de saúde com cobertura 100% do titular e 75% para o primeiro dependente;
  • Convênio Odontológico;
  • Cupom de desconto mensal nas lojas que aceitam o Pix Parcelado;
  • Day off no dia do seu aniversário;
  • Ajuda de custo (cartão caju);
  • Modelo flexível de trabalho, pois atuamos no modelo híbrido (presencial 1 - 2x por semana), escritório na Vila Olímpia, SP.

Process stages

  • Step 1: Registration1Registration
  • Step 2: Entrevista com RH2Entrevista com RH
  • Step 3: Entrevista com o Gestor3Entrevista com o Gestor
  • Step 4: Hiring4Hiring

Conheça Mais Sobre a Pagaleve

Agradecemos seu interesse em fazer parte da Pagaleve.

Nossos processos seletivos estão acontecendo de maneira remota.

Torcemos para que você esteja bem, com saúde e seguro.

A Pagaleve é uma empresa do setor de “Buy

Now Pay Later”. Somos uma das primeiras empresas a oferecer pagamento parcelado

no PIX, sem juros, e sem a necessidade de usar cartão de crédito. Temos como

objetivo oferecer aos lojistas um novo método de pagamento, para aumentar suas

vendas de um jeito simples, descomplicado e ágil, mas também temos como

objetivo oferecer às pessoas a oportunidade de comprar aquilo que desejam, sem

se comprometerem com os altos juros do cartão de crédito.

Propósito

Democratizar o acesso ao parcelamento e pagamentos, libertando consumidores e varejistas do sistema

financeiro tradicional, com tecnologia inovadora e uma relação financeira leve e saudável.

Visão

Ser o sinônimo de parcelamento para milhões de consumidores e o parceiro preferido dos varejistas na América Latina.

Title: Fellow Data Scientist
Description:
Sobre nós  

Nossa história começou em 2001, com um pequeno escritório de agentes autônomos de investimentos em Porto Alegre e hoje somos um grande ecossistema de serviços financeiros, mídia e educação.  

Chegamos até aqui com a dedicação de equipes talentosas que tiveram garra, determinação, resiliência e, acima de tudo, ambição de fazer o impossível.

Nossos valores


Foco no cliente: Somos obstinados em superar as expectativas dos nossos clientes.
Sonho grande: Miramos no impossível, acreditamos que ele pode se tornar realidade, e chegamos lá juntos.
Mente aberta: Nossa abertura para o novo e nossa capacidade de adaptação são o que nos fazem evoluir e melhorar sempre.
Espírito empreendedor: Construímos o futuro com nossas próprias mãos com o mais alto nível de comprometimento e sentimento de dono.


Se identificou com a nossa cultura? Então embarque nesse foguete! 🚀

>> Sobre a vaga

Como cientista de dados, com apoio do centro de excelência de Data Science & Machine Learning, essa pessoa será responsável por construir produtos de dados para otimizar tomada de decisão na companhia, como modelos de classificação, otimização de heurísticas e análises estatísticas.

Principais Responsabilidades


Responsável por análises e soluções estatísticos e de machine learning, entendendo os fenômenos para transcrever em dados e variáveis, e desenvolvendo modelos preditivos e não supervisionados..


>> Para esta vaga, é essencial:


Conhecimento em Python.
Experiência com modelos de Machine Learning e modelos estatísticos.


>> Você pode ter destaque se:


Pragmático, equilibrando qualidade e simplicidade, garantindo que estamos resolvendo problemas práticos e reais.
Se adaptar às mudanças e adversidades.
Trabalhar bem em equipe, colaborando com time de entrega e capítulo de Data Science, aproveitando conhecimento e capacidade das pessoas em diferentes áreas da XP.
Mostrar proatividade, ownership e capacidade de buscar conhecimento.
Conhecimento em PySpark.


Saiba mais sobre nosso dia a dia no Instagram CLICANDO AQUI

Confira nossas avaliações no Glassdoor CLICANDO AQUI

“Se te oferecem um lugar em um foguete, não pergunte qual é o assento, apenas embarque.”

Sheryl Sandberg

Benefícios Que Oferecemos


Saúde e bem-estar: plano de saúde, plano odontológico, Gympass , Zenklub , VA, VR, New Value , seguro de vida.
Maternidade e Paternidade: auxílio creche para pais e mães, licença maternidade de 6 meses, licença paternidade de 20 dias.
Só na XP Inc.: assessoria de investimento e acesso a fundos de investimentos exclusivos.


Jornada de trabalho com flexibilidade

O nosso modelo de trabalho varia de acordo com a função: presencial para frentes de negócio e híbrido para as demais equipes. É importante ressaltar que todos os colaboradores precisam morar na localidade da vaga (nossa sede está localizada na cidade de São Paulo e é onde temos o maior número de posições), já que temos atividades que exigem a presença física para promover a colaboração e os rituais da nossa cultura. Esses encontros são organizados de acordo com as orientações dos líderes e as particularidades de cada rotina, para que nossos colaboradores possam exercer suas jornadas de trabalho com liberdade e autonomia .
Show more
